module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AccessRules

-- | Describes the anonymous access permissions for an Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket and its objects.
--   
--   For more information about bucket access permissions, see
--   <a>Understanding bucket permissions in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessRules</a> smart constructor.
data AccessRules
AccessRules' :: Maybe AccessType -> Maybe Bool -> AccessRules

-- | Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:getObject:AccessRules'] :: AccessRules -> Maybe AccessType

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL)
--   permissions that are applied to individual objects override the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> option that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
[$sel:allowPublicOverrides:AccessRules'] :: AccessRules -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessRules</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:getObject:AccessRules'</a>, <a>accessRules_getObject</a> -
--   Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowPublicOverrides:AccessRules'</a>,
--   <a>accessRules_allowPublicOverrides</a> - A Boolean value that
--   indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are
--   applied to individual objects override the <tt>getObject</tt> option
--   that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
newAccessRules :: AccessRules

-- | Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
accessRules_getObject :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe AccessType)

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL)
--   permissions that are applied to individual objects override the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> option that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
accessRules_allowPublicOverrides :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AccessRules.AccessRules
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AccessRules.AccessRules

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AddOn

-- | Describes an add-on that is enabled for an Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddOn</a> smart constructor.
data AddOn
AddOn' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AddOn

-- | The status of the add-on.
[$sel:status:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
[$sel:nextSnapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.

--

--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.

newAddOn :: AddOn

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | Describes a request to enable or modify the automatic snapshot add-on
--   for an Amazon Lightsail instance or disk.
--   
--   When you modify the automatic snapshot time for a resource, it is
--   typically effective immediately except under the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has been created for the current day, and
--   you change the snapshot time to a later time of day, then the new
--   snapshot time will be effective the following day. This ensures that
--   two snapshots are not created for the current day.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has not yet been created for the current
--   day, and you change the snapshot time to an earlier time of day, then
--   the new snapshot time will be effective the following day and a
--   snapshot is automatically created at the previously set time for the
--   current day. This ensures that a snapshot is created for the current
--   day.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has not yet been created for the current
--   day, and you change the snapshot time to a time that is within 30
--   minutes from your current time, then the new snapshot time will be
--   effective the following day and a snapshot is automatically created at
--   the previously set time for the current day. This ensures that a
--   snapshot is created for the current day, because 30 minutes is
--   required between your current time and the new snapshot time that you
--   specify.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot is scheduled to be created within 30
--   minutes from your current time and you change the snapshot time, then
--   the new snapshot time will be effective the following day and a
--   snapshot is automatically created at the previously set time for the
--   current day. This ensures that a snapshot is created for the current
--   day, because 30 minutes is required between your current time and the
--   new snapshot time that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoSnapshotAddOnRequest</a> smart constructor.
data AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest
AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest' :: Maybe Text -> AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in an hourly increment.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The snapshot will be automatically created between the time
--   specified and up to 45 minutes after.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest'] :: AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotAddOnRequest_snapshotTimeOfDay</a> - The daily time
--   when an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in an hourly increment.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The snapshot will be automatically created between the time
--   specified and up to 45 minutes after.</li>
--   </ul>
newAutoSnapshotAddOnRequest :: AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in an hourly increment.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The snapshot will be automatically created between the time
--   specified and up to 45 minutes after.</li>
--   </ul>
autoSnapshotAddOnRequest_snapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest.AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest.AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AddOnRequest

-- | Describes a request to enable, modify, or disable an add-on for an
--   Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   An additional cost may be associated with enabling add-ons. For more
--   information, see the <a>Lightsail pricing page</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddOnRequest</a> smart constructor.
data AddOnRequest
AddOnRequest' :: Maybe AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest -> AddOnType -> AddOnRequest

--   modifying the automatic snapshot add-on.

--   represents additional parameters when enabling or modifying the
--   automatic snapshot add-on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOnType:AddOnRequest'</a>, <a>addOnRequest_addOnType</a> -
--   The add-on type.

--   modifying the automatic snapshot add-on.

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AutoSnapshotDetails

-- | Describes an automatic snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoSnapshotDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AutoSnapshotDetails
AutoSnapshotDetails' :: Maybe AutoSnapshotStatus -> Maybe [AttachedDisk] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> AutoSnapshotDetails

-- | The status of the automatic snapshot.
[$sel:status:AutoSnapshotDetails'] :: AutoSnapshotDetails -> Maybe AutoSnapshotStatus

-- | An array of objects that describe the block storage disks attached to
--   the instance when the automatic snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromAttachedDisks:AutoSnapshotDetails'] :: AutoSnapshotDetails -> Maybe [AttachedDisk]

-- | The timestamp when the automatic snapshot was created.
[$sel:createdAt:AutoSnapshotDetails'] :: AutoSnapshotDetails -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.
[$sel:date:AutoSnapshotDetails'] :: AutoSnapshotDetails -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoSnapshotDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotDetails_status</a> - The status of the automatic
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAttachedDisks:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotDetails_fromAttachedDisks</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the block storage disks attached to the instance when
--   the automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotDetails_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>, <a>autoSnapshotDetails_date</a>
--   - The date of the automatic snapshot in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.
newAutoSnapshotDetails :: AutoSnapshotDetails

-- | The status of the automatic snapshot.
autoSnapshotDetails_status :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe AutoSnapshotStatus)

-- | An array of objects that describe the block storage disks attached to
--   the instance when the automatic snapshot was created.
autoSnapshotDetails_fromAttachedDisks :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe [AttachedDisk])

-- | The timestamp when the automatic snapshot was created.
autoSnapshotDetails_createdAt :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.
autoSnapshotDetails_date :: Lens' AutoSnapshotDetails (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.AutoSnapshotDetails.AutoSnapshotDetails

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketBundle

-- | Describes the specifications of a bundle that can be applied to an
--   Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketBundle</a> smart constructor.
data BucketBundle
BucketBundle' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> BucketBundle

-- | The storage size of the bundle, in GB.
[$sel:storagePerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The monthly network transfer quota of the bundle.
[$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The ID of the bundle.
[$sel:bundleId:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the bundle.
[$sel:name:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly price of the bundle, in US dollars.
[$sel:price:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Double

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active. Use for a new or existing
--   bucket.
[$sel:isActive:BucketBundle'] :: BucketBundle -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketBundle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:storagePerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>bucketBundle_storagePerMonthInGb</a> - The storage size of the
--   bundle, in GB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>bucketBundle_transferPerMonthInGb</a> - The monthly network
--   transfer quota of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_bundleId</a> - The
--   ID of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_name</a> - The name of
--   the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_price</a> - The
--   monthly price of the bundle, in US dollars.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_isActive</a> -
--   Indicates whether the bundle is active. Use for a new or existing
--   bucket.
newBucketBundle :: BucketBundle

-- | The storage size of the bundle, in GB.
bucketBundle_storagePerMonthInGb :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The monthly network transfer quota of the bundle.
bucketBundle_transferPerMonthInGb :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The ID of the bundle.
bucketBundle_bundleId :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the bundle.
bucketBundle_name :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price of the bundle, in US dollars.
bucketBundle_price :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Double)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active. Use for a new or existing
--   bucket.
bucketBundle_isActive :: Lens' BucketBundle (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketBundle.BucketBundle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketBundle.BucketBundle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketBundle.BucketBundle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketBundle.BucketBundle

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState

-- | Describes the state of an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketState</a> smart constructor.
data BucketState
BucketState' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketState

-- | The state code of the bucket.
--   
--   The following codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The bucket is in a running state.</li>
--   <li><tt>Unknown</tt> - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out.
--   You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:BucketState'] :: BucketState -> Maybe Text

-- | A message that describes the state of the bucket.
[$sel:message:BucketState'] :: BucketState -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketState</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:BucketState'</a>, <a>bucketState_code</a> - The state
--   code of the bucket.
--   
--   The following codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The bucket is in a running state.</li>
--   <li><tt>Unknown</tt> - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out.
--   You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:BucketState'</a>, <a>bucketState_message</a> - A
--   message that describes the state of the bucket.
newBucketState :: BucketState

-- | The state code of the bucket.
--   
--   The following codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The bucket is in a running state.</li>
--   <li><tt>Unknown</tt> - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out.
--   You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.</li>
--   </ul>
bucketState_code :: Lens' BucketState (Maybe Text)

-- | A message that describes the state of the bucket.
bucketState_message :: Lens' BucketState (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.BucketState.BucketState


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior

-- | Describes the default cache behavior of an Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data CacheBehavior
CacheBehavior' :: Maybe BehaviorEnum -> CacheBehavior

-- | The cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   The following cache behaviors can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This option is best for static sites. When
--   specified, your distribution caches and serves your entire website as
--   static content. This behavior is ideal for websites with static
--   content that doesn't change depending on who views it, or for websites
--   that don't use cookies, headers, or query strings to personalize
--   content.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This option is best for sites that
--   serve a mix of static and dynamic content. When specified, your
--   distribution caches and serve only the content that is specified in
--   the distribution's <tt>CacheBehaviorPerPath</tt> parameter. This
--   behavior is ideal for websites or web applications that use cookies,
--   headers, and query strings to personalize content for individual
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:behavior:CacheBehavior'] :: CacheBehavior -> Maybe BehaviorEnum

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheBehavior</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:CacheBehavior'</a>, <a>cacheBehavior_behavior</a> -
--   The cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   The following cache behaviors can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This option is best for static sites. When
--   specified, your distribution caches and serves your entire website as
--   static content. This behavior is ideal for websites with static
--   content that doesn't change depending on who views it, or for websites
--   that don't use cookies, headers, or query strings to personalize
--   content.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This option is best for sites that
--   serve a mix of static and dynamic content. When specified, your
--   distribution caches and serve only the content that is specified in
--   the distribution's <tt>CacheBehaviorPerPath</tt> parameter. This
--   behavior is ideal for websites or web applications that use cookies,
--   headers, and query strings to personalize content for individual
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
newCacheBehavior :: CacheBehavior

-- | The cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   The following cache behaviors can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This option is best for static sites. When
--   specified, your distribution caches and serves your entire website as
--   static content. This behavior is ideal for websites with static
--   content that doesn't change depending on who views it, or for websites
--   that don't use cookies, headers, or query strings to personalize
--   content.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This option is best for sites that
--   serve a mix of static and dynamic content. When specified, your
--   distribution caches and serve only the content that is specified in
--   the distribution's <tt>CacheBehaviorPerPath</tt> parameter. This
--   behavior is ideal for websites or web applications that use cookies,
--   headers, and query strings to personalize content for individual
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehavior_behavior :: Lens' CacheBehavior (Maybe BehaviorEnum)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehavior.CacheBehavior


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath

-- | Describes the per-path cache behavior of an Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   A per-path cache behavior is used to override, or add an exception to,
--   the default cache behavior of a distribution. For example, if the
--   <tt>cacheBehavior</tt> is set to <tt>cache</tt>, then a per-path cache
--   behavior can be used to specify a directory, file, or file type that
--   your distribution will cache. Alternately, if the distribution's
--   <tt>cacheBehavior</tt> is <tt>dont-cache</tt>, then a per-path cache
--   behavior can be used to specify a directory, file, or file type that
--   your distribution will not cache.
--   
--   if the cacheBehavior's behavior is set to 'cache', then
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheBehaviorPerPath</a> smart constructor.
data CacheBehaviorPerPath
CacheBehaviorPerPath' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorEnum -> CacheBehaviorPerPath

-- | The path to a directory or file to cached, or not cache. Use an
--   asterisk symbol to specify wildcard directories
--   (<tt>path/to/assets/*</tt>), and file types (<tt>*.html, *jpg,
--   *js</tt>). Directories and file paths are case-sensitive.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache all files in the document root of
--   an Apache web server running on a Lightsail
--   instance.<pre>var/www/html/</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following file to cache only the index page in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/index.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .html files in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/*.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .jpg, .png, and .gif files
--   in the images sub-directory of the document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/*.jpg</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.png</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.gif</pre>Specify
--   the following to cache all files in the images sub-directory of the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:path:CacheBehaviorPerPath'] :: CacheBehaviorPerPath -> Maybe Text

-- | The cache behavior for the specified path.
--   
--   You can specify one of the following per-path cache behaviors:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This behavior caches the specified
--   path.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This behavior doesn't cache the
--   specified path.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:behavior:CacheBehaviorPerPath'] :: CacheBehaviorPerPath -> Maybe BehaviorEnum

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheBehaviorPerPath</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:CacheBehaviorPerPath'</a>,
--   <a>cacheBehaviorPerPath_path</a> - The path to a directory or file to
--   cached, or not cache. Use an asterisk symbol to specify wildcard
--   directories (<tt>path/to/assets/*</tt>), and file types (<tt>*.html,
--   *jpg, *js</tt>). Directories and file paths are case-sensitive.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache all files in the document root of
--   an Apache web server running on a Lightsail
--   instance.<pre>var/www/html/</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following file to cache only the index page in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/index.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .html files in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/*.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .jpg, .png, and .gif files
--   in the images sub-directory of the document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/*.jpg</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.png</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.gif</pre>Specify
--   the following to cache all files in the images sub-directory of the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:CacheBehaviorPerPath'</a>,
--   <a>cacheBehaviorPerPath_behavior</a> - The cache behavior for the
--   specified path.
--   
--   You can specify one of the following per-path cache behaviors:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This behavior caches the specified
--   path.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This behavior doesn't cache the
--   specified path.</li>
--   </ul>
newCacheBehaviorPerPath :: CacheBehaviorPerPath

-- | The path to a directory or file to cached, or not cache. Use an
--   asterisk symbol to specify wildcard directories
--   (<tt>path/to/assets/*</tt>), and file types (<tt>*.html, *jpg,
--   *js</tt>). Directories and file paths are case-sensitive.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache all files in the document root of
--   an Apache web server running on a Lightsail
--   instance.<pre>var/www/html/</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following file to cache only the index page in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/index.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .html files in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/*.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .jpg, .png, and .gif files
--   in the images sub-directory of the document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/*.jpg</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.png</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.gif</pre>Specify
--   the following to cache all files in the images sub-directory of the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehaviorPerPath_path :: Lens' CacheBehaviorPerPath (Maybe Text)

-- | The cache behavior for the specified path.
--   
--   You can specify one of the following per-path cache behaviors:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This behavior caches the specified
--   path.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This behavior doesn't cache the
--   specified path.</li>
--   </ul>
cacheBehaviorPerPath_behavior :: Lens' CacheBehaviorPerPath (Maybe BehaviorEnum)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CacheBehaviorPerPath.CacheBehaviorPerPath

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo

-- | Describes the source of a CloudFormation stack record (i.e., the
--   export snapshot record).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo
CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo' :: Maybe CloudFormationStackRecordSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ExportSnapshotRecord</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'] :: CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe CloudFormationStackRecordSourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the export snapshot record.
[$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'] :: CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the record.
[$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'] :: CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ExportSnapshotRecord</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the export snapshot record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_name</a> - The name of the
--   record.
newCloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo :: CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ExportSnapshotRecord</tt>).
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_resourceType :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe CloudFormationStackRecordSourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the export snapshot record.
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_arn :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the record.
cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_name :: Lens' CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerImage

-- | Describes a container image that is registered to an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerImage</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerImage
ContainerImage' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> ContainerImage

-- | The name of the container image.
[$sel:image:ContainerImage'] :: ContainerImage -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the container image was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContainerImage'] :: ContainerImage -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The digest of the container image.
[$sel:digest:ContainerImage'] :: ContainerImage -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerImage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   name of the container image.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerImage'</a>, <a>containerImage_createdAt</a>
--   - The timestamp when the container image was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:digest:ContainerImage'</a>, <a>containerImage_digest</a> - The
--   digest of the container image.
newContainerImage :: ContainerImage

-- | The name of the container image.

-- | The timestamp when the container image was created.

-- | The digest of the container image.

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | Describes the health check configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value
--   is <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:healthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The path on the container on which to perform the health check. The
--   default value is <tt>/</tt>.
[$sel:path:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a
--   container. You can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and
--   <tt>499</tt>. You can specify multiple values (for example,
--   <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of values (for example,
--   <tt>200-299</tt>).
[$sel:successCodes:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
[$sel:intervalSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:timeoutSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
[$sel:unhealthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'] :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_healthyThreshold</a> - The number
--   of consecutive health checks successes required before moving the
--   container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_path</a> - The path on the
--   container on which to perform the health check. The default value is
--   <tt>/</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:successCodes:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_successCodes</a> - The HTTP codes
--   to use when checking for a successful response from a container. You
--   can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and <tt>499</tt>. You can
--   specify multiple values (for example, <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of
--   values (for example, <tt>200-299</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:intervalSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_intervalSeconds</a> - The
--   approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:timeoutSeconds:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_timeoutSeconds</a> - The amount
--   of time, in seconds, during which no response means a failed health
--   check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unhealthyThreshold:ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_unhealthyThreshold</a> - The
--   number of consecutive health check failures required before moving the
--   container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
newContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig :: ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The number of consecutive health checks successes required before
--   moving the container to the <tt>Healthy</tt> state. The default value
--   is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_healthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The path on the container on which to perform the health check. The
--   default value is <tt>/</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_path :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The HTTP codes to use when checking for a successful response from a
--   container. You can specify values between <tt>200</tt> and
--   <tt>499</tt>. You can specify multiple values (for example,
--   <tt>200,202</tt>) or a range of values (for example,
--   <tt>200-299</tt>).
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_successCodes :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Text)

-- | The approximate interval, in seconds, between health checks of an
--   individual container. You can specify between 5 and 300 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>5</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_intervalSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The amount of time, in seconds, during which no response means a
--   failed health check. You can specify between 2 and 60 seconds. The
--   default value is <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_timeoutSeconds :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)

-- | The number of consecutive health check failures required before moving
--   the container to the <tt>Unhealthy</tt> state. The default value is
--   <tt>2</tt>.
containerServiceHealthCheckConfig_unhealthyThreshold :: Lens' ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig.ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | Describes the public endpoint configuration of a deployment of an
--   Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceEndpoint</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceEndpoint
ContainerServiceEndpoint' :: Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
[$sel:healthCheck:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The name of the container entry of the deployment that the endpoint
--   configuration applies to.
[$sel:containerName:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe Text

-- | The port of the specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
[$sel:containerPort:ContainerServiceEndpoint'] :: ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceEndpoint</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_healthCheck</a> - An object that describes
--   the health check configuration of the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerName:ContainerServiceEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_containerName</a> - The name of the
--   container entry of the deployment that the endpoint configuration
--   applies to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerPort:ContainerServiceEndpoint'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceEndpoint_containerPort</a> - The port of the
--   specified container to which traffic is forwarded to.
newContainerServiceEndpoint :: ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.

--   configuration applies to.

containerServiceEndpoint_containerPort :: Lens' ContainerServiceEndpoint (Maybe Int)

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower

-- | Describes the powers that can be specified for an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServicePower</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServicePower
ContainerServicePower' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> ContainerServicePower

-- | The ID of the power (e.g., <tt>nano-1</tt>).
[$sel:powerId:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the power.
[$sel:cpuCount:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | The friendly name of the power (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
[$sel:name:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly price of the power in USD.
[$sel:price:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the power is active and can be
--   specified for container services.
[$sel:isActive:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Bool

-- | The amount of RAM (in GB) of the power.
[$sel:ramSizeInGb:ContainerServicePower'] :: ContainerServicePower -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServicePower</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:powerId:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_powerId</a> - The ID of the power (e.g.,
--   <tt>nano-1</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuCount:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_cpuCount</a> - The number of vCPUs included
--   in the power.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_name</a> - The friendly name of the power
--   (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_price</a> - The monthly price of the power in
--   USD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_isActive</a> - A Boolean value indicating
--   whether the power is active and can be specified for container
--   services.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramSizeInGb:ContainerServicePower'</a>,
--   <a>containerServicePower_ramSizeInGb</a> - The amount of RAM (in GB)
--   of the power.
newContainerServicePower :: ContainerServicePower

-- | The ID of the power (e.g., <tt>nano-1</tt>).
containerServicePower_powerId :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the power.
containerServicePower_cpuCount :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | The friendly name of the power (e.g., <tt>nano</tt>).
containerServicePower_name :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price of the power in USD.
containerServicePower_price :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the power is active and can be
--   specified for container services.
containerServicePower_isActive :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of RAM (in GB) of the power.
containerServicePower_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' ContainerServicePower (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServicePower.ContainerServicePower

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceProtocol.ContainerServiceProtocol


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container

-- | Describes the settings of a container that will be launched, or that
--   is launched, to an Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainer</a> smart constructor.
data Container
Container' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe (HashMap Text ContainerServiceProtocol) -> Container

-- | The name of the image used for the container.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
[$sel:image:Container'] :: Container -> Maybe Text

-- | The launch command for the container.
[$sel:command:Container'] :: Container -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The environment variables of the container.
[$sel:environment:Container'] :: Container -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The open firewall ports of the container.
[$sel:ports:Container'] :: Container -> Maybe (HashMap Text ContainerServiceProtocol)

-- | Create a value of <a>Container</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:Container'</a>, <a>container_image</a> - The name of the
--   image used for the container.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:command:Container'</a>, <a>container_command</a> - The launch
--   command for the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:environment:Container'</a>, <a>container_environment</a> - The
--   environment variables of the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ports:Container'</a>, <a>container_ports</a> - The open
--   firewall ports of the container.
newContainer :: Container

-- | The name of the image used for the container.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
container_image :: Lens' Container (Maybe Text)

-- | The launch command for the container.
container_command :: Lens' Container (Maybe [Text])

-- | The environment variables of the container.
container_environment :: Lens' Container (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The open firewall ports of the container.
container_ports :: Lens' Container (Maybe (HashMap Text ContainerServiceProtocol))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Container.Container


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | Describes a container deployment configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the settings, such as the ports and launch
--   command, of containers that are deployed to your container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceDeployment</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceDeployment
ContainerServiceDeployment' :: Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState -> Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
[$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint

-- | The timestamp when the deployment was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
[$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container)

-- | The version number of the deployment.
[$sel:version:ContainerServiceDeployment'] :: ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceDeployment</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_state</a> - The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint</a> - An object that
--   describes the endpoint of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   deployment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_containers</a> - An object that
--   describes the configuration for the containers of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_version</a> - The version number of the
--   deployment.
newContainerServiceDeployment :: ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceDeployment_state :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState)

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint)

-- | The timestamp when the deployment was created.
containerServiceDeployment_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_containers :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe (HashMap Text Container))

-- | The version number of the deployment.
containerServiceDeployment_version :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeployment (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeployment.ContainerServiceDeployment


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | Describes the login information for the container image registry of an
--   Amazon Lightsail account.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceRegistryLogin</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
ContainerServiceRegistryLogin' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | The timestamp of when the container image registry username and
--   password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
[$sel:expiresAt:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The container service registry username to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account.
[$sel:username:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | The container service registry password to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account
[$sel:password:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | The address to use to push container images to the container image
--   registry of a Lightsail account.
[$sel:registry:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'] :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceRegistryLogin</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiresAt:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_expiresAt</a> - The timestamp of when
--   the container image registry username and password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_username</a> - The container service
--   registry username to use to push container images to the container
--   image registry of a Lightsail account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_password</a> - The container service
--   registry password to use to push container images to the container
--   image registry of a Lightsail account
--   
--   <a>$sel:registry:ContainerServiceRegistryLogin'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceRegistryLogin_registry</a> - The address to use to
--   push container images to the container image registry of a Lightsail
--   account.
newContainerServiceRegistryLogin :: ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

-- | The timestamp of when the container image registry username and
--   password expire.
--   
--   The log in credentials expire 12 hours after they are created, at
--   which point you will need to create a new set of log in credentials
--   using the <tt>CreateContainerServiceRegistryLogin</tt> action.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_expiresAt :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The container service registry username to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_username :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The container service registry password to use to push container
--   images to the container image registry of a Lightsail account
containerServiceRegistryLogin_password :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)

-- | The address to use to push container images to the container image
--   registry of a Lightsail account.
containerServiceRegistryLogin_registry :: Lens' ContainerServiceRegistryLogin (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin.ContainerServiceRegistryLogin

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | Describes the current state of a container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceStateDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceStateDetail
ContainerServiceStateDetail' :: Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode -> Maybe Text -> ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | The state code of the container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:code:ContainerServiceStateDetail'] :: ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode

-- | A message that provides more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
[$sel:message:ContainerServiceStateDetail'] :: ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceStateDetail</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ContainerServiceStateDetail'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceStateDetail_code</a> - The state code of the
--   container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ContainerServiceStateDetail'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceStateDetail_message</a> - A message that provides
--   more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
newContainerServiceStateDetail :: ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | The state code of the container service.
--   
--   The following state codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>DEPLOYING</tt> or <tt>UPDATING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CREATING_SYSTEM_RESOURCES</tt> - The system
--   resources for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>CREATING_NETWORK_INFRASTRUCTURE</tt> - The
--   network infrastructure for your container service are being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_CERTIFICATE</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate for your container service is being
--   created.</li><li><tt>PROVISIONING_SERVICE</tt> - Your container
--   service is being provisioned.</li><li><tt>CREATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt> -
--   Your deployment is being created on your container
--   service.</li><li><tt>EVALUATING_HEALTH_CHECK</tt> - The health of your
--   deployment is being evaluated.</li><li><tt>ACTIVATING_DEPLOYMENT</tt>
--   - Your deployment is being activated.</li></ul></li>
--   <li>The following state codes are possible if your container service
--   is in a <tt>PENDING</tt>
--   state:<ul><li><tt>CERTIFICATE_LIMIT_EXCEEDED</tt> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate required for your container service exceeds the maximum
--   number of certificates allowed for your
--   account.</li><li><tt>UNKNOWN_ERROR</tt> - An error was experienced
--   when your container service was being created.</li></ul></li>
--   </ul>
containerServiceStateDetail_code :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetailCode)

-- | A message that provides more information for the state code.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
containerServiceStateDetail_message :: Lens' ContainerServiceStateDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceStateDetail.ContainerServiceStateDetail

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo

-- | Describes a disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDiskInfo</a> smart constructor.
data DiskInfo
DiskInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> DiskInfo

-- | The disk path.
[$sel:path:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The disk name.
[$sel:name:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
[$sel:sizeInGb:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Int

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
[$sel:isSystemDisk:DiskInfo'] :: DiskInfo -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>DiskInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_path</a> - The disk path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_name</a> - The disk name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_sizeInGb</a> - The size of
--   the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSystemDisk:DiskInfo'</a>, <a>diskInfo_isSystemDisk</a> - A
--   Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
newDiskInfo :: DiskInfo

-- | The disk path.
diskInfo_path :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk name.
diskInfo_name :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
diskInfo_sizeInGb :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
diskInfo_isSystemDisk :: Lens' DiskInfo (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskInfo.DiskInfo

-- | The original disk path exposed to the instance (for example,
--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>).
[$sel:originalDiskPath:DiskMap'] :: DiskMap -> Maybe Text

--   <tt>/dev/sdh</tt>).

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle

-- | Describes the specifications of a distribution bundle.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDistributionBundle</a> smart constructor.
data DistributionBundle
DistributionBundle' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> DistributionBundle

-- | The monthly network transfer quota of the bundle.
[$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:DistributionBundle'] :: DistributionBundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The ID of the bundle.
[$sel:bundleId:DistributionBundle'] :: DistributionBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the distribution bundle.
[$sel:name:DistributionBundle'] :: DistributionBundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The monthly price, in US dollars, of the bundle.
[$sel:price:DistributionBundle'] :: DistributionBundle -> Maybe Double

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active, and can be specified for a new
--   or existing distribution.
[$sel:isActive:DistributionBundle'] :: DistributionBundle -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>DistributionBundle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:DistributionBundle'</a>,
--   <a>distributionBundle_transferPerMonthInGb</a> - The monthly network
--   transfer quota of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:DistributionBundle'</a>,
--   <a>distributionBundle_bundleId</a> - The ID of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DistributionBundle'</a>, <a>distributionBundle_name</a> -
--   The name of the distribution bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:DistributionBundle'</a>, <a>distributionBundle_price</a>
--   - The monthly price, in US dollars, of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:DistributionBundle'</a>,
--   <a>distributionBundle_isActive</a> - Indicates whether the bundle is
--   active, and can be specified for a new or existing distribution.
newDistributionBundle :: DistributionBundle

-- | The monthly network transfer quota of the bundle.
distributionBundle_transferPerMonthInGb :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The ID of the bundle.
distributionBundle_bundleId :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the distribution bundle.
distributionBundle_name :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The monthly price, in US dollars, of the bundle.
distributionBundle_price :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Double)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle is active, and can be specified for a new
--   or existing distribution.
distributionBundle_isActive :: Lens' DistributionBundle (Maybe Bool)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DistributionBundle.DistributionBundle
