module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry

-- | Describes a domain recordset entry.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomainEntry</a> smart constructor.
data DomainEntry
DomainEntry' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DomainEntry

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias
--   used by the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type)
--   record in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and
--   routes traffic to your load balancer.
[$sel:isAlias:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the domain.
[$sel:name:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the domain recordset entry.
[$sel:id:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
[$sel:options:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for
--   IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server
--   (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:type':DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
[$sel:target:DomainEntry'] :: DomainEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DomainEntry</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAlias:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_isAlias</a> - When
--   <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias used by
--   the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type) record
--   in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and routes
--   traffic to your load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_name</a> - The name of
--   the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_id</a> - The ID of the
--   domain recordset entry.
--   
--   <a>$sel:options:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_options</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_type</a> - The type of
--   domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for IPv6 (AAAA),
--   canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server (NS), start
--   of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:target:DomainEntry'</a>, <a>domainEntry_target</a> - The
--   target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
newDomainEntry :: DomainEntry

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, specifies whether the domain entry is an alias
--   used by the Lightsail load balancer. You can include an alias (A type)
--   record in your request, which points to a load balancer DNS name and
--   routes traffic to your load balancer.
domainEntry_isAlias :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the domain.
domainEntry_name :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the domain recordset entry.
domainEntry_id :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The options for the domain entry.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 29, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
domainEntry_options :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The type of domain entry, such as address for IPv4 (A), address for
--   IPv6 (AAAA), canonical name (CNAME), mail exchanger (MX), name server
--   (NS), start of authority (SOA), service locator (SRV), or text (TXT).
--   
--   The following domain entry types can be used:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><pre>A</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>AAAA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>CNAME</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>MX</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>NS</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SOA</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>SRV</pre></li>
--   <li><pre>TXT</pre></li>
--   </ul>
domainEntry_type :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The target IP address (e.g., <tt>192.0.2.0</tt>), or AWS name server
--   (e.g., <tt>ns-111.awsdns-22.com.</tt>).
--   
--   For Lightsail load balancers, the value looks like
--   <tt>ab1234c56789c6b86aba6fb203d443bc-123456789.us-east-2.elb.amazonaws.com</tt>.
--   For Lightsail distributions, the value looks like
--   <tt>exampled1182ne.cloudfront.net</tt>. For Lightsail container
--   services, the value looks like
--   <tt>container-service-1.example23scljs.us-west-2.cs.amazonlightsail.com</tt>.
--   Be sure to also set <tt>isAlias</tt> to <tt>true</tt> when setting up
--   an A record for a Lightsail load balancer, distribution, or container
--   service.
domainEntry_target :: Lens' DomainEntry (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DomainEntry.DomainEntry


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest

-- | Describes the settings of a public endpoint for an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEndpointRequest</a> smart constructor.
data EndpointRequest
EndpointRequest' :: Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig -> Text -> Int -> EndpointRequest

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
[$sel:healthCheck:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig

-- | The name of the container for the endpoint.
[$sel:containerName:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Text

-- | The port of the container to which traffic is forwarded to.
[$sel:containerPort:EndpointRequest'] :: EndpointRequest -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>EndpointRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:healthCheck:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_healthCheck</a> - An object that describes the
--   health check configuration of the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerName:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_containerName</a> - The name of the container for
--   the endpoint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerPort:EndpointRequest'</a>,
--   <a>endpointRequest_containerPort</a> - The port of the container to
--   which traffic is forwarded to.
newEndpointRequest :: Text -> Int -> EndpointRequest

-- | An object that describes the health check configuration of the
--   container.
endpointRequest_healthCheck :: Lens' EndpointRequest (Maybe ContainerServiceHealthCheckConfig)

-- | The name of the container for the endpoint.
endpointRequest_containerName :: Lens' EndpointRequest Text

-- | The port of the container to which traffic is forwarded to.
endpointRequest_containerPort :: Lens' EndpointRequest Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.EndpointRequest.EndpointRequest


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

-- | Describes a container deployment configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the settings, such as the ports and launch
--   command, of containers that are deployed to your container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceDeploymentRequest</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest
ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest' :: Maybe EndpointRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
[$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'] :: ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest -> Maybe EndpointRequest

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
[$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'] :: ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container)

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeploymentRequest_publicEndpoint</a> - An object
--   that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeploymentRequest_containers</a> - An object that
--   describes the configuration for the containers of the deployment.
newContainerServiceDeploymentRequest :: ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

-- | An object that describes the endpoint of the deployment.
containerServiceDeploymentRequest_publicEndpoint :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest (Maybe EndpointRequest)

-- | An object that describes the configuration for the containers of the
--   deployment.
containerServiceDeploymentRequest_containers :: Lens' ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest (Maybe (HashMap Text Container))
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest.ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest.ContainerServiceDeploymentRequest

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject

-- | Describes whether an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution forwards cookies to the origin and, if so, which ones.
--   
--   For the cookies that you specify, your distribution caches separate
--   versions of the specified content based on the cookie values in viewer
--   requests.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCookieObject</a> smart constructor.
data CookieObject
CookieObject' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe ForwardValues -> CookieObject

-- | The specific cookies to forward to your distribution's origin.
[$sel:cookiesAllowList:CookieObject'] :: CookieObject -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
[$sel:option:CookieObject'] :: CookieObject -> Maybe ForwardValues

-- | Create a value of <a>CookieObject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cookiesAllowList:CookieObject'</a>,
--   <a>cookieObject_cookiesAllowList</a> - The specific cookies to forward
--   to your distribution's origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:option:CookieObject'</a>, <a>cookieObject_option</a> -
--   Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
newCookieObject :: CookieObject

-- | The specific cookies to forward to your distribution's origin.
cookieObject_cookiesAllowList :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies which cookies to forward to the distribution's origin for a
--   cache behavior: <tt>all</tt>, <tt>none</tt>, or <tt>allow-list</tt> to
--   forward only the cookies specified in the <tt>cookiesAllowList</tt>
--   parameter.
cookieObject_option :: Lens' CookieObject (Maybe ForwardValues)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CookieObject.CookieObject

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject

-- | Describes the request headers that a Lightsail distribution bases
--   caching on.
--   
--   For the headers that you specify, your distribution caches separate
--   versions of the specified content based on the header values in viewer
--   requests. For example, suppose viewer requests for <tt>logo.jpg</tt>
--   contain a custom <tt>product</tt> header that has a value of either
--   <tt>acme</tt> or <tt>apex</tt>, and you configure your distribution to
--   cache your content based on values in the <tt>product</tt> header.
--   Your distribution forwards the <tt>product</tt> header to the origin
--   and caches the response from the origin once for each header value.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHeaderObject</a> smart constructor.
data HeaderObject
HeaderObject' :: Maybe [HeaderEnum] -> Maybe ForwardValues -> HeaderObject

-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
[$sel:headersAllowList:HeaderObject'] :: HeaderObject -> Maybe [HeaderEnum]

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:option:HeaderObject'] :: HeaderObject -> Maybe ForwardValues

-- | Create a value of <a>HeaderObject</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:headersAllowList:HeaderObject'</a>,
--   <a>headerObject_headersAllowList</a> - The specific headers to forward
--   to your distribution's origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:option:HeaderObject'</a>, <a>headerObject_option</a> - The
--   headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin and
--   base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
newHeaderObject :: HeaderObject

-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
headerObject_headersAllowList :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe [HeaderEnum])

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
headerObject_option :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe ForwardValues)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HeaderObject.HeaderObject


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes

-- | Describes the public SSH host keys or the RDP certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newHostKeyAttributes</a> smart constructor.
data HostKeyAttributes
HostKeyAttributes' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> HostKeyAttributes

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
[$sel:notValidAfter:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
[$sel:notValidBefore:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:fingerprintSHA1:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
[$sel:publicKey:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
[$sel:algorithm:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | The time that the SSH host key or RDP certificate was recorded by
--   Lightsail.
[$sel:witnessedAt:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The SHA-256 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP
--   certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:fingerprintSHA256:HostKeyAttributes'] :: HostKeyAttributes -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>HostKeyAttributes</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:notValidAfter:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter</a> - The returned RDP certificate
--   is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notValidBefore:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore</a> - The returned RDP certificate
--   is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprintSHA1:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1</a> - The SHA-1 fingerprint of
--   the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicKey:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_publicKey</a> - The public SSH host key or the
--   RDP certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:algorithm:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_algorithm</a> - The SSH host key algorithm or the
--   RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:witnessedAt:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_witnessedAt</a> - The time that the SSH host key
--   or RDP certificate was recorded by Lightsail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprintSHA256:HostKeyAttributes'</a>,
--   <a>hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA256</a> - The SHA-256 fingerprint
--   of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
newHostKeyAttributes :: HostKeyAttributes

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
hostKeyAttributes_publicKey :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
hostKeyAttributes_algorithm :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the SSH host key or RDP certificate was recorded by
--   Lightsail.
hostKeyAttributes_witnessedAt :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-256 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP
--   certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA256 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.HostKeyAttributes.HostKeyAttributes

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary

-- | Describes information about the health of the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceHealthSummary</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceHealthSummary
InstanceHealthSummary' :: Maybe InstanceHealthState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceHealthReason -> InstanceHealthSummary

-- | Describes the overall instance health. Valid values are below.
[$sel:instanceHealth:InstanceHealthSummary'] :: InstanceHealthSummary -> Maybe InstanceHealthState

-- | The name of the Lightsail instance for which you are requesting health
--   check data.
[$sel:instanceName:InstanceHealthSummary'] :: InstanceHealthSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | More information about the instance health. If the
--   <tt>instanceHealth</tt> is <tt>healthy</tt>, then an
--   <tt>instanceHealthReason</tt> value is not provided.
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>initial</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.RegistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   in the process of being registered with the load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InitialHealthChecking</tt></b> - The Lightsail load
--   balancer is still sending the target instance the minimum number of
--   health checks required to determine its health status.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unhealthy</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.ResponseCodeMismatch</tt></b> - The health checks
--   did not return an expected HTTP code.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.Timeout</tt></b> - The health check requests timed
--   out.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.FailedHealthChecks</tt></b> - The health checks
--   failed because the connection to the target instance timed out, the
--   target instance response was malformed, or the target instance failed
--   the health check for an unknown reason.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InternalError</tt></b> - The health checks failed due to
--   an internal error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unused</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotRegistered</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   not registered with the target group.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotInUse</tt></b> - The target group is not used
--   by any load balancer, or the target instance is in an Availability
--   Zone that is not enabled for its load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.IpUnusable</tt></b> - The target IP address is
--   reserved for use by a Lightsail load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.InvalidState</tt></b> - The target is in the
--   stopped or terminated state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>draining</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.DeregistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target
--   instance is in the process of being deregistered and the
--   deregistration delay period has not expired.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:instanceHealthReason:InstanceHealthSummary'] :: InstanceHealthSummary -> Maybe InstanceHealthReason

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceHealthSummary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceHealth:InstanceHealthSummary'</a>,
--   <a>instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealth</a> - Describes the overall
--   instance health. Valid values are below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceName:InstanceHealthSummary'</a>,
--   <a>instanceHealthSummary_instanceName</a> - The name of the Lightsail
--   instance for which you are requesting health check data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceHealthReason:InstanceHealthSummary'</a>,
--   <a>instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealthReason</a> - More information
--   about the instance health. If the <tt>instanceHealth</tt> is
--   <tt>healthy</tt>, then an <tt>instanceHealthReason</tt> value is not
--   provided.
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>initial</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.RegistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   in the process of being registered with the load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InitialHealthChecking</tt></b> - The Lightsail load
--   balancer is still sending the target instance the minimum number of
--   health checks required to determine its health status.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unhealthy</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.ResponseCodeMismatch</tt></b> - The health checks
--   did not return an expected HTTP code.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.Timeout</tt></b> - The health check requests timed
--   out.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.FailedHealthChecks</tt></b> - The health checks
--   failed because the connection to the target instance timed out, the
--   target instance response was malformed, or the target instance failed
--   the health check for an unknown reason.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InternalError</tt></b> - The health checks failed due to
--   an internal error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unused</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotRegistered</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   not registered with the target group.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotInUse</tt></b> - The target group is not used
--   by any load balancer, or the target instance is in an Availability
--   Zone that is not enabled for its load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.IpUnusable</tt></b> - The target IP address is
--   reserved for use by a Lightsail load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.InvalidState</tt></b> - The target is in the
--   stopped or terminated state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>draining</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.DeregistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target
--   instance is in the process of being deregistered and the
--   deregistration delay period has not expired.</li>
--   </ul>
newInstanceHealthSummary :: InstanceHealthSummary

-- | Describes the overall instance health. Valid values are below.
instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealth :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe InstanceHealthState)

-- | The name of the Lightsail instance for which you are requesting health
--   check data.
instanceHealthSummary_instanceName :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | More information about the instance health. If the
--   <tt>instanceHealth</tt> is <tt>healthy</tt>, then an
--   <tt>instanceHealthReason</tt> value is not provided.
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>initial</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.RegistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   in the process of being registered with the load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InitialHealthChecking</tt></b> - The Lightsail load
--   balancer is still sending the target instance the minimum number of
--   health checks required to determine its health status.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unhealthy</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.ResponseCodeMismatch</tt></b> - The health checks
--   did not return an expected HTTP code.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.Timeout</tt></b> - The health check requests timed
--   out.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.FailedHealthChecks</tt></b> - The health checks
--   failed because the connection to the target instance timed out, the
--   target instance response was malformed, or the target instance failed
--   the health check for an unknown reason.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InternalError</tt></b> - The health checks failed due to
--   an internal error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unused</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotRegistered</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   not registered with the target group.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotInUse</tt></b> - The target group is not used
--   by any load balancer, or the target instance is in an Availability
--   Zone that is not enabled for its load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.IpUnusable</tt></b> - The target IP address is
--   reserved for use by a Lightsail load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.InvalidState</tt></b> - The target is in the
--   stopped or terminated state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>draining</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.DeregistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target
--   instance is in the process of being deregistered and the
--   deregistration delay period has not expired.</li>
--   </ul>
instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealthReason :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe InstanceHealthReason)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHealthSummary.InstanceHealthSummary

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstancePlatform.InstancePlatform
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstancePlatform.InstancePlatform
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstancePlatform.InstancePlatform


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle

-- | Describes a bundle, which is a set of specs describing your virtual
--   private server (or <i>instance</i>).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBundle</a> smart constructor.
data Bundle
Bundle' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [InstancePlatform] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> Bundle

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the bundle (e.g., <tt>2</tt>).
[$sel:cpuCount:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The data transfer rate per month in GB (e.g., <tt>2000</tt>).
[$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The bundle ID (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
[$sel:bundleId:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon EC2 instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>).
[$sel:instanceType:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly name for the bundle (e.g., <tt>Micro</tt>).
[$sel:name:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Text

-- | A numeric value that represents the power of the bundle (e.g.,
--   <tt>500</tt>). You can use the bundle's power value in conjunction
--   with a blueprint's minimum power value to determine whether the
--   blueprint will run on the bundle. For example, you need a bundle with
--   a power value of 500 or more to create an instance that uses a
--   blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
[$sel:power:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The size of the SSD (e.g., <tt>30</tt>).
[$sel:diskSizeInGb:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Int

-- | The operating system platform (Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) that the bundle supports. You can only launch a
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> bundle on a blueprint that supports the
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> platform. <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> blueprints require a
--   <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> bundle.
[$sel:supportedPlatforms:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe [InstancePlatform]

-- | The price in US dollars (e.g., <tt>5.0</tt>) of the bundle.
[$sel:price:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Double

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the bundle is active.
[$sel:isActive:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Bool

-- | The amount of RAM in GB (e.g., <tt>2.0</tt>).
[$sel:ramSizeInGb:Bundle'] :: Bundle -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>Bundle</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuCount:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_cpuCount</a> - The number of
--   vCPUs included in the bundle (e.g., <tt>2</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:Bundle'</a>,
--   <a>bundle_transferPerMonthInGb</a> - The data transfer rate per month
--   in GB (e.g., <tt>2000</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_bundleId</a> - The bundle ID
--   (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_instanceType</a> - The
--   Amazon EC2 instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_name</a> - A friendly name for the
--   bundle (e.g., <tt>Micro</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:power:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_power</a> - A numeric value that
--   represents the power of the bundle (e.g., <tt>500</tt>). You can use
--   the bundle's power value in conjunction with a blueprint's minimum
--   power value to determine whether the blueprint will run on the bundle.
--   For example, you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to
--   create an instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of
--   500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskSizeInGb:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_diskSizeInGb</a> - The
--   size of the SSD (e.g., <tt>30</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedPlatforms:Bundle'</a>,
--   <a>bundle_supportedPlatforms</a> - The operating system platform
--   (Linux/Unix-based or Windows Server-based) that the bundle supports.
--   You can only launch a <tt>WINDOWS</tt> bundle on a blueprint that
--   supports the <tt>WINDOWS</tt> platform. <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> blueprints
--   require a <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_price</a> - The price in US
--   dollars (e.g., <tt>5.0</tt>) of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_isActive</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating whether the bundle is active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramSizeInGb:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_ramSizeInGb</a> - The
--   amount of RAM in GB (e.g., <tt>2.0</tt>).
newBundle :: Bundle

-- | The number of vCPUs included in the bundle (e.g., <tt>2</tt>).
bundle_cpuCount :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The data transfer rate per month in GB (e.g., <tt>2000</tt>).
bundle_transferPerMonthInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The bundle ID (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
bundle_bundleId :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon EC2 instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>).
bundle_instanceType :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | A friendly name for the bundle (e.g., <tt>Micro</tt>).
bundle_name :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Text)

-- | A numeric value that represents the power of the bundle (e.g.,
--   <tt>500</tt>). You can use the bundle's power value in conjunction
--   with a blueprint's minimum power value to determine whether the
--   blueprint will run on the bundle. For example, you need a bundle with
--   a power value of 500 or more to create an instance that uses a
--   blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
bundle_power :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The size of the SSD (e.g., <tt>30</tt>).
bundle_diskSizeInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Int)

-- | The operating system platform (Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) that the bundle supports. You can only launch a
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> bundle on a blueprint that supports the
--   <tt>WINDOWS</tt> platform. <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> blueprints require a
--   <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> bundle.
bundle_supportedPlatforms :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe [InstancePlatform])

-- | The price in US dollars (e.g., <tt>5.0</tt>) of the bundle.
bundle_price :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Double)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the bundle is active.
bundle_isActive :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Bool)

-- | The amount of RAM in GB (e.g., <tt>2.0</tt>).
bundle_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' Bundle (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bundle.Bundle


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint

-- | Describes a blueprint (a virtual private server image).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBlueprint</a> smart constructor.
data Blueprint
Blueprint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InstancePlatform -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BlueprintType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Blueprint

-- | The version code.
[$sel:versionCode:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The operating system platform (either Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) of the blueprint.
[$sel:platform:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe InstancePlatform

-- | The group name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>amazon-linux</tt>).
[$sel:group':Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The minimum bundle power required to run this blueprint. For example,
--   you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an
--   instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
--   <tt>0</tt> indicates that the blueprint runs on all instance sizes.
[$sel:minPower:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Int

-- | The product URL to learn more about the image or blueprint.
[$sel:productUrl:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The end-user license agreement URL for the image or blueprint.
[$sel:licenseUrl:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
[$sel:name:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The version number of the operating system, application, or stack
--   (e.g., <tt>2016.03.0</tt>).
[$sel:version:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID for the virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>).
[$sel:blueprintId:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | The type of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>os</tt> or <tt>app</tt>).
[$sel:type':Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe BlueprintType

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the blueprint is active. Inactive
--   blueprints are listed to support customers with existing instances but
--   are not necessarily available for launch of new instances. Blueprints
--   are marked inactive when they become outdated due to operating system
--   updates or new application releases.
[$sel:isActive:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Bool

-- | The description of the blueprint.
[$sel:description:Blueprint'] :: Blueprint -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Blueprint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionCode:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_versionCode</a> - The
--   version code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_platform</a> - The
--   operating system platform (either Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) of the blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:group':Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_group</a> - The group name
--   of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>amazon-linux</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minPower:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_minPower</a> - The
--   minimum bundle power required to run this blueprint. For example, you
--   need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an instance
--   that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500. <tt>0</tt>
--   indicates that the blueprint runs on all instance sizes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productUrl:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_productUrl</a> - The
--   product URL to learn more about the image or blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseUrl:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_licenseUrl</a> - The
--   end-user license agreement URL for the image or blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_name</a> - The friendly name
--   of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_version</a> - The version
--   number of the operating system, application, or stack (e.g.,
--   <tt>2016.03.0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintId:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_blueprintId</a> - The
--   ID for the virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_type</a> - The type of the
--   blueprint (e.g., <tt>os</tt> or <tt>app</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_isActive</a> - A Boolean
--   value indicating whether the blueprint is active. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances but are not
--   necessarily available for launch of new instances. Blueprints are
--   marked inactive when they become outdated due to operating system
--   updates or new application releases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_description</a> - The
--   description of the blueprint.
newBlueprint :: Blueprint

-- | The version code.
blueprint_versionCode :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The operating system platform (either Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) of the blueprint.
blueprint_platform :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe InstancePlatform)

-- | The group name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>amazon-linux</tt>).
blueprint_group :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The minimum bundle power required to run this blueprint. For example,
--   you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an
--   instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500.
--   <tt>0</tt> indicates that the blueprint runs on all instance sizes.
blueprint_minPower :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Int)

-- | The product URL to learn more about the image or blueprint.
blueprint_productUrl :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The end-user license agreement URL for the image or blueprint.
blueprint_licenseUrl :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
blueprint_name :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The version number of the operating system, application, or stack
--   (e.g., <tt>2016.03.0</tt>).
blueprint_version :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID for the virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>).
blueprint_blueprintId :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>os</tt> or <tt>app</tt>).
blueprint_type :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe BlueprintType)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the blueprint is active. Inactive
--   blueprints are listed to support customers with existing instances but
--   are not necessarily available for launch of new instances. Blueprints
--   are marked inactive when they become outdated due to operating system
--   updates or new application releases.
blueprint_isActive :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Bool)

-- | The description of the blueprint.
blueprint_description :: Lens' Blueprint (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Blueprint.Blueprint


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo

-- | Describes an instance snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceSnapshotInfo</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceSnapshotInfo
InstanceSnapshotInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DiskInfo] -> InstanceSnapshotInfo

-- | The blueprint ID from which the source instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>).
[$sel:fromBlueprintId:InstanceSnapshotInfo'] :: InstanceSnapshotInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle ID from which the source instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
[$sel:fromBundleId:InstanceSnapshotInfo'] :: InstanceSnapshotInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects describing the disks that were attached to the
--   source instance.
[$sel:fromDiskInfo:InstanceSnapshotInfo'] :: InstanceSnapshotInfo -> Maybe [DiskInfo]

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceSnapshotInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromBlueprintId:InstanceSnapshotInfo'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBlueprintId</a> - The blueprint ID from
--   which the source instance (e.g., <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromBundleId:InstanceSnapshotInfo'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBundleId</a> - The bundle ID from which
--   the source instance was created (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromDiskInfo:InstanceSnapshotInfo'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshotInfo_fromDiskInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the disks that were attached to the source instance.
newInstanceSnapshotInfo :: InstanceSnapshotInfo

-- | The blueprint ID from which the source instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>).
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBlueprintId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle ID from which the source instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBundleId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects describing the disks that were attached to the
--   source instance.
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromDiskInfo :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe [DiskInfo])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotInfo.InstanceSnapshotInfo


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo

-- | Describes the source of an export snapshot record.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo' :: Maybe DiskSnapshotInfo -> Maybe ExportSnapshotRecordSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceSnapshotInfo -> Maybe Text -> ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo

-- | A list of objects describing a disk snapshot.
[$sel:diskSnapshotInfo:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe DiskSnapshotInfo

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt> or
--   <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe ExportSnapshotRecordSourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source instance or disk
--   snapshot.
[$sel:arn:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the source instance or disk snapshot was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot's source instance or
--   disk.
[$sel:fromResourceArn:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the source instance or disk snapshot.
[$sel:name:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects describing an instance snapshot.
[$sel:instanceSnapshotInfo:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe InstanceSnapshotInfo

-- | The name of the snapshot's source instance or disk.
[$sel:fromResourceName:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'] :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskSnapshotInfo:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_diskSnapshotInfo</a> - A list of
--   objects describing a disk snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail
--   resource type (e.g., <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt> or
--   <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the source instance or disk snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_createdAt</a> - The date when the
--   source instance or disk snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromResourceArn:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_fromResourceArn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot's source instance or disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_name</a> - The name of the source
--   instance or disk snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceSnapshotInfo:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_instanceSnapshotInfo</a> - A list of
--   objects describing an instance snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromResourceName:ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_fromResourceName</a> - The name of
--   the snapshot's source instance or disk.
newExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo :: ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo

-- | A list of objects describing a disk snapshot.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_diskSnapshotInfo :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe DiskSnapshotInfo)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt> or
--   <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_resourceType :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe ExportSnapshotRecordSourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source instance or disk
--   snapshot.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_arn :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the source instance or disk snapshot was created.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_createdAt :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot's source instance or
--   disk.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_fromResourceArn :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the source instance or disk snapshot.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_name :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects describing an instance snapshot.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_instanceSnapshotInfo :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe InstanceSnapshotInfo)

-- | The name of the snapshot's source instance or disk.
exportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo_fromResourceName :: Lens' ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo.ExportSnapshotRecordSourceInfo


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState
newtype InstanceSnapshotState
InstanceSnapshotState' :: Text -> InstanceSnapshotState
[fromInstanceSnapshotState] :: InstanceSnapshotState -> Text
pattern InstanceSnapshotState_Available :: InstanceSnapshotState
pattern InstanceSnapshotState_Error :: InstanceSnapshotState
pattern InstanceSnapshotState_Pending :: InstanceSnapshotState

instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshotState.InstanceSnapshotState


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState

-- | Describes the virtual private server (or <i>instance</i>) status.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceState</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceState
InstanceState' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> InstanceState

-- | The state of the instance (e.g., <tt>running</tt> or
--   <tt>pending</tt>).
[$sel:name:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Text

-- | The status code for the instance.
[$sel:code:InstanceState'] :: InstanceState -> Maybe Int

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceState</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_name</a> - The state
--   of the instance (e.g., <tt>running</tt> or <tt>pending</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:InstanceState'</a>, <a>instanceState_code</a> - The
--   status code for the instance.
newInstanceState :: InstanceState

-- | The state of the instance (e.g., <tt>running</tt> or
--   <tt>pending</tt>).
instanceState_name :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The status code for the instance.
instanceState_code :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Int)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceState.InstanceState

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption

-- | Contains information about the domain names on an SSL/TLS certificate
--   that you will use to validate domain ownership.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption</a>
--   smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption

-- | The fully qualified domain name in the certificate request.
[$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption -> Maybe Text

-- | The status of the domain validation. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:validationStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_domainName</a> -
--   The fully qualified domain name in the certificate request.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_validationStatus</a>
--   - The status of the domain validation. Valid values are listed below.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption

-- | The fully qualified domain name in the certificate request.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the domain validation. Valid values are listed below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_validationStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord

-- | Describes the validation record of each domain name in the SSL/TLS
--   certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord</a>
--   smart constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus -> Maybe Text -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord

-- | The value for that type.
[$sel:value:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name against which your SSL/TLS certificate was validated.
[$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | A fully qualified domain name in the certificate. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>.
[$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | The validation status. Valid values are listed below.
[$sel:validationStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus

-- | The type of validation record. For example, <tt>CNAME</tt> for domain
--   validation.
[$sel:type':LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of
--   <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_value</a> - The
--   value for that type.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_domainName</a> -
--   The domain name against which your SSL/TLS certificate was validated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_name</a> - A fully
--   qualified domain name in the certificate. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:validationStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_validationStatus</a>
--   - The validation status. Valid values are listed below.
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_type</a> - The
--   type of validation record. For example, <tt>CNAME</tt> for domain
--   validation.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord

-- | The value for that type.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_value :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name against which your SSL/TLS certificate was validated.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | A fully qualified domain name in the certificate. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>.

-- | The validation status. Valid values are listed below.

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | Contains information about the status of Lightsail's managed renewal
--   for the certificate.
--   
--   The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names in the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names in the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. If you used DNS validation, check to make sure your
--   certificate's domain validation records exist in your domain's DNS,
--   and that your certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary' :: Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption] -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:renewalStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus

-- | Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
[$sel:domainValidationOptions:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary -> Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption]

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalStatus:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_renewalStatus</a> - The
--   renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationOptions:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary'</a>,
--   <a>loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_domainValidationOptions</a>
--   - Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_renewalStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus)

-- | Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_domainValidationOptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption])

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary

-- | Provides a summary of SSL/TLS certificate metadata.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary</a> smart
--   constructor.
data LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary
LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
[$sel:isAttached:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.
[$sel:name:LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary'] :: LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.
