module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.KeyPair

-- | Describes an SSH key pair.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newKeyPair</a> smart constructor.
data KeyPair
KeyPair' :: Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> KeyPair

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>KeyPair</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key pair (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:KeyPair/05859e3d-331d-48ba-9034-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the key pair was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
[$sel:createdAt:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the key pair was created.
[$sel:location:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The RSA fingerprint of the key pair.
[$sel:fingerprint:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the SSH key pair.
[$sel:name:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe Text

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:KeyPair'] :: KeyPair -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>KeyPair</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_resourceType</a> - The
--   resource type (usually <tt>KeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the key pair (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:KeyPair/05859e3d-331d-48ba-9034-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the key pair was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_location</a> - The region
--   name and Availability Zone where the key pair was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprint:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_fingerprint</a> - The RSA
--   fingerprint of the key pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_name</a> - The friendly name of
--   the SSH key pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:KeyPair'</a>, <a>keyPair_tags</a> - The tag keys and
--   optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in
--   Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newKeyPair :: KeyPair

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>KeyPair</tt>).
keyPair_resourceType :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key pair (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:KeyPair/05859e3d-331d-48ba-9034-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).

-- | The timestamp when the key pair was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the key pair was created.
keyPair_location :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The RSA fingerprint of the key pair.

-- | The friendly name of the SSH key pair.
keyPair_name :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
keyPair_tags :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe [Tag])

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.KeyPair.KeyPair


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Domain

-- | Describes a domain where you are storing recordsets.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDomain</a> smart constructor.
data Domain
Domain' :: Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe [DomainEntry] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Domain

-- | The resource type.
[$sel:resourceType:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entries.
[$sel:domainEntries:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe [DomainEntry]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain recordset (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:global:123456789101:Domain/824cede0-abc7-4f84-8dbc-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the domain recordset was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zones where the domain recordset was
--   created.
[$sel:location:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The name of the domain.
[$sel:name:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Domain'] :: Domain -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Domain</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_resourceType</a> - The
--   resource type.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainEntries:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_domainEntries</a> - An
--   array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entries.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the domain recordset (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:global:123456789101:Domain/824cede0-abc7-4f84-8dbc-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_createdAt</a> - The date when
--   the domain recordset was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_location</a> - The AWS Region
--   and Availability Zones where the domain recordset was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_name</a> - The name of the domain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Domain'</a>, <a>domain_tags</a> - The tag keys and
--   optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in
--   Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newDomain :: Domain

-- | The resource type.
domain_resourceType :: Lens' Domain (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the domain
--   entries.
domain_domainEntries :: Lens' Domain (Maybe [DomainEntry])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the domain recordset (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:global:123456789101:Domain/824cede0-abc7-4f84-8dbc-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
domain_arn :: Lens' Domain (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the domain recordset was created.
domain_createdAt :: Lens' Domain (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zones where the domain recordset was
--   created.
domain_location :: Lens' Domain (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The name of the domain.
domain_name :: Lens' Domain (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
domain_supportCode :: Lens' Domain (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
domain_tags :: Lens' Domain (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Domain.Domain
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Domain.Domain
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Domain.Domain

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.DiskSnapshot

-- | Describes a block storage disk snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDiskSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data DiskSnapshot
DiskSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe DiskSnapshotState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> DiskSnapshot

-- | The unique name of the source disk from which the disk snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:fromDiskName:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
[$sel:isFromAutoSnapshot:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The status of the disk snapshot operation.
[$sel:state:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe DiskSnapshotState

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk snapshot.
[$sel:arn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the disk snapshot was created.
[$sel:createdAt:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk snapshot was
--   created.
[$sel:location:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The progress of the snapshot.
[$sel:progress:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
[$sel:name:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
[$sel:sizeInGb:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source instance from which the
--   disk (system volume) snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromInstanceArn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the source instance from which the disk (system
--   volume) snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromInstanceName:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source disk from which the disk
--   snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromDiskArn:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:DiskSnapshot'] :: DiskSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>DiskSnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromDiskName:DiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>diskSnapshot_fromDiskName</a> - The unique name of the source disk
--   from which the disk snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isFromAutoSnapshot:DiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>diskSnapshot_isFromAutoSnapshot</a> - A Boolean value indicating
--   whether the snapshot was created from an automatic snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_state</a> - The
--   status of the disk snapshot operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:DiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>diskSnapshot_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>DiskSnapshot</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the disk snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_createdAt</a> -
--   The date when the disk snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_location</a> - The
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progress:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_progress</a> - The
--   progress of the snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_name</a> - The name of
--   the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_sizeInGb</a> - The
--   size of the disk in GB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_supportCode</a>
--   - The support code. Include this code in your email to support when
--   you have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromInstanceArn:DiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>diskSnapshot_fromInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the source instance from which the disk (system volume) snapshot
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromInstanceName:DiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>diskSnapshot_fromInstanceName</a> - The unique name of the source
--   instance from which the disk (system volume) snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromDiskArn:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_fromDiskArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source disk from which the
--   disk snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:DiskSnapshot'</a>, <a>diskSnapshot_tags</a> - The tag
--   keys and optional values for the resource. For more information about
--   tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newDiskSnapshot :: DiskSnapshot

--   created.
diskSnapshot_fromDiskName :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.

--   created.

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).

-- | The size of the disk in GB.

--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source instance from which the
--   disk (system volume) snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromInstanceArn :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the source instance from which the disk (system
--   volume) snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromInstanceName :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source disk from which the disk
--   snapshot was created.
diskSnapshot_fromDiskArn :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe Text)

diskSnapshot_tags :: Lens' DiskSnapshot (Maybe [Tag])

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk

-- | Describes a block storage disk.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDisk</a> smart constructor.
data Disk
Disk' :: Maybe DiskState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [AddOn] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [Tag] -> Disk

-- | Describes the status of the disk.
[$sel:state:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe DiskState

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.
[$sel:arn:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The disk path.
[$sel:path:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The date when the disk was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk is located.
[$sel:location:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.
[$sel:iops:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.
[$sel:isAttached:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Bool

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
[$sel:addOns:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [AddOn]

-- | (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
[$sel:attachmentState:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the disk.
[$sel:name:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
[$sel:sizeInGb:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
[$sel:isSystemDisk:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Bool

-- | The resources to which the disk is attached.
[$sel:attachedTo:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Text

-- | (Deprecated) The number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
[$sel:gbInUse:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe Int

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Disk'] :: Disk -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Disk</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_state</a> - Describes the status of
--   the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_path</a> - The disk path.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_createdAt</a> - The date when the
--   disk was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_location</a> - The AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone where the disk is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:iops:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_iops</a> - The input/output operations
--   per second (IOPS) of the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttached:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_isAttached</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating whether the disk is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOns:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_addOns</a> - An array of objects
--   representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachmentState:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_attachmentState</a> -
--   (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_name</a> - The unique name of the
--   disk.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_sizeInGb</a> - The size of the
--   disk in GB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_supportCode</a> - The support
--   code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isSystemDisk:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_isSystemDisk</a> - A Boolean
--   value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an operating
--   system loaded on it).
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedTo:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_attachedTo</a> - The resources
--   to which the disk is attached.
--   
--   <a>$sel:gbInUse:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_gbInUse</a> - (Deprecated) The
--   number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Disk'</a>, <a>disk_tags</a> - The tag keys and optional
--   values for the resource. For more information about tags in Lightsail,
--   see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newDisk :: Disk

-- | Describes the status of the disk.
disk_state :: Lens' Disk (Maybe DiskState)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Disk</tt>).
disk_resourceType :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the disk.
disk_arn :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The disk path.
disk_path :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The date when the disk was created.
disk_createdAt :: Lens' Disk (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where the disk is located.
disk_location :: Lens' Disk (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The input/output operations per second (IOPS) of the disk.
disk_iops :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the disk is attached.
disk_isAttached :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the disk.
disk_addOns :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [AddOn])

-- | (Deprecated) The attachment state of the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter returned
--   <tt>attached</tt> for system disks in the API response. It is now
--   deprecated, but still included in the response. Use
--   <tt>isAttached</tt> instead.
disk_attachmentState :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the disk.
disk_name :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the disk in GB.
disk_sizeInGb :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
disk_supportCode :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this disk is a system disk (has an
--   operating system loaded on it).
disk_isSystemDisk :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Bool)

-- | The resources to which the disk is attached.
disk_attachedTo :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Text)

-- | (Deprecated) The number of GB in use by the disk.
--   
--   In releases prior to November 14, 2017, this parameter was not
--   included in the API response. It is now deprecated.
disk_gbInUse :: Lens' Disk (Maybe Int)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
disk_tags :: Lens' Disk (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Disk.Disk


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceSnapshot

-- | Describes an instance snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceSnapshot
InstanceSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe InstanceSnapshotState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe [Disk] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> InstanceSnapshot

-- | The blueprint ID from which you created the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>). A blueprint is a virtual private server (or
--   <i>instance</i>) image used to create instances quickly.
[$sel:fromBlueprintId:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
[$sel:isFromAutoSnapshot:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The state the snapshot is in.
[$sel:state:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe InstanceSnapshotState

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | An array of disk objects containing information about all block
--   storage disks.
[$sel:fromAttachedDisks:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe [Disk]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:InstanceSnapshot/d23b5706-3322-4d83-81e5-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the snapshot was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479907467.024</tt>).
[$sel:createdAt:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where you created the snapshot.
[$sel:location:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The progress of the snapshot.
--   
--   This is populated only for disk snapshots, and is <tt>null</tt> for
--   instance snapshots.
[$sel:progress:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the snapshot.
[$sel:name:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle ID from which you created the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
[$sel:fromBundleId:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The size in GB of the SSD.
[$sel:sizeInGb:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance from which the snapshot
--   was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/64b8404c-ccb1-430b-8daf-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:fromInstanceArn:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The instance from which the snapshot was created.
[$sel:fromInstanceName:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:InstanceSnapshot'] :: InstanceSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceSnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromBlueprintId:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_fromBlueprintId</a> - The blueprint ID from which
--   you created the snapshot (e.g., <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>). A blueprint
--   is a virtual private server (or <i>instance</i>) image used to create
--   instances quickly.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isFromAutoSnapshot:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_isFromAutoSnapshot</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating whether the snapshot was created from an automatic
--   snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:InstanceSnapshot'</a>, <a>instanceSnapshot_state</a> -
--   The state the snapshot is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_resourceType</a> - The type of resource (usually
--   <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromAttachedDisks:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_fromAttachedDisks</a> - An array of disk objects
--   containing information about all block storage disks.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InstanceSnapshot'</a>, <a>instanceSnapshot_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:InstanceSnapshot/d23b5706-3322-4d83-81e5-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the snapshot
--   was created (e.g., <tt>1479907467.024</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_location</a> - The region name and Availability
--   Zone where you created the snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:progress:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_progress</a> - The progress of the snapshot.
--   
--   This is populated only for disk snapshots, and is <tt>null</tt> for
--   instance snapshots.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:InstanceSnapshot'</a>, <a>instanceSnapshot_name</a> - The
--   name of the snapshot.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromBundleId:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_fromBundleId</a> - The bundle ID from which you
--   created the snapshot (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_sizeInGb</a> - The size in GB of the SSD.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_supportCode</a> - The support code. Include this
--   code in your email to support when you have questions about an
--   instance or another resource in Lightsail. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromInstanceArn:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_fromInstanceArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the instance from which the snapshot was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/64b8404c-ccb1-430b-8daf-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:fromInstanceName:InstanceSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>instanceSnapshot_fromInstanceName</a> - The instance from which the
--   snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InstanceSnapshot'</a>, <a>instanceSnapshot_tags</a> - The
--   tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information
--   about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newInstanceSnapshot :: InstanceSnapshot

-- | The blueprint ID from which you created the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>). A blueprint is a virtual private server (or
--   <i>instance</i>) image used to create instances quickly.
instanceSnapshot_fromBlueprintId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_isFromAutoSnapshot :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The state the snapshot is in.
instanceSnapshot_state :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe InstanceSnapshotState)

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_resourceType :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | An array of disk objects containing information about all block
--   storage disks.
instanceSnapshot_fromAttachedDisks :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe [Disk])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:InstanceSnapshot/d23b5706-3322-4d83-81e5-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_arn :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the snapshot was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479907467.024</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_createdAt :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where you created the snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_location :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe ResourceLocation)

--   
--   This is populated only for disk snapshots, and is <tt>null</tt> for
--   instance snapshots.
instanceSnapshot_progress :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_name :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

instanceSnapshot_fromBundleId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
instanceSnapshot_supportCode :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

--   was created (e.g.,

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHardware

-- | Describes the hardware for the instance.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceHardware</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceHardware
InstanceHardware' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe [Disk] -> Maybe Double -> InstanceHardware

-- | The number of vCPUs the instance has.
[$sel:cpuCount:InstanceHardware'] :: InstanceHardware -> Maybe Int

-- | The disks attached to the instance.
[$sel:disks:InstanceHardware'] :: InstanceHardware -> Maybe [Disk]

-- | The amount of RAM in GB on the instance (e.g., <tt>1.0</tt>).
[$sel:ramSizeInGb:InstanceHardware'] :: InstanceHardware -> Maybe Double

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceHardware</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuCount:InstanceHardware'</a>,
--   <a>instanceHardware_cpuCount</a> - The number of vCPUs the instance
--   has.
--   
--   <a>$sel:disks:InstanceHardware'</a>, <a>instanceHardware_disks</a> -
--   The disks attached to the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramSizeInGb:InstanceHardware'</a>,
--   <a>instanceHardware_ramSizeInGb</a> - The amount of RAM in GB on the
--   instance (e.g., <tt>1.0</tt>).
newInstanceHardware :: InstanceHardware

-- | The number of vCPUs the instance has.
instanceHardware_cpuCount :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe Int)

-- | The disks attached to the instance.
instanceHardware_disks :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe [Disk])

-- | The amount of RAM in GB on the instance (e.g., <tt>1.0</tt>).
instanceHardware_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe Double)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.InstanceHardware.InstanceHardware

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance

-- | Describes an instance (a virtual private server).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstance</a> smart constructor.
data Instance
Instance' :: Maybe InstanceState -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddOn] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceNetworking -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe InstanceHardware -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Instance

-- | The status code and the state (e.g., <tt>running</tt>) for the
--   instance.
[$sel:state:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceState

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>Instance</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/244ad76f-8aad-4741-809f-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
[$sel:arn:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479734909.17</tt>) in Unix time format.
[$sel:createdAt:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the instance is located.
[$sel:location:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The name of the SSH key being used to connect to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
[$sel:sshKeyName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the instance.
[$sel:addOns:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [AddOn]

-- | The user name for connecting to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>ec2-user</tt>).
[$sel:username:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | Information about the public ports and monthly data transfer rates for
--   the instance.
[$sel:networking:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceNetworking

-- | The bundle for the instance (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
[$sel:bundleId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The name the user gave the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
[$sel:name:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The IP address type of the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
[$sel:ipAddressType:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The blueprint ID (e.g., <tt>os_amlinux_2016_03</tt>).
[$sel:blueprintId:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
[$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
[$sel:blueprintName:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP
--   assigned to it.
[$sel:isStaticIp:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
[$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe Text

-- | The size of the vCPU and the amount of RAM for the instance.
[$sel:hardware:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe InstanceHardware

-- | The IPv6 addresses of the instance.
[$sel:ipv6Addresses:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Instance'] :: Instance -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Instance</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_state</a> - The status code
--   and the state (e.g., <tt>running</tt>) for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_resourceType</a> - The
--   type of resource (usually <tt>Instance</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/244ad76f-8aad-4741-809f-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the instance was created (e.g., <tt>1479734909.17</tt>)
--   in Unix time format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_location</a> - The region
--   name and Availability Zone where the instance is located.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sshKeyName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_sshKeyName</a> - The
--   name of the SSH key being used to connect to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOns:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_addOns</a> - An array of
--   objects representing the add-ons enabled on the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:username:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_username</a> - The user
--   name for connecting to the instance (e.g., <tt>ec2-user</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:networking:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_networking</a> -
--   Information about the public ports and monthly data transfer rates for
--   the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_bundleId</a> - The bundle
--   for the instance (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_name</a> - The name the user
--   gave the instance (e.g., <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ipAddressType</a> -
--   The IP address type of the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintId:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_blueprintId</a> - The
--   blueprint ID (e.g., <tt>os_amlinux_2016_03</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateIpAddress:Instance'</a>,
--   <a>instance_privateIpAddress</a> - The private IP address of the
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintName:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_blueprintName</a> -
--   The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:isStaticIp:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_isStaticIp</a> - A
--   Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP
--   assigned to it.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicIpAddress:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_publicIpAddress</a>
--   - The public IP address of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hardware:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_hardware</a> - The size of
--   the vCPU and the amount of RAM for the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipv6Addresses:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_ipv6Addresses</a> -
--   The IPv6 addresses of the instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Instance'</a>, <a>instance_tags</a> - The tag keys and
--   optional values for the resource. For more information about tags in
--   Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
newInstance :: Instance

-- | The status code and the state (e.g., <tt>running</tt>) for the
--   instance.
instance_state :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceState)

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>Instance</tt>).
instance_resourceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/244ad76f-8aad-4741-809f-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
instance_arn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479734909.17</tt>) in Unix time format.
instance_createdAt :: Lens' Instance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the instance is located.
instance_location :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The name of the SSH key being used to connect to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
instance_sshKeyName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the instance.
instance_addOns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [AddOn])

-- | The user name for connecting to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>ec2-user</tt>).
instance_username :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the public ports and monthly data transfer rates for
--   the instance.
instance_networking :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceNetworking)

-- | The bundle for the instance (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
instance_bundleId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name the user gave the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
instance_name :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
instance_ipAddressType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
instance_supportCode :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The blueprint ID (e.g., <tt>os_amlinux_2016_03</tt>).
instance_blueprintId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
instance_privateIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
instance_blueprintName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP
--   assigned to it.
instance_isStaticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
instance_publicIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the vCPU and the amount of RAM for the instance.
instance_hardware :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceHardware)

-- | The IPv6 addresses of the instance.
instance_ipv6Addresses :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
instance_tags :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Instance.Instance


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerService</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerService
ContainerService' :: Maybe ContainerServiceState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe [Tag] -> ContainerService

-- | The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceState

-- | The ID of the power of the container service.
[$sel:powerId:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the container service (i.e.,
--   <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
[$sel:arn:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the container service was created.
[$sel:createdAt:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that describes the location of the container service, such
--   as the AWS Region and Availability Zone.
[$sel:location:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
[$sel:scale:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Natural

-- | The publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
[$sel:url:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
[$sel:stateDetail:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail

-- | An object that describes the next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
[$sel:nextDeployment:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The principal ARN of the container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
[$sel:principalArn:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
[$sel:power:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName

-- | The private domain name of the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
[$sel:privateDomainName:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the container service is disabled.
[$sel:isDisabled:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Bool

-- | The public domain name of the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
[$sel:publicDomainNames:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text])

-- | The name of the container service.
[$sel:containerServiceName:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the current container deployment of the
--   container service.
[$sel:currentDeployment:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:ContainerService'] :: ContainerService -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerService</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_state</a> -
--   The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:powerId:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_powerId</a>
--   - The ID of the power of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource type of
--   the container service (i.e., <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the container
--   service was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_location</a> - An object that describes the
--   location of the container service, such as the AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scale:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_scale</a> -
--   The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_url</a> - The
--   publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateDetail:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_stateDetail</a> - An object that describes the
--   current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextDeployment:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_nextDeployment</a> - An object that describes the
--   next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalArn:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_principalArn</a> - The principal ARN of the
--   container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:power:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_power</a> -
--   The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDomainName:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_privateDomainName</a> - The private domain name of
--   the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDisabled:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_isDisabled</a> - A Boolean value indicating
--   whether the container service is disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDomainNames:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_publicDomainNames</a> - The public domain name of
--   the container service, such as <tt>example.com</tt> and
--   <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerServiceName:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_containerServiceName</a> - The name of the
--   container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentDeployment:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_currentDeployment</a> - An object that describes
--   the current container deployment of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_tags</a> - The
--   tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information
--   about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newContainerService :: ContainerService

-- | The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
containerService_state :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceState)

-- | The ID of the power of the container service.
containerService_powerId :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the container service (i.e.,
--   <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
containerService_resourceType :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
containerService_arn :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the container service was created.
containerService_createdAt :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the location of the container service, such
--   as the AWS Region and Availability Zone.
containerService_location :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
containerService_scale :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Natural)

-- | The publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
containerService_url :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
containerService_stateDetail :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail)

-- | An object that describes the next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
containerService_nextDeployment :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment)

-- | The principal ARN of the container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
containerService_principalArn :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
containerService_power :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServicePowerName)

-- | The private domain name of the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
containerService_privateDomainName :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the container service is disabled.
containerService_isDisabled :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public domain name of the container service, such as
--   <tt>example.com</tt> and <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
containerService_publicDomainNames :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]))

-- | The name of the container service.
containerService_containerServiceName :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the current container deployment of the
--   container service.
containerService_currentDeployment :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
containerService_tags :: Lens' ContainerService (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.ContainerService.ContainerService


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate

-- | Describes the full details of an Amazon Lightsail SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   To get a summary of a certificate, use the <tt>GetCertificates</tt>
--   action and ommit <tt>includeCertificateDetails</tt> from your request.
--   The response will include only the certificate Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN), certificate name, domain name, and tags.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RenewalSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DomainValidationRecord] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | The validation status of the certificate.
[$sel:status:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe CertificateStatus

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) of the certificate.
[$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
[$sel:arn:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The renewal eligibility of the certificate.
[$sel:eligibleToRenew:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:requestFailureReason:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revokedAt:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The timestamp when the certificate is first valid.
[$sel:notBefore:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
[$sel:revocationReason:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
[$sel:domainName:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
[$sel:name:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
[$sel:renewalSummary:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe RenewalSummary

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail certificate. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that describe the domain validation records of the
--   certificate.
[$sel:domainValidationRecords:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe [DomainValidationRecord]

-- | The number of Lightsail resources that the certificate is attached to.
[$sel:inUseResourceCount:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Int

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was issued.
[$sel:issuedAt:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key) of the certificate.
[$sel:keyAlgorithm:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
[$sel:serialNumber:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The certificate authority that issued the certificate.
[$sel:issuerCA:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The timestamp when the certificate expires.
[$sel:notAfter:Certificate'] :: Certificate -> Maybe POSIX

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_status</a> - The
--   validation status of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_subjectAlternativeNames</a> - An array of strings that
--   specify the alternate domains (e.g., <tt>example2.com</tt>) and
--   subdomains (e.g., <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eligibleToRenew:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_eligibleToRenew</a> - The renewal eligibility of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestFailureReason:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_requestFailureReason</a> - The validation failure
--   reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:revokedAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_revokedAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_notBefore</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate is first valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revocationReason:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_revocationReason</a> - The reason the certificate was
--   revoked. This value is present only when the certificate status is
--   <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_domainName</a> -
--   The domain name of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_name</a> - The name of
--   the certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalSummary:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_renewalSummary</a> - An object that describes the
--   status of the certificate renewal managed by Lightsail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_supportCode</a> -
--   The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail certificate. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationRecords:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_domainValidationRecords</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe the domain validation records of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inUseResourceCount:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_inUseResourceCount</a> - The number of Lightsail
--   resources that the certificate is attached to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuedAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_issuedAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was issued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyAlgorithm:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_keyAlgorithm</a>
--   - The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_serialNumber</a>
--   - The serial number of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuerCA:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_issuerCA</a> - The
--   certificate authority that issued the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_tags</a> - The tag keys
--   and optional values for the resource. For more information about tags
--   in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_notAfter</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate expires.
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | The validation status of the certificate.
certificate_status :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe CertificateStatus)

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) of the certificate.
certificate_subjectAlternativeNames :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [Text])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
certificate_arn :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was created.
certificate_createdAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The renewal eligibility of the certificate.
certificate_eligibleToRenew :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
