--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
certificate_requestFailureReason :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
certificate_revokedAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate is first valid.
certificate_notBefore :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
certificate_revocationReason :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
certificate_domainName :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
certificate_name :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the status of the certificate renewal managed
--   by Lightsail.
certificate_renewalSummary :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe RenewalSummary)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail certificate. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
certificate_supportCode :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe the domain validation records of the
--   certificate.
certificate_domainValidationRecords :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [DomainValidationRecord])

-- | The number of Lightsail resources that the certificate is attached to.
certificate_inUseResourceCount :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Int)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was issued.
certificate_issuedAt :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key) of the certificate.
certificate_keyAlgorithm :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
certificate_serialNumber :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The certificate authority that issued the certificate.
certificate_issuerCA :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
certificate_tags :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The timestamp when the certificate expires.
certificate_notAfter :: Lens' Certificate (Maybe UTCTime)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Certificate.Certificate


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateSummary
CertificateSummary' :: Maybe Certificate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> CertificateSummary

-- | An object that describes a certificate in detail.
[$sel:certificateDetail:CertificateSummary'] :: CertificateSummary -> Maybe Certificate

-- | The name of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateName:CertificateSummary'] :: CertificateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
[$sel:certificateArn:CertificateSummary'] :: CertificateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
[$sel:domainName:CertificateSummary'] :: CertificateSummary -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:tags:CertificateSummary'] :: CertificateSummary -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateDetail:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateDetail</a> - An object that describes
--   a certificate in detail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateName</a> - The name of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_domainName</a> - The domain name of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CertificateSummary'</a>, <a>certificateSummary_tags</a> -
--   The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
newCertificateSummary :: CertificateSummary

-- | An object that describes a certificate in detail.
certificateSummary_certificateDetail :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Certificate)

-- | The name of the certificate.
certificateSummary_certificateName :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
certificateSummary_certificateArn :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the certificate.
certificateSummary_domainName :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
certificateSummary_tags :: Lens' CertificateSummary (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.CertificateSummary.CertificateSummary


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucket</a> smart constructor.
data Bucket
Bucket' :: Maybe BucketState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResourceReceivingAccess] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessRules -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Bucket

-- | An object that describes the state of the bucket.
[$sel:state:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe BucketState

-- | Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be configured:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Object versioning is enabled.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Object versioning was previously enabled but
--   is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   <li><tt>NeverEnabled</tt> - Object versioning has never been
--   enabled.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:objectVersioning:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the bucket (for example,
--   <tt>Bucket</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
[$sel:arn:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe POSIX
[$sel:location:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | An array of strings that specify the AWS account IDs that have
--   read-only access to the bucket.
[$sel:readonlyAccessAccounts:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The URL of the bucket.
[$sel:url:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that describe Lightsail instances that have access
--   to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the SetResourceAccessForBucket action to update the instances that
--   have access to a bucket.
[$sel:resourcesReceivingAccess:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe [ResourceReceivingAccess]

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle of a bucket.
[$sel:bundleId:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the access rules of the bucket.
[$sel:accessRules:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe AccessRules

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to a bucket can
--   be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   You can update a bucket's bundle only one time within a monthly AWS
--   billing cycle.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change a bucket's bundle.
[$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the bucket.
[$sel:name:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to
--   support when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Tags in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:Bucket'] :: Bucket -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | Create a value of <a>Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_state</a> - An object that
--   describes the state of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectVersioning:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_objectVersioning</a> -
--   Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be configured:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Object versioning is enabled.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Object versioning was previously enabled but
--   is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   <li><tt>NeverEnabled</tt> - Object versioning has never been
--   enabled.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type of the bucket (for example, <tt>Bucket</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_createdAt</a> - The timestamp
--   when the distribution was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_location</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readonlyAccessAccounts:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_readonlyAccessAccounts</a> - An array of strings that
--   specify the AWS account IDs that have read-only access to the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_url</a> - The URL of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourcesReceivingAccess:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_resourcesReceivingAccess</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe Lightsail instances that have access to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the SetResourceAccessForBucket action to update the instances that
--   have access to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_bundleId</a> - The ID of the
--   bundle currently applied to the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle of a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessRules:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_accessRules</a> - An object
--   that describes the access rules of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_ableToUpdateBundle</a> - Indicates whether the bundle that
--   is currently applied to a bucket can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   You can update a bucket's bundle only one time within a monthly AWS
--   billing cycle.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change a bucket's bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_name</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to support
--   when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_tags</a> - The tag keys and
--   optional values for the bucket. For more information, see <a>Tags in
--   Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
newBucket :: Bucket

-- | An object that describes the state of the bucket.
bucket_state :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe BucketState)

-- | Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be configured:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Object versioning is enabled.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Object versioning was previously enabled but
--   is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   <li><tt>NeverEnabled</tt> - Object versioning has never been
--   enabled.</li>
--   </ul>
bucket_objectVersioning :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type of the bucket (for example,
--   <tt>Bucket</tt>).
bucket_resourceType :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.
bucket_arn :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
bucket_createdAt :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
bucket_location :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | An array of strings that specify the AWS account IDs that have
--   read-only access to the bucket.
bucket_readonlyAccessAccounts :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [Text])

-- | The URL of the bucket.
bucket_url :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe Lightsail instances that have access
--   to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the SetResourceAccessForBucket action to update the instances that
--   have access to a bucket.
bucket_resourcesReceivingAccess :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [ResourceReceivingAccess])

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle of a bucket.
bucket_bundleId :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the access rules of the bucket.
bucket_accessRules :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe AccessRules)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to a bucket can
--   be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   You can update a bucket's bundle only one time within a monthly AWS
--   billing cycle.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change a bucket's bundle.
bucket_ableToUpdateBundle :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the bucket.
bucket_name :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to
--   support when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code
--   enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information more
--   easily.
bucket_supportCode :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the bucket. For more information,
--   see <a>Tags in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</i>.
bucket_tags :: Lens' Bucket (Maybe [Tag])
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Bucket.Bucket


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData
newtype TreatMissingData
TreatMissingData' :: Text -> TreatMissingData
[fromTreatMissingData] :: TreatMissingData -> Text
pattern TreatMissingData_Breaching :: TreatMissingData
pattern TreatMissingData_Ignore :: TreatMissingData
pattern TreatMissingData_Missing :: TreatMissingData
pattern TreatMissingData_NotBreaching :: TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.TreatMissingData.TreatMissingData


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types.Alarm

-- | Describes an alarm.
--   
--   An alarm is a way to monitor your Lightsail resource metrics. For more
--   information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlarm</a> smart constructor.
data Alarm
Alarm' :: Maybe AlarmState -> Maybe TreatMissingData -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe [ContactProtocol] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe MetricName -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [AlarmState] -> Maybe MetricStatistic -> Maybe MetricUnit -> Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo -> Alarm

-- | The current state of the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe AlarmState

-- | Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:treatMissingData:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe TreatMissingData

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
[$sel:arn:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the alarm was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that lists information about the location of the alarm.
[$sel:location:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
[$sel:contactProtocols:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe [ContactProtocol]

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
[$sel:period:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
[$sel:evaluationPeriods:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the metric associated with the alarm.
[$sel:metricName:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricName

-- | The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the alarm.
[$sel:name:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
[$sel:threshold:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
[$sel:datapointsToAlarm:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.
[$sel:notificationEnabled:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Bool

-- | The alarm states that trigger a notification.
[$sel:notificationTriggers:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe [AlarmState]

-- | The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:statistic:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricStatistic

-- | The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.
[$sel:unit:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricUnit

-- | An object that lists information about the resource monitored by the
--   alarm.
[$sel:monitoredResourceInfo:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>Alarm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_state</a> - The current state of
--   the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatMissingData:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_treatMissingData</a> -
--   Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_createdAt</a> - The timestamp
--   when the alarm was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_location</a> - An object that
--   lists information about the location of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactProtocols:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_contactProtocols</a> -
--   The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_period</a> - The period, in
--   seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_evaluationPeriods</a> -
--   The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_metricName</a> - The name of
--   the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_comparisonOperator</a>
--   - The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_name</a> - The name of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_threshold</a> - The value
--   against which the specified statistic is compared.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datapointsToAlarm:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_datapointsToAlarm</a> -
--   The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_supportCode</a> - The support
--   code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our support
--   team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationEnabled:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the alarm is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTriggers:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationTriggers</a> - The alarm states that trigger a
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_statistic</a> - The statistic
--   for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_unit</a> - The unit of the metric
--   associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitoredResourceInfo:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_monitoredResourceInfo</a> - An object that lists information
--   about the resource monitored by the alarm.
newAlarm :: Alarm

-- | The current state of the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_state :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe AlarmState)

-- | Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_treatMissingData :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe TreatMissingData)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
alarm_resourceType :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
alarm_arn :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the alarm was created.
alarm_createdAt :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that lists information about the location of the alarm.
alarm_location :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
alarm_contactProtocols :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe [ContactProtocol])

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
alarm_period :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Natural)

-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
alarm_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the metric associated with the alarm.
alarm_metricName :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricName)

-- | The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
alarm_comparisonOperator :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ComparisonOperator)

-- | The name of the alarm.
alarm_name :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
alarm_threshold :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Double)

-- | The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
alarm_datapointsToAlarm :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
alarm_supportCode :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.
alarm_notificationEnabled :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Bool)

-- | The alarm states that trigger a notification.
alarm_notificationTriggers :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe [AlarmState])

-- | The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_statistic :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricStatistic)

-- | The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.
alarm_unit :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricUnit)

-- | An object that lists information about the resource monitored by the
--   alarm.
alarm_monitoredResourceInfo :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo)

module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Types

-- | API version <tt>2016-11-28</tt> of the Amazon Lightsail SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when the user cannot be authenticated
--   or uses invalid credentials to access a resource.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when an account is still in the setup
--   in progress state.
_AccountSetupInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when it cannot find a resource.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when an operation fails to execute.
_OperationFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A general service exception.
_ServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when the user has not been
--   authenticated.
_UnauthenticatedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when user input does not conform to
--   the validation rules of an input field.
--   
--   Domain and distribution APIs are only available in the N. Virginia
--   (<tt>us-east-1</tt>) AWS Region. Please set your AWS Region
--   configuration to <tt>us-east-1</tt> to create, view, or edit these
--   resources.
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Describes an access key for an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   Access keys grant full programmatic access to the specified bucket and
--   its objects. You can have a maximum of two access keys per bucket. Use
--   the CreateBucketAccessKey action to create an access key for a
--   specific bucket. For more information about access keys, see
--   <a>Creating access keys for a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The <tt>secretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to the
--   <tt>CreateBucketAccessKey</tt> action. You can get a secret access key
--   only when you first create an access key; you cannot get the secret
--   access key later. If you lose the secret access key, you must create a
--   new access key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKey</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKey
AccessKey' :: Maybe StatusType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe StatusType

-- | The timestamp when the access key was created.
[$sel:createdAt:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The secret access key used to sign requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
[$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
[$sel:lastUsed:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The ID of the access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKey'] :: AccessKey -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKey</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_status</a> - The status of
--   the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the access key was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKey'</a>,
--   <a>accessKey_secretAccessKey</a> - The secret access key used to sign
--   requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsed:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_lastUsed</a> - An object
--   that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_accessKeyId</a> - The
--   ID of the access key.
newAccessKey :: AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKey_status :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe StatusType)

-- | The timestamp when the access key was created.
accessKey_createdAt :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The secret access key used to sign requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
accessKey_secretAccessKey :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
accessKey_lastUsed :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed)

-- | The ID of the access key.
accessKey_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the last time an access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyLastUsed</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyLastUsed
AccessKeyLastUsed' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The date and time when the access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is null if the access key has not been used.
[$sel:lastUsedDate:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The name of the AWS service with which this access key was most
--   recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
[$sel:serviceName:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe Text

-- | The AWS Region where this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
[$sel:region:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyLastUsed</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsedDate:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is null if the access key has not been used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName</a> - The name of the AWS service
--   with which this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>, <a>accessKeyLastUsed_region</a>
--   - The AWS Region where this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
newAccessKeyLastUsed :: AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The date and time when the access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is null if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the AWS service with which this access key was most
--   recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region where this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
accessKeyLastUsed_region :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the anonymous access permissions for an Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket and its objects.
--   
--   For more information about bucket access permissions, see
--   <a>Understanding bucket permissions in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessRules</a> smart constructor.
data AccessRules
AccessRules' :: Maybe AccessType -> Maybe Bool -> AccessRules

-- | Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:getObject:AccessRules'] :: AccessRules -> Maybe AccessType

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL)
--   permissions that are applied to individual objects override the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> option that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
[$sel:allowPublicOverrides:AccessRules'] :: AccessRules -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessRules</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:getObject:AccessRules'</a>, <a>accessRules_getObject</a> -
--   Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowPublicOverrides:AccessRules'</a>,
--   <a>accessRules_allowPublicOverrides</a> - A Boolean value that
--   indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are
--   applied to individual objects override the <tt>getObject</tt> option
--   that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
newAccessRules :: AccessRules

-- | Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
accessRules_getObject :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe AccessType)

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether the access control list (ACL)
--   permissions that are applied to individual objects override the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> option that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
accessRules_allowPublicOverrides :: Lens' AccessRules (Maybe Bool)

-- | Describes an add-on that is enabled for an Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddOn</a> smart constructor.
data AddOn
AddOn' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AddOn

-- | The status of the add-on.
[$sel:status:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
[$sel:nextSnapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
[$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the add-on.
[$sel:name:AddOn'] :: AddOn -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AddOn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_status</a> - The status of the
--   add-on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSnapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'</a>,
--   <a>addOn_nextSnapshotTimeOfDay</a> - The next daily time an automatic
--   snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_snapshotTimeOfDay</a> -
--   The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_name</a> - The name of the add-on.
newAddOn :: AddOn

-- | The status of the add-on.
addOn_status :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The next daily time an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
addOn_nextSnapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
addOn_snapshotTimeOfDay :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the add-on.
addOn_name :: Lens' AddOn (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes a request to enable, modify, or disable an add-on for an
--   Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   An additional cost may be associated with enabling add-ons. For more
--   information, see the <a>Lightsail pricing page</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddOnRequest</a> smart constructor.
data AddOnRequest
AddOnRequest' :: Maybe AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest -> AddOnType -> AddOnRequest

-- | An object that represents additional parameters when enabling or
--   modifying the automatic snapshot add-on.
[$sel:autoSnapshotAddOnRequest:AddOnRequest'] :: AddOnRequest -> Maybe AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | The add-on type.
[$sel:addOnType:AddOnRequest'] :: AddOnRequest -> AddOnType

-- | Create a value of <a>AddOnRequest</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>addOnRequest_autoSnapshotAddOnRequest</a> - An object that
--   represents additional parameters when enabling or modifying the
--   automatic snapshot add-on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOnType:AddOnRequest'</a>, <a>addOnRequest_addOnType</a> -
--   The add-on type.
newAddOnRequest :: AddOnType -> AddOnRequest

-- | An object that represents additional parameters when enabling or
--   modifying the automatic snapshot add-on.
addOnRequest_autoSnapshotAddOnRequest :: Lens' AddOnRequest (Maybe AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest)

-- | The add-on type.
addOnRequest_addOnType :: Lens' AddOnRequest AddOnType

-- | Describes an alarm.
--   
--   An alarm is a way to monitor your Lightsail resource metrics. For more
--   information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlarm</a> smart constructor.
data Alarm
Alarm' :: Maybe AlarmState -> Maybe TreatMissingData -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe [ContactProtocol] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe MetricName -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [AlarmState] -> Maybe MetricStatistic -> Maybe MetricUnit -> Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo -> Alarm

-- | The current state of the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:state:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe AlarmState

-- | Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:treatMissingData:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe TreatMissingData

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
[$sel:resourceType:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ResourceType

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
[$sel:arn:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | The timestamp when the alarm was created.
[$sel:createdAt:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe POSIX

-- | An object that lists information about the location of the alarm.
[$sel:location:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ResourceLocation

-- | The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
[$sel:contactProtocols:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe [ContactProtocol]

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
[$sel:period:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Natural

-- | The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
[$sel:evaluationPeriods:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Int

-- | The name of the metric associated with the alarm.
[$sel:metricName:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricName

-- | The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
[$sel:comparisonOperator:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe ComparisonOperator

-- | The name of the alarm.
[$sel:name:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | The value against which the specified statistic is compared.
[$sel:threshold:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Double

-- | The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
[$sel:datapointsToAlarm:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Int

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
[$sel:supportCode:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Text

-- | Indicates whether the alarm is enabled.
[$sel:notificationEnabled:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe Bool

-- | The alarm states that trigger a notification.
[$sel:notificationTriggers:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe [AlarmState]

-- | The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:statistic:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricStatistic

-- | The unit of the metric associated with the alarm.
[$sel:unit:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MetricUnit

-- | An object that lists information about the resource monitored by the
--   alarm.
[$sel:monitoredResourceInfo:Alarm'] :: Alarm -> Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>Alarm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_state</a> - The current state of
--   the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatMissingData:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_treatMissingData</a> -
--   Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_createdAt</a> - The timestamp
--   when the alarm was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_location</a> - An object that
--   lists information about the location of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactProtocols:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_contactProtocols</a> -
--   The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_period</a> - The period, in
--   seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_evaluationPeriods</a> -
--   The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_metricName</a> - The name of
--   the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_comparisonOperator</a>
--   - The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_name</a> - The name of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_threshold</a> - The value
--   against which the specified statistic is compared.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datapointsToAlarm:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_datapointsToAlarm</a> -
--   The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_supportCode</a> - The support
--   code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our support
--   team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationEnabled:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the alarm is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTriggers:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationTriggers</a> - The alarm states that trigger a
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_statistic</a> - The statistic
--   for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_unit</a> - The unit of the metric
--   associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitoredResourceInfo:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_monitoredResourceInfo</a> - An object that lists information
--   about the resource monitored by the alarm.
newAlarm :: Alarm

-- | The current state of the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_state :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe AlarmState)

-- | Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
alarm_treatMissingData :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe TreatMissingData)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
alarm_resourceType :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the alarm.
alarm_arn :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Text)

alarm_createdAt :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that lists information about the location of the alarm.
alarm_location :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe ResourceLocation)

--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
alarm_contactProtocols :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe [ContactProtocol])

-- | The period, in seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
alarm_period :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Natural)

--   threshold.
alarm_evaluationPeriods :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

-- | The name of the metric associated with the alarm.
alarm_metricName :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe MetricName)

--   and threshold.

alarm_datapointsToAlarm :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Int)

--   have questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our

alarm_notificationEnabled :: Lens' Alarm (Maybe Bool)

-- | The statistic for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--

--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your

--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
