-- | Returns information about one or more Amazon Lightsail buckets.
--   
--   For more information about buckets, see <a>Buckets in Amazon
--   Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>..
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.GetBuckets

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBuckets</a> smart constructor.
data GetBuckets
GetBuckets' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> GetBuckets

-- | The name of the bucket for which to return information.
--   
--   When omitted, the response includes all of your buckets in the AWS
--   Region where the request is made.
[$sel:bucketName:GetBuckets'] :: GetBuckets -> Maybe Text

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether to include Lightsail instances
--   that were given access to the bucket using the
--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.
[$sel:includeConnectedResources:GetBuckets'] :: GetBuckets -> Maybe Bool

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetBuckets</tt> request.
--   If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page
--   token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.
[$sel:pageToken:GetBuckets'] :: GetBuckets -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBuckets</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:GetBuckets'</a>, <a>getBuckets_bucketName</a> - The
--   name of the bucket for which to return information.
--   
--   When omitted, the response includes all of your buckets in the AWS
--   Region where the request is made.
--   
--   <a>$sel:includeConnectedResources:GetBuckets'</a>,
--   <a>getBuckets_includeConnectedResources</a> - A Boolean value that
--   indicates whether to include Lightsail instances that were given
--   access to the bucket using the SetResourceAccessForBucket action.
--   
--   <a>$sel:pageToken:GetBuckets'</a>, <a>getBuckets_pageToken</a> - The
--   token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetBuckets</tt> request.
--   If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page
--   token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.
newGetBuckets :: GetBuckets

--

--   Region where the request is made.

--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.

--   token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.

--   
--   <a>$sel:buckets:GetBucketsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketsResponse_buckets</a> - An array of objects that describe
--   buckets.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetBucketsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http status
--   code.
newGetBucketsResponse :: Int -> GetBucketsResponse

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   A next page token is not returned if there are no more results to
--   display.
--   
--   To get the next page of results, perform another <tt>GetBuckets</tt>
--   request and specify the next page token using the <tt>pageToken</tt>
--   parameter.
getBucketsResponse_nextPageToken :: Lens' GetBucketsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects that describe buckets.
getBucketsResponse_buckets :: Lens' GetBucketsResponse (Maybe [Bucket])

-- | The response's http status code.
getBucketsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetBucketsResponse Int

-- | Returns the data points of a specific metric for an Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket.
--   
--   Metrics report the utilization of a bucket. View and collect metric
--   data regularly to monitor the number of objects stored in a bucket
--   (including object versions) and the storage space used by those
--   objects.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.GetBucketMetricData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBucketMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data GetBucketMetricData
GetBucketMetricData' :: Text -> BucketMetricName -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Natural -> [MetricStatistic] -> MetricUnit -> GetBucketMetricData

-- | The name of the bucket for which to get metric data.
[$sel:bucketName:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid bucket metric names are listed below, along with the most useful
--   statistics to include in your request, and the published unit value.
--   
--   These bucket metrics are reported once per day.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>BucketSizeBytes</tt></b> - The amount of data in bytes
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by summing the size of
--   all objects in the bucket (including object versions), including the
--   size of all parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the
--   bucket.Statistics: The most useful statistic is <tt>Maximum</tt>.Unit:
--   The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NumberOfObjects</tt></b> - The total number of objects
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by counting all objects
--   in the bucket (including object versions) and the total number of
--   parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the bucket.Statistics:
--   The most useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The published unit
--   is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:metricName:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> BucketMetricName

-- | The timestamp indicating the earliest data to be returned.
[$sel:startTime:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> POSIX

-- | The timestamp indicating the latest data to be returned.
[$sel:endTime:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> POSIX

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   Bucket storage metrics are reported once per day. Therefore, you
--   should specify a period of 86400 seconds, which is the number of
--   seconds in a day.
[$sel:period:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> Natural

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - The sum of all values submitted for the matching
--   metric. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of a
--   metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of <tt>Sum</tt> /
--   <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. By comparing this
--   statistic with the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values, you
--   can determine the full scope of a metric and how close the average use
--   is to the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:statistics:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> [MetricStatistic]

-- | The unit for the metric data request.
--   
--   Valid units depend on the metric data being requested. For the valid
--   units with each available metric, see the <tt>metricName</tt>
--   parameter.
[$sel:unit:GetBucketMetricData'] :: GetBucketMetricData -> MetricUnit

-- | Create a value of <a>GetBucketMetricData</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_bucketName</a> - The name of the bucket for
--   which to get metric data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_metricName</a> - The metric for which you want
--   to return information.
--   
--   Valid bucket metric names are listed below, along with the most useful
--   statistics to include in your request, and the published unit value.
--   
--   These bucket metrics are reported once per day.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>BucketSizeBytes</tt></b> - The amount of data in bytes
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by summing the size of
--   all objects in the bucket (including object versions), including the
--   size of all parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the
--   bucket.Statistics: The most useful statistic is <tt>Maximum</tt>.Unit:
--   The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NumberOfObjects</tt></b> - The total number of objects
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by counting all objects
--   in the bucket (including object versions) and the total number of
--   parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the bucket.Statistics:
--   The most useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The published unit
--   is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_startTime</a> - The timestamp indicating the
--   earliest data to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_endTime</a> - The timestamp indicating the
--   latest data to be returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_period</a> - The granularity, in seconds, of
--   the returned data points.
--   
--   Bucket storage metrics are reported once per day. Therefore, you
--   should specify a period of 86400 seconds, which is the number of
--   seconds in a day.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistics:GetBucketMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getBucketMetricData_statistics</a> - The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - The sum of all values submitted for the matching
--   metric. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of a
--   metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of <tt>Sum</tt> /
--   <tt>SampleCount</tt> during the specified period. By comparing this
--   statistic with the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values, you
--   can determine the full scope of a metric and how close the average use
--   is to the <tt>Minimum</tt> and <tt>Maximum</tt> values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:GetBucketMetricData'</a>, <a>getBucketMetricData_unit</a>
--   - The unit for the metric data request.
--   
--   Valid units depend on the metric data being requested. For the valid
--   units with each available metric, see the <tt>metricName</tt>
--   parameter.
newGetBucketMetricData :: Text -> BucketMetricName -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Natural -> MetricUnit -> GetBucketMetricData

-- | The name of the bucket for which to get metric data.
getBucketMetricData_bucketName :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData Text

-- | The metric for which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid bucket metric names are listed below, along with the most useful
--   statistics to include in your request, and the published unit value.

--   <li><b><tt>BucketSizeBytes</tt></b> - The amount of data in bytes
--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by summing the size of

--   stored in a bucket. This value is calculated by counting all objects
--   in the bucket (including object versions) and the total number of
--   parts for all incomplete multipart uploads to the bucket.Statistics:
--   The most useful statistic is <tt>Average</tt>.Unit: The published unit
--   is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
getBucketMetricData_metricName :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData BucketMetricName

-- | The timestamp indicating the earliest data to be returned.
getBucketMetricData_startTime :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData UTCTime

-- | The timestamp indicating the latest data to be returned.
getBucketMetricData_endTime :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData UTCTime

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   Bucket storage metrics are reported once per day. Therefore, you
--   should specify a period of 86400 seconds, which is the number of
--   seconds in a day.
getBucketMetricData_period :: Lens' GetBucketMetricData Natural

-- | The statistic for the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>

--   metric. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of a

-- | Returns the existing access key IDs for the specified Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket.
--   
--   This action does not return the secret access key value of an access
--   key. You can get a secret access key only when you create it from the
--   response of the CreateBucketAccessKey action. If you lose the secret
--   access key, you must create a new access key.

-- | Returns the list of available instance images, or <i>blueprints</i>.
--   You can use a blueprint to create a new instance already running a
--   specific operating system, as well as a preinstalled app or
--   development stack. The software each instance is running depends on
--   the blueprint image you choose.
--   
--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances and are not
--   necessarily available to create new instances. Blueprints are marked
--   inactive when they become outdated due to operating system updates or
--   new application releases.
--   
--   This operation returns paginated results.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.GetBlueprints

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetBlueprints</a> smart constructor.
data GetBlueprints
GetBlueprints' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> GetBlueprints

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether to include inactive results in your
--   request.
[$sel:includeInactive:GetBlueprints'] :: GetBlueprints -> Maybe Bool

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetBlueprints</tt>
--   request. If your results are paginated, the response will return a
--   next page token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent
--   request.
[$sel:pageToken:GetBlueprints'] :: GetBlueprints -> Maybe Text

-- | Returns information about the configured alarms. Specify an alarm name
--   in your request to return information about a specific alarm, or
--   specify a monitored resource name to return information about all
--   alarms for a specific resource.
--   
--   An alarm is used to monitor a single metric for one of your resources.
--   When a metric condition is met, the alarm can notify you by email, SMS
--   text message, and a banner displayed on the Amazon Lightsail console.
--   For more information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.GetAlarms

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetAlarms</a> smart constructor.
data GetAlarms
GetAlarms' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> GetAlarms

-- | The name of the alarm.
--   
--   Specify an alarm name to return information about a specific alarm.
[$sel:alarmName:GetAlarms'] :: GetAlarms -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the Lightsail resource being monitored by the alarm.
--   
--   Specify a monitored resource name to return information about all
--   alarms for a specific resource.
[$sel:monitoredResourceName:GetAlarms'] :: GetAlarms -> Maybe Text

-- | The token to advance to the next page of results from your request.
--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetAlarms</tt> request. If
--   your results are paginated, the response will return a next page token
--   that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.
[$sel:pageToken:GetAlarms'] :: GetAlarms -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>GetAlarms</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   
--   <a>$sel:monitoredResourceName:GetAlarms'</a>,
--   <a>getAlarms_monitoredResourceName</a> - The name of the Lightsail
--   resource being monitored by the alarm.
--

--   alarms for a specific resource.

--   token to advance to the next page of results from your request.

-- | Exports an Amazon Lightsail instance or block storage disk snapshot to
--   Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2). This operation results in
--   an export snapshot record that can be used with the <tt>create cloud
--   formation stack</tt> operation to create new Amazon EC2 instances.
--   
--   Exported instance snapshots appear in Amazon EC2 as Amazon Machine
--   Images (AMIs), and the instance system disk appears as an Amazon
--   Elastic Block Store (Amazon EBS) volume. Exported disk snapshots
--   appear in Amazon EC2 as Amazon EBS volumes. Snapshots are exported to
--   the same Amazon Web Services Region in Amazon EC2 as the source
--   Lightsail snapshot.
--   
--   The <tt>export snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   <tt>source snapshot name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get instance snapshots</tt> or <tt>get disk snapshots</tt>
--   operations to get a list of snapshots that you can export to Amazon
--   EC2.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.ExportSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data ExportSnapshot
ExportSnapshot' :: Text -> ExportSnapshot

-- | The name of the instance or disk snapshot to be exported to Amazon
--   EC2.
[$sel:sourceSnapshotName:ExportSnapshot'] :: ExportSnapshot -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ExportSnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceSnapshotName:ExportSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>exportSnapshot_sourceSnapshotName</a> - The name of the instance or
--   disk snapshot to be exported to Amazon EC2.
newExportSnapshot :: Text -> ExportSnapshot

-- | The name of the instance or disk snapshot to be exported to Amazon
--   EC2.
exportSnapshot_sourceSnapshotName :: Lens' ExportSnapshot Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newExportSnapshotResponse</a> smart constructor.
data ExportSnapshotResponse
ExportSnapshotResponse' :: Maybe [Operation] -> Int -> ExportSnapshotResponse

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.

-- | Detaches the specified instances from a Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   This operation waits until the instances are no longer needed before
--   they are detached from the load balancer.
--   
--   The <tt>detach instances from load balancer</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer
DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer' :: Text -> [Text] -> DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer

[$sel:loadBalancerName:DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer'] :: DetachInstancesFromLoadBalancer -> Text

--   detach from the load balancer.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   the load balancer.

-- | Detaches a stopped block storage disk from a Lightsail instance. Make
--   sure to unmount any file systems on the device within your operating
--   system before stopping the instance and detaching the disk.
--   
--   The <tt>detach disk</tt> operation supports tag-based access control
--   via resource tags applied to the resource identified by <tt>disk
--   name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer
--   Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DetachDisk

-- | Detaches an SSL/TLS certificate from your Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   After the certificate is detached, your distribution stops accepting
--   traffic for all of the domains that are associated with the
--   certificate.

-- | Deletes a database in Amazon Lightsail.
--   
--   The <tt>delete relational database</tt> operation supports tag-based
--   access control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   relationalDatabaseName. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteRelationalDatabase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteRelationalDatabase</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteRelationalDatabase
DeleteRelationalDatabase' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Text -> DeleteRelationalDatabase

-- | Determines whether a final database snapshot is created before your
--   database is deleted. If <tt>true</tt> is specified, no database
--   snapshot is created. If <tt>false</tt> is specified, a database
--   snapshot is created before your database is deleted.
--   
--   You must specify the <tt>final relational database snapshot name</tt>
--   parameter if the <tt>skip final snapshot</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
[$sel:skipFinalSnapshot:DeleteRelationalDatabase'] :: DeleteRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the database snapshot created if <tt>skip final
--   snapshot</tt> is <tt>false</tt>, which is the default value for that
--   parameter.
--   
--   Specifying this parameter and also specifying the <tt>skip final
--   snapshot</tt> parameter to <tt>true</tt> results in an error.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 2 to 255 alphanumeric characters, or
--   hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first and last character must be a letter or number.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:finalRelationalDatabaseSnapshotName:DeleteRelationalDatabase'] :: DeleteRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database that you are deleting.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseName:DeleteRelationalDatabase'] :: DeleteRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteRelationalDatabase</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:skipFinalSnapshot:DeleteRelationalDatabase'</a>,
--   <a>deleteRelationalDatabase_skipFinalSnapshot</a> - Determines whether
--   a final database snapshot is created before your database is deleted.
--   If <tt>true</tt> is specified, no database snapshot is created. If
--   <tt>false</tt> is specified, a database snapshot is created before
--   your database is deleted.
--   
--   You must specify the <tt>final relational database snapshot name</tt>
--   parameter if the <tt>skip final snapshot</tt> parameter is
--   <tt>false</tt>.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:finalRelationalDatabaseSnapshotName:DeleteRelationalDatabase'</a>,
--   <a>deleteRelationalDatabase_finalRelationalDatabaseSnapshotName</a> -
--   The name of the database snapshot created if <tt>skip final
--   snapshot</tt> is <tt>false</tt>, which is the default value for that

--   the database that you are deleting.
newDeleteRelationalDatabase :: Text -> DeleteRelationalDatabase

-- | Determines whether a final database snapshot is created before your
--   database is deleted. If <tt>true</tt> is specified, no database
--   snapshot is created. If <tt>false</tt> is specified, a database
--   snapshot is created before your database is deleted.

--   <tt>false</tt>.
--

-- | Deletes an SSL/TLS certificate associated with a Lightsail load
--   balancer.
--   
--   The <tt>DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate
DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> Text -> DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, forces the deletion of an SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   There can be two certificates associated with a Lightsail load
--   balancer: the primary and the backup. The <tt>force</tt> parameter is
--   required when the primary SSL/TLS certificate is in use by an instance
--   attached to the load balancer.
[$sel:force:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe Bool

-- | The load balancer name.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | The SSL/TLS certificate name.
[$sel:certificateName:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:force:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_force</a> - When <tt>true</tt>,
--   forces the deletion of an SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   There can be two certificates associated with a Lightsail load
--   balancer: the primary and the backup. The <tt>force</tt> parameter is
--   required when the primary SSL/TLS certificate is in use by an instance
--   attached to the load balancer.
--   
--   <a>$sel:loadBalancerName:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName</a> - The load
--   balancer name.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>deleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_certificateName</a> - The SSL/TLS
--   certificate name.
newDeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate :: Text -> Text -> DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, forces the deletion of an SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   There can be two certificates associated with a Lightsail load
--   balancer: the primary and the backup. The <tt>force</tt> parameter is
--   required when the primary SSL/TLS certificate is in use by an instance
--   attached to the load balancer.
deleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_force :: Lens' DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Bool)

deleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName :: Lens' DeleteLoadBalancerTlsCertificate Text

-- | Deletes a Lightsail load balancer and all its associated SSL/TLS
--   certificates. Once the load balancer is deleted, you will need to
--   create a new load balancer, create a new certificate, and verify
--   domain ownership again.
--   
--   The <tt>delete load balancer</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Deletes the known host key or certificate used by the Amazon Lightsail
--   browser-based SSH or RDP clients to authenticate an instance. This
--   operation enables the Lightsail browser-based SSH or RDP clients to
--   connect to the instance after a host key mismatch.
--   
--   Perform this operation only if you were expecting the host key or
--   certificate mismatch or if you are familiar with the new host key or
--   certificate on the instance. For more information, see
--   <a>Troubleshooting connection issues when using the Amazon Lightsail
--   browser-based SSH or RDP client</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteKnownHostKeys

-- | Deletes the specified disk snapshot.
--   
--   When you make periodic snapshots of a disk, the snapshots are
--   incremental, and only the blocks on the device that have changed since
--   your last snapshot are saved in the new snapshot. When you delete a
--   snapshot, only the data not needed for any other snapshot is removed.
--   So regardless of which prior snapshots have been deleted, all active
--   snapshots will have access to all the information needed to restore
--   the disk.
--   
--   The <tt>delete disk snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via resource tags applied to the resource identified by
--   <tt>disk snapshot name</tt>. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteDiskSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDiskSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDiskSnapshot
DeleteDiskSnapshot' :: Text -> DeleteDiskSnapshot

-- | The name of the disk snapshot you want to delete (e.g.,
--   <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
[$sel:diskSnapshotName:DeleteDiskSnapshot'] :: DeleteDiskSnapshot -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDiskSnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskSnapshotName:DeleteDiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDiskSnapshot_diskSnapshotName</a> - The name of the disk
--   snapshot you want to delete (e.g., <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
newDeleteDiskSnapshot :: Text -> DeleteDiskSnapshot

-- | The name of the disk snapshot you want to delete (e.g.,
--   <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>).
deleteDiskSnapshot_diskSnapshotName :: Lens' DeleteDiskSnapshot Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteDiskSnapshotResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse
DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse' :: Maybe [Operation] -> Int -> DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse

-- | An array of objects that describe the result of the action, such as
--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.
[$sel:operations:DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse'] :: DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse -> Maybe [Operation]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse'] :: DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:operations:DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDiskSnapshotResponse_operations</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the result of the action, such as the status of the
--   request, the timestamp of the request, and the resources affected by
--   the request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteDiskSnapshotResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.

--   the status of the request, the timestamp of the request, and the
--   resources affected by the request.

deleteDiskSnapshotResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DeleteDiskSnapshotResponse Int

instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteDiskSnapshot.DeleteDiskSnapshot

instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteDiskSnapshot.DeleteDiskSnapshot

--   minutes.

-- | Deletes a container image that is registered to your Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteContainerImage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContainerImage</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContainerImage
DeleteContainerImage' :: Text -> Text -> DeleteContainerImage

-- | The name of the container service for which to delete a registered
--   container image.
[$sel:serviceName:DeleteContainerImage'] :: DeleteContainerImage -> Text

-- | The name of the container image to delete from the container service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerImages</tt> action to get the name of the
--   container images that are registered to a container service.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
[$sel:image:DeleteContainerImage'] :: DeleteContainerImage -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContainerImage</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:DeleteContainerImage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContainerImage_serviceName</a> - The name of the container
--   service for which to delete a registered container image.
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:DeleteContainerImage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContainerImage_image</a> - The name of the container image to
--   delete from the container service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerImages</tt> action to get the name of the
--   container images that are registered to a container service.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
newDeleteContainerImage :: Text -> Text -> DeleteContainerImage

-- | The name of the container service for which to delete a registered
--   container image.
deleteContainerImage_serviceName :: Lens' DeleteContainerImage Text

-- | The name of the container image to delete from the container service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerImages</tt> action to get the name of the
--   container images that are registered to a container service.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
deleteContainerImage_image :: Lens' DeleteContainerImage Text

-- | Deletes a contact method.
--   
--   A contact method is used to send you notifications about your Amazon
--   Lightsail resources. You can add one email address and one mobile
--   phone number contact method in each AWS Region. However, SMS text
--   messaging is not supported in some AWS Regions, and SMS text messages
--   cannot be sent to some countries/regions. For more information, see
--   <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteContactMethod

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContactMethod</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContactMethod
DeleteContactMethod' :: ContactProtocol -> DeleteContactMethod

-- | The protocol that will be deleted, such as <tt>Email</tt> or
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   To delete an <tt>Email</tt> and an <tt>SMS</tt> contact method if you
--   added both, you must run separate <tt>DeleteContactMethod</tt> actions
--   to delete each protocol.
[$sel:protocol:DeleteContactMethod'] :: DeleteContactMethod -> ContactProtocol

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContactMethod</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:DeleteContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContactMethod_protocol</a> - The protocol that will be
--   deleted, such as <tt>Email</tt> or <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   To delete an <tt>Email</tt> and an <tt>SMS</tt> contact method if you
--   added both, you must run separate <tt>DeleteContactMethod</tt> actions
--   to delete each protocol.
newDeleteContactMethod :: ContactProtocol -> DeleteContactMethod

-- | The protocol that will be deleted, such as <tt>Email</tt> or
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging).
--   
--   To delete an <tt>Email</tt> and an <tt>SMS</tt> contact method if you
--   added both, you must run separate <tt>DeleteContactMethod</tt> actions
--   to delete each protocol.

-- | Deletes a Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   When you delete your bucket, the bucket name is released and can be
--   reused for a new bucket in your account or another AWS account.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.DeleteBucket

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteBucket</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteBucket
DeleteBucket' :: Maybe Bool -> Text -> DeleteBucket

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether to force delete the bucket.
--   
--   You must force delete the bucket if it has one of the following
--   conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The bucket is the origin of a distribution.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has instances that were granted access to it using the
--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has objects.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has access keys.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Force deleting a bucket might impact other resources that rely on the
--   bucket, such as instances, distributions, or software that use the
--   issued access keys.
[$sel:forceDelete:DeleteBucket'] :: DeleteBucket -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the bucket to delete.
--   
--   Use the GetBuckets action to get a list of bucket names that you can
--   specify.
[$sel:bucketName:DeleteBucket'] :: DeleteBucket -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteBucket</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDelete:DeleteBucket'</a>, <a>deleteBucket_forceDelete</a>
--   - A Boolean value that indicates whether to force delete the bucket.
--   
--   You must force delete the bucket if it has one of the following
--   conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The bucket is the origin of a distribution.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has instances that were granted access to it using the
--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has objects.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has access keys.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Force deleting a bucket might impact other resources that rely on the
--   bucket, such as instances, distributions, or software that use the
--   issued access keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:DeleteBucket'</a>, <a>deleteBucket_bucketName</a> -
--   The name of the bucket to delete.
--   
--   Use the GetBuckets action to get a list of bucket names that you can
--   specify.
newDeleteBucket :: Text -> DeleteBucket

-- | A Boolean value that indicates whether to force delete the bucket.
--   
--   You must force delete the bucket if it has one of the following
--   conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The bucket is the origin of a distribution.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has instances that were granted access to it using the
--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has objects.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has access keys.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Force deleting a bucket might impact other resources that rely on the
--   bucket, such as instances, distributions, or software that use the
--   issued access keys.
deleteBucket_forceDelete :: Lens' DeleteBucket (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the bucket to delete.
--   
--   Use the GetBuckets action to get a list of bucket names that you can
--   specify.

-- | Deletes an alarm.
--   
--   An alarm is used to monitor a single metric for one of your resources.
--   When a metric condition is met, the alarm can notify you by email, SMS
--   text message, and a banner displayed on the Amazon Lightsail console.
--   For more information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.

-- | Creates a snapshot of your database in Amazon Lightsail. You can use

--   before deleting a database.

--   tag-based access control via request tags. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.

-- | Creates a new database from an existing database snapshot in Amazon
--   Lightsail.
--   
--   You can create a new database from a snapshot in if something goes
--   wrong with your original database, or to change it to a different
--   plan, such as a high availability or standard plan.
--   
--   The <tt>create relational database from snapshot</tt> operation
--   supports tag-based access control via request tags and resource tags
--   applied to the resource identified by relationalDatabaseSnapshotName.
--   For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot
CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot

-- | The name of the source database.
[$sel:sourceRelationalDatabaseName:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The bundle ID for your new database. A bundle describes the
--   performance specifications for your database.
--   
--   You can get a list of database bundle IDs by using the <tt>get
--   relational database bundles</tt> operation.
--   
--   When creating a new database from a snapshot, you cannot choose a
--   bundle that is smaller than the bundle of the source database.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseBundleId:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your new database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether your database is restored from the latest backup
--   time. A value of <tt>true</tt> restores from the latest backup time.
--   
--   Default: <tt>false</tt>
--   
--   Constraints: Cannot be specified if the <tt>restore time</tt>
--   parameter is provided.
[$sel:useLatestRestorableTime:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time to restore your database from.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be before the latest restorable time for the database.</li>
--   <li>Cannot be specified if the <tt>use latest restorable time</tt>
--   parameter is <tt>true</tt>.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a restore time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the restore time.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:restoreTime:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The Availability Zone in which to create your new database. Use the
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> case-sensitive format.
--   
--   You can get a list of Availability Zones by using the <tt>get
--   regions</tt> operation. Be sure to add the <tt>include relational
--   database Availability Zones</tt> parameter to your request.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the database snapshot from which to create your new
--   database.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseSnapshotName:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name to use for your new Lightsail database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 2 to 255 alphanumeric characters, or
--   hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first and last character must be a letter or number.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:relationalDatabaseName:CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot'] :: CreateRelationalDatabaseFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | Creates a new database in Amazon Lightsail.
--   
--   The <tt>create relational database</tt> operation supports tag-based
--   access control via request tags. For more information, see the
--   <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateRelationalDatabase

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateRelationalDatabase</a> smart constructor.
data CreateRelationalDatabase
CreateRelationalDatabase' :: Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateRelationalDatabase

-- | The password for the master user. The password can include any
--   printable ASCII character except "/", """, or "@". It cannot contain
--   spaces.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 41 characters.
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints: Must contain from 8 to 128 characters.
[$sel:masterUserPassword:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | Specifies the accessibility options for your new database. A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> specifies a database that is available to resources
--   outside of your Lightsail account. A value of <tt>false</tt> specifies
--   a database that is available only to your Lightsail resources in the
--   same region as your database.
[$sel:publiclyAccessible:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Bool

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on
--   your new database.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region, occurring on a random day of the
--   week.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>Valid days: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Example: <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt></li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:preferredMaintenanceWindow:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   your new database if automated backups are enabled.
--   
--   The default is a 30-minute window selected at random from an 8-hour
--   block of time for each AWS Region. For more information about the
--   preferred backup window time blocks for each region, see the
--   <a>Working With Backups</a> guide in the Amazon Relational Database
--   Service (Amazon RDS) documentation.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in the <tt>hh24:mi-hh24:mi</tt> format.Example:
--   <tt>16:00-16:30</tt></li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Must not conflict with the preferred maintenance window.</li>
--   <li>Must be at least 30 minutes.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:preferredBackupWindow:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The Availability Zone in which to create your new database. Use the
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> case-sensitive format.
--   
--   You can get a list of Availability Zones by using the <tt>get
--   regions</tt> operation. Be sure to add the <tt>include relational
--   database Availability Zones</tt> parameter to your request.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name to use for your new Lightsail database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain from 2 to 255 alphanumeric characters, or
--   hyphens.</li>
--   <li>The first and last character must be a letter or number.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:relationalDatabaseName:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | The blueprint ID for your new database. A blueprint describes the
--   major engine version of a database.
--   
--   You can get a list of database blueprints IDs by using the <tt>get
--   relational database blueprints</tt> operation.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseBlueprintId:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | The bundle ID for your new database. A bundle describes the
--   performance specifications for your database.
--   
--   You can get a list of database bundle IDs by using the <tt>get
--   relational database bundles</tt> operation.
[$sel:relationalDatabaseBundleId:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | The meaning of this parameter differs according to the database engine
--   you use.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   The name of the database to create when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created. If this parameter isn't specified, no database is
--   created in the database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 64 letters or numbers.</li>
--   <li>Must begin with a letter. Subsequent characters can be letters,
--   underscores, or digits (0- 9).</li>
--   <li>Can't be a word reserved by the specified database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL, see the Keywords and
--   Reserved Words articles for <a>MySQL 5.6</a>, <a>MySQL 5.7</a>, and
--   <a>MySQL 8.0</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   The name of the database to create when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created. If this parameter isn't specified, a database
--   named <tt>postgres</tt> is created in the database resource.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must contain 1 to 63 letters or numbers.</li>
--   <li>Must begin with a letter. Subsequent characters can be letters,
--   underscores, or digits (0- 9).</li>
--   <li>Can't be a word reserved by the specified database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in PostgreSQL, see the SQL Key Words
--   articles for <a>PostgreSQL 9.6</a>, <a>PostgreSQL 10</a>,
--   <a>PostgreSQL 11</a>, and <a>PostgreSQL 12</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:masterDatabaseName:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | The name for the master user.
--   
--   <b>MySQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Required for MySQL.</li>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 16 letters or numbers. Can contain underscores.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Can't be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL 5.6 or 5.7, see the Keywords
--   and Reserved Words articles for <a>MySQL 5.6</a>, <a>MySQL 5.7</a>, or
--   <a>MySQL 8.0</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <b>PostgreSQL</b>
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Required for PostgreSQL.</li>
--   <li>Must be 1 to 63 letters or numbers. Can contain underscores.</li>
--   <li>First character must be a letter.</li>
--   <li>Can't be a reserved word for the chosen database engine.For more
--   information about reserved words in MySQL 5.6 or 5.7, see the Keywords
--   and Reserved Words articles for <a>PostgreSQL 9.6</a>, <a>PostgreSQL
--   10</a>, <a>PostgreSQL 11</a>, and <a>PostgreSQL 12</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:masterUsername:CreateRelationalDatabase'] :: CreateRelationalDatabase -> Text

-- | Creates an SSL/TLS certificate for an Amazon Lightsail load balancer.
--   
--   TLS is just an updated, more secure version of Secure Socket Layer
--   (SSL).
--   
--   The <tt>CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via resource tags applied to the resource
--   identified by <tt>load balancer name</tt>. For more information, see
--   the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate
CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | An array of strings listing alternative domains and subdomains for
--   your SSL/TLS certificate. Lightsail will de-dupe the names for you.
--   You can have a maximum of 9 alternative names (in addition to the 1
--   primary domain). We do not support wildcards (e.g.,
--   <tt>*.example.com</tt>).
[$sel:certificateAlternativeNames:CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The load balancer name where you want to create the SSL/TLS
--   certificate.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | The SSL/TLS certificate name.
--   
--   You can have up to 10 certificates in your account at one time. Each
--   Lightsail load balancer can have up to 2 certificates associated with
--   it at one time. There is also an overall limit to the number of
--   certificates that can be issue in a 365-day period. For more
--   information, see <a>Limits</a>.
[$sel:certificateName:CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | The domain name (e.g., <tt>example.com</tt>) for your SSL/TLS
--   certificate.
[$sel:certificateDomainName:CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate'] :: CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <tt>*.example.com</tt>).

--   created.

--   domain name (e.g., <tt>example.com</tt>) for your SSL/TLS certificate.
newCreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateLoadBalancerTlsCertificate

-- | An array of strings listing alternative domains and subdomains for
--   your SSL/TLS certificate. Lightsail will de-dupe the names for you.

--   primary domain). We do not support wildcards (e.g.,

-- | Creates a Lightsail load balancer. To learn more about deciding
--   whether to load balance your application, see <a>Configure your
--   Lightsail instances for load balancing</a>. You can create up to 5
--   load balancers per AWS Region in your account.
--   
--   When you create a load balancer, you can specify a unique name and
--   port settings. To change additional load balancer settings, use the
--   <tt>UpdateLoadBalancerAttribute</tt> operation.
--   
--   The <tt>create load balancer</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via request tags. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateLoadBalancer

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateLoadBalancer</a> smart constructor.
data CreateLoadBalancer
CreateLoadBalancer' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Int -> CreateLoadBalancer

-- | The path you provided to perform the load balancer health check. If
--   you didn't specify a health check path, Lightsail uses the root path
--   of your website (e.g., <tt>"/"</tt>).
--   
--   You may want to specify a custom health check path other than the root
--   of your application if your home page loads slowly or has a lot of
--   media or scripting on it.
[$sel:healthCheckPath:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   If you specify <tt>certificateName</tt>, then
--   <tt>certificateDomainName</tt> is required (and vice-versa).
[$sel:certificateName:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The domain name with which your certificate is associated (e.g.,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>).
--   
--   If you specify <tt>certificateDomainName</tt>, then
--   <tt>certificateName</tt> is required (and vice-versa).
[$sel:certificateDomainName:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe Text

-- | The optional alternative domains and subdomains to use with your
--   SSL/TLS certificate (e.g., <tt>www.example.com</tt>,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>, <tt>m.example.com</tt>,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>).
[$sel:certificateAlternativeNames:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The IP address type for the load balancer.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.
[$sel:ipAddressType:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name of your load balancer.
[$sel:loadBalancerName:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Text

-- | The instance port where you're creating your load balancer.
[$sel:instancePort:CreateLoadBalancer'] :: CreateLoadBalancer -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateLoadBalancer</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

-- | Creates one or more new instances from a manual or automatic snapshot
--   of an instance.
--   
--   The <tt>create instances from snapshot</tt> operation supports
--   tag-based access control via request tags and resource tags applied to
--   the resource identified by <tt>instance snapshot name</tt>. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateInstancesFromSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInstancesFromSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInstancesFromSnapshot
CreateInstancesFromSnapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddOnRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text [DiskMap]) -> Maybe [Tag] -> [Text] -> Text -> Text -> CreateInstancesFromSnapshot

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available
--   automatic snapshot.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new instance from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the instance snapshot on which you are basing your new
--   instances. Use the get instance snapshots operation to return
--   information about your existing snapshots.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>source
--   instance name</tt> parameter. The <tt>instance snapshot name</tt> and
--   <tt>source instance name</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:instanceSnapshotName:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons to enable for the new
--   instance.
[$sel:addOns:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe [AddOnRequest]

-- | You can create a launch script that configures a server with
--   additional user data. For example, <tt>apt-get -y update</tt>.
--   
--   Depending on the machine image you choose, the command to get software
--   on your instance varies. Amazon Linux and CentOS use <tt>yum</tt>,
--   Debian and Ubuntu use <tt>apt-get</tt>, and FreeBSD uses <tt>pkg</tt>.
--   For a complete list, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
[$sel:userData:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot to use for the new instance. Use
--   the <tt>get auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the
--   available automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>use latest
--   restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameter. The <tt>restore date</tt> and
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters are mutually
--   exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new instance from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:restoreDate:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.

[$sel:keyPairName:CreateInstancesFromSnapshot'] :: CreateInstancesFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | Creates one or more Amazon Lightsail instances.
--   
--   The <tt>create instances</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via request tags. For more information, see the <a>Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateInstances

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateInstances</a> smart constructor.
data CreateInstances
CreateInstances' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddOnRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> [Text] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateInstances

--   instance.

--   <tt>["MyFirstInstance","MySecondInstance"]</tt>
[$sel:instanceNames:CreateInstances'] :: CreateInstances -> [Text]

--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>). Use the <tt>get
--   blueprints</tt> operation to return a list of available images (or
--   <i>blueprints</i>).
--   
--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances and are not
--   necessarily available to create new instances. Blueprints are marked
--   inactive when they become outdated due to operating system updates or
--   new application releases.
[$sel:blueprintId:CreateInstances'] :: CreateInstances -> Text

--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type for the
--   instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPairName:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_keyPairName</a> - The name of your key pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_tags</a> - The
--   tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceNames:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_instanceNames</a> - The names to use for your new
--   Lightsail instances. Separate multiple values using quotation marks
--   and commas, for example:
--   <tt>["MyFirstInstance","MySecondInstance"]</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone in
--   which to create your instance. Use the following format:
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> (case sensitive). You can get a list of
--   Availability Zones by using the <a>get regions</a> operation. Be sure
--   to add the <tt>include Availability Zones</tt> parameter to your
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintId:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_blueprintId</a> - The ID for a virtual private
--   server image (e.g., <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or
--   <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>). Use the <tt>get blueprints</tt> operation to
--   return a list of available images (or <i>blueprints</i>).
--   
--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances and are not
--   necessarily available to create new instances. Blueprints are marked
--   inactive when they become outdated due to operating system updates or
--   new application releases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_bundleId</a>
--   - The bundle of specification information for your virtual private
--   server (or <i>instance</i>), including the pricing plan (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
newCreateInstances :: Text -> Text -> Text -> CreateInstances

-- | (Deprecated) The name for your custom image.
--   
--   In releases prior to June 12, 2017, this parameter was ignored by the
--   API. It is now deprecated.
createInstances_customImageName :: Lens' CreateInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons to enable for the new
--   instance.
createInstances_addOns :: Lens' CreateInstances (Maybe [AddOnRequest])

-- | A launch script you can create that configures a server with
--   additional user data. For example, you might want to run <tt>apt-get
--   -y update</tt>.
--   
--   Depending on the machine image you choose, the command to get software
--   on your instance varies. Amazon Linux and CentOS use <tt>yum</tt>,
--   Debian and Ubuntu use <tt>apt-get</tt>, and FreeBSD uses <tt>pkg</tt>.
--   For a complete list, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
createInstances_userData :: Lens' CreateInstances (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type for the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.

-- | The Availability Zone in which to create your instance. Use the

--   Be sure to add the <tt>include Availability Zones</tt> parameter to
--   your request.

--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints

--   new application releases.

--   its name in this parameter to manage the DNS records for that domain
--   using Lightsail.

-- | Creates an Amazon Lightsail content delivery network (CDN)
--   distribution.
--   
--   A distribution is a globally distributed network of caching servers
--   that improve the performance of your website or web application hosted
--   on a Lightsail instance. For more information, see <a>Content delivery
--   networks in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateDistribution

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDistribution</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDistribution
CreateDistribution' :: Maybe CacheSettings -> Maybe IpAddressType -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath] -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> InputOrigin -> CacheBehavior -> Text -> CreateDistribution

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviorSettings:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe CacheSettings

-- | The IP address type for the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.
[$sel:ipAddressType:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe IpAddressType

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:cacheBehaviors:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath]

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the distribution during
--   create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name for the distribution.
[$sel:distributionName:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> Text

-- | An object that describes the origin resource for the distribution,
--   such as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
[$sel:origin:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> InputOrigin

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior for the
--   distribution.
[$sel:defaultCacheBehavior:CreateDistribution'] :: CreateDistribution -> CacheBehavior

-- | The bundle ID to use for the distribution.
--   
--   A distribution bundle describes the specifications of your
--   distribution, such as the monthly cost and monthly network transfer
--   quota.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetDistributionBundles</tt> action to get a list of

-- | Creates a snapshot of a block storage disk. You can use snapshots for
--   backups, to make copies of disks, and to save data before shutting
--   down a Lightsail instance.
--   
--   You can take a snapshot of an attached disk that is in use; however,
--   snapshots only capture data that has been written to your disk at the
--   time the snapshot command is issued. This may exclude any data that
--   has been cached by any applications or the operating system. If you
--   can pause any file systems on the disk long enough to take a snapshot,
--   your snapshot should be complete. Nevertheless, if you cannot pause
--   all file writes to the disk, you should unmount the disk from within
--   the Lightsail instance, issue the create disk snapshot command, and
--   then remount the disk to ensure a consistent and complete snapshot.
--   You may remount and use your disk while the snapshot status is
--   pending.
--   
--   You can also use this operation to create a snapshot of an instance's
--   system volume. You might want to do this, for example, to recover data
--   from the system volume of a botched instance or to create a backup of
--   the system volume like you would for a block storage disk. To create a
--   snapshot of a system volume, just define the <tt>instance name</tt>
--   parameter when issuing the snapshot command, and a snapshot of the
--   defined instance's system volume will be created. After the snapshot
--   is available, you can create a block storage disk from the snapshot
--   and attach it to a running instance to access the data on the disk.
--   
--   The <tt>create disk snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based access
--   control via request tags. For more information, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateDiskSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDiskSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDiskSnapshot
CreateDiskSnapshot' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> CreateDiskSnapshot

-- | The unique name of the source disk (e.g., <tt>Disk-Virginia-1</tt>).
--   
--   This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>instance
--   name</tt> parameter. The <tt>disk name</tt> and <tt>instance name</tt>
--   parameters are mutually exclusive.
[$sel:diskName:CreateDiskSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique name of the source instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-512MB-Virginia-1</tt>). When this is defined, a
--   snapshot of the instance's system volume is created.
--   
--   This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>disk name</tt>
--   parameter. The <tt>instance name</tt> and <tt>disk name</tt>
--   parameters are mutually exclusive.
[$sel:instanceName:CreateDiskSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateDiskSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The name of the destination disk snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>my-disk-snapshot</tt>) based on the source disk.
[$sel:diskSnapshotName:CreateDiskSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskSnapshot -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>CreateDiskSnapshot</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional

--   disk (e.g., <tt>Disk-Virginia-1</tt>).

--   parameters are mutually exclusive.

--   <a>$sel:instanceName:CreateDiskSnapshot'</a>,
--   <a>createDiskSnapshot_instanceName</a> - The unique name of the source
--   instance (e.g., <tt>Amazon_Linux-512MB-Virginia-1</tt>). When this is
--   defined, a snapshot of the instance's system volume is created.

--   This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>disk name</tt>

--   parameters are mutually exclusive.

-- | Creates a block storage disk from a manual or automatic snapshot of a
--   disk. The resulting disk can be attached to an Amazon Lightsail
--   instance in the same Availability Zone (e.g., <tt>us-east-2a</tt>).
--   
--   The <tt>create disk from snapshot</tt> operation supports tag-based
--   access control via request tags and resource tags applied to the
--   resource identified by <tt>disk snapshot name</tt>. For more
--   information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail.CreateDiskFromSnapshot

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newCreateDiskFromSnapshot</a> smart constructor.
data CreateDiskFromSnapshot
CreateDiskFromSnapshot' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AddOnRequest] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Int -> CreateDiskFromSnapshot

-- | A Boolean value to indicate whether to use the latest available
--   automatic snapshot.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>restore
--   date</tt> parameter. The <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt>
--   and <tt>restore date</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new disk from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:useLatestRestorableAutoSnapshot:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the source disk from which the source automatic snapshot
--   was created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>disk
--   snapshot name</tt> parameter. The <tt>source disk name</tt> and
--   <tt>disk snapshot name</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new disk from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:sourceDiskName:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | An array of objects that represent the add-ons to enable for the new
--   disk.
[$sel:addOns:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe [AddOnRequest]

-- | The name of the disk snapshot (e.g., <tt>my-snapshot</tt>) from which
--   to create the new storage disk.
--   
--   Constraint:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>source disk
--   name</tt> parameter. The <tt>disk snapshot name</tt> and <tt>source
--   disk name</tt> parameters are mutually exclusive.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:diskSnapshotName:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

-- | The date of the automatic snapshot to use for the new disk. Use the
--   <tt>get auto snapshots</tt> operation to identify the dates of the
--   available automatic snapshots.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be specified in <tt>YYYY-MM-DD</tt> format.</li>
--   <li>This parameter cannot be defined together with the <tt>use latest
--   restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameter. The <tt>restore date</tt> and
--   <tt>use latest restorable auto snapshot</tt> parameters are mutually
--   exclusive.</li>
--   <li>Define this parameter only when creating a new disk from an
--   automatic snapshot. For more information, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:restoreDate:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe Text

--

--   created.
[$sel:tags:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The unique Lightsail disk name (e.g., <tt>my-disk</tt>).
[$sel:diskName:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | The Availability Zone where you want to create the disk (e.g.,
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt>). Choose the same Availability Zone as the
--   Lightsail instance where you want to create the disk.
--   
--   Use the GetRegions operation to list the Availability Zones where
--   Lightsail is currently available.
[$sel:availabilityZone:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Text

-- | The size of the disk in GB (e.g., <tt>32</tt>).
[$sel:sizeInGb:CreateDiskFromSnapshot'] :: CreateDiskFromSnapshot -> Int

--   fields omitted.
