-- | The specific headers to forward to your distribution's origin.
headerObject_headersAllowList :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe [HeaderEnum])

-- | The headers that you want your distribution to forward to your origin
--   and base caching on.
--   
--   You can configure your distribution to do one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>all</tt></b> - Forward all headers to your origin.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>none</tt></b> - Forward only the default headers.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>allow-list</tt></b> - Forward only the headers you specify
--   using the <tt>headersAllowList</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
headerObject_option :: Lens' HeaderObject (Maybe ForwardValues)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is not valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidAfter :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The returned RDP certificate is valid after this point in time.
--   
--   This value is listed only for RDP certificates.
hostKeyAttributes_notValidBefore :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-1 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA1:1CHH6FaAaXjtFOsR/t83vf91SR0</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-1 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>af:34:51:fe:09:f0:e0:da:b8:4e:56:ca:60:c2:10:ff:38:06:db:45</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA1 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The public SSH host key or the RDP certificate.
hostKeyAttributes_publicKey :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The SSH host key algorithm or the RDP certificate format.
--   
--   For SSH host keys, the algorithm may be <tt>ssh-rsa</tt>,
--   <tt>ecdsa-sha2-nistp256</tt>, <tt>ssh-ed25519</tt>, etc. For RDP
--   certificates, the algorithm is always <tt>x509-cert</tt>.
hostKeyAttributes_algorithm :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The time that the SSH host key or RDP certificate was recorded by
--   Lightsail.
hostKeyAttributes_witnessedAt :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The SHA-256 fingerprint of the returned SSH host key or RDP
--   certificate.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 SSH
--   fingerprint:<pre>SHA256:KTsMnRBh1IhD17HpdfsbzeGA4jOijm5tyXsMjKVbB8o</pre></li>
--   <li>Example of an SHA-256 RDP
--   fingerprint:<pre>03:9b:36:9f:4b:de:4e:61:70:fc:7c:c9:78:e7:d2:1a:1c:25:a8:0c:91:f6:7c:e4:d6:a0:85:c8:b4:53:99:68</pre></li>
--   </ul>
hostKeyAttributes_fingerprintSHA256 :: Lens' HostKeyAttributes (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region name of the origin resource.
inputOrigin_regionName :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The name of the origin resource.
inputOrigin_name :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
inputOrigin_protocolPolicy :: Lens' InputOrigin (Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum)

-- | The status code and the state (e.g., <tt>running</tt>) for the
--   instance.
instance_state :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceState)

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>Instance</tt>).
instance_resourceType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/244ad76f-8aad-4741-809f-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
instance_arn :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479734909.17</tt>) in Unix time format.
instance_createdAt :: Lens' Instance (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the instance is located.
instance_location :: Lens' Instance (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The name of the SSH key being used to connect to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
instance_sshKeyName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of objects representing the add-ons enabled on the instance.
instance_addOns :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [AddOn])

-- | The user name for connecting to the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>ec2-user</tt>).
instance_username :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | Information about the public ports and monthly data transfer rates for
--   the instance.
instance_networking :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceNetworking)

-- | The bundle for the instance (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
instance_bundleId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The name the user gave the instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
instance_name :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
instance_ipAddressType :: Lens' Instance (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
instance_supportCode :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The blueprint ID (e.g., <tt>os_amlinux_2016_03</tt>).
instance_blueprintId :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The private IP address of the instance.
instance_privateIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
instance_blueprintName :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether this instance has a static IP
--   assigned to it.
instance_isStaticIp :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public IP address of the instance.
instance_publicIpAddress :: Lens' Instance (Maybe Text)

-- | The size of the vCPU and the amount of RAM for the instance.
instance_hardware :: Lens' Instance (Maybe InstanceHardware)

-- | The IPv6 addresses of the instance.
instance_ipv6Addresses :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Text])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
instance_tags :: Lens' Instance (Maybe [Tag])

-- | Describes the public SSH host keys or the RDP certificate.
instanceAccessDetails_hostKeys :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe [HostKeyAttributes])

-- | For SSH access, the public key to use when accessing your instance For
--   OpenSSH clients (e.g., command line SSH), you should save this value
--   to <tt>tempkey-cert.pub</tt>.
instanceAccessDetails_certKey :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The public IP address of the Amazon Lightsail instance.
instanceAccessDetails_ipAddress :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | For SSH access, the temporary private key. For OpenSSH clients (e.g.,
--   command line SSH), you should save this value to <tt>tempkey</tt>).
instanceAccessDetails_privateKey :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | For SSH access, the date on which the temporary keys expire.
instanceAccessDetails_expiresAt :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The user name to use when logging in to the Amazon Lightsail instance.
instanceAccessDetails_username :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol for these Amazon Lightsail instance access details.
instanceAccessDetails_protocol :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe InstanceAccessProtocol)

-- | For a Windows Server-based instance, an object with the data you can
--   use to retrieve your password. This is only needed if
--   <tt>password</tt> is empty and the instance is not new (and therefore
--   the password is not ready yet). When you create an instance, it can
--   take up to 15 minutes for the instance to be ready.
instanceAccessDetails_passwordData :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe PasswordData)

-- | For RDP access, the password for your Amazon Lightsail instance.
--   Password will be an empty string if the password for your new instance
--   is not ready yet. When you create an instance, it can take up to 15
--   minutes for the instance to be ready.
--   
--   If you create an instance using any key pair other than the default
--   (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>), <tt>password</tt> will always be
--   an empty string.
--   
--   If you change the Administrator password on the instance, Lightsail
--   will continue to return the original password value. When accessing
--   the instance using RDP, you need to manually enter the Administrator
--   password after changing it from the default.
instanceAccessDetails_password :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of this Amazon Lightsail instance.
instanceAccessDetails_instanceName :: Lens' InstanceAccessDetails (Maybe Text)

-- | A launch script you can create that configures a server with
--   additional user data. For example, you might want to run <tt>apt-get
--   -y update</tt>.
--   
--   Depending on the machine image you choose, the command to get software
--   on your instance varies. Amazon Linux and CentOS use <tt>yum</tt>,
--   Debian and Ubuntu use <tt>apt-get</tt>, and FreeBSD uses <tt>pkg</tt>.
instanceEntry_userData :: Lens' InstanceEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the export snapshot record, which contains the exported
--   Lightsail instance snapshot that will be used as the source of the new
--   Amazon EC2 instance.
--   
--   Use the <tt>get export snapshot records</tt> operation to get a list
--   of export snapshot records that you can use to create a CloudFormation
--   stack.
instanceEntry_sourceName :: Lens' InstanceEntry Text

-- | The instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>) to use for the new Amazon
--   EC2 instance.
instanceEntry_instanceType :: Lens' InstanceEntry Text

-- | The port configuration to use for the new Amazon EC2 instance.
--   
--   The following configuration options are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>DEFAULT</tt> - Use the default firewall settings from the
--   Lightsail instance blueprint. If this is specified, then IPv4 and IPv6
--   will be configured for the new instance that is created in Amazon
--   EC2.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSTANCE</tt> - Use the configured firewall settings from the
--   source Lightsail instance. If this is specified, the new instance that
--   is created in Amazon EC2 will be configured to match the configuration
--   of the source Lightsail instance. For example, if the source instance
--   is configured for dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6), then IPv4 and IPv6 will
--   be configured for the new instance that is created in Amazon EC2. If
--   the source instance is configured for IPv4 only, then only IPv4 will
--   be configured for the new instance that is created in Amazon EC2.</li>
--   <li><tt>NONE</tt> - Use the default Amazon EC2 security group. If this
--   is specified, then only IPv4 will be configured for the new instance
--   that is created in Amazon EC2.</li>
--   <li><tt>CLOSED</tt> - All ports closed. If this is specified, then
--   only IPv4 will be configured for the new instance that is created in
--   Amazon EC2.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you configured <tt>lightsail-connect</tt> as a
--   <tt>cidrListAliases</tt> on your instance, or if you chose to allow
--   the Lightsail browser-based SSH or RDP clients to connect to your
--   instance, that configuration is not carried over to your new Amazon
--   EC2 instance.
instanceEntry_portInfoSource :: Lens' InstanceEntry PortInfoSourceType

-- | The Availability Zone for the new Amazon EC2 instance.
instanceEntry_availabilityZone :: Lens' InstanceEntry Text

-- | The number of vCPUs the instance has.
instanceHardware_cpuCount :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe Int)

-- | The disks attached to the instance.
instanceHardware_disks :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe [Disk])

-- | The amount of RAM in GB on the instance (e.g., <tt>1.0</tt>).
instanceHardware_ramSizeInGb :: Lens' InstanceHardware (Maybe Double)

-- | Describes the overall instance health. Valid values are below.
instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealth :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe InstanceHealthState)

-- | The name of the Lightsail instance for which you are requesting health
--   check data.
instanceHealthSummary_instanceName :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | More information about the instance health. If the
--   <tt>instanceHealth</tt> is <tt>healthy</tt>, then an
--   <tt>instanceHealthReason</tt> value is not provided.
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>initial</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.RegistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   in the process of being registered with the load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InitialHealthChecking</tt></b> - The Lightsail load
--   balancer is still sending the target instance the minimum number of
--   health checks required to determine its health status.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unhealthy</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.ResponseCodeMismatch</tt></b> - The health checks
--   did not return an expected HTTP code.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.Timeout</tt></b> - The health check requests timed
--   out.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.FailedHealthChecks</tt></b> - The health checks
--   failed because the connection to the target instance timed out, the
--   target instance response was malformed, or the target instance failed
--   the health check for an unknown reason.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Lb.InternalError</tt></b> - The health checks failed due to
--   an internal error.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>unused</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotRegistered</tt></b> - The target instance is
--   not registered with the target group.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.NotInUse</tt></b> - The target group is not used
--   by any load balancer, or the target instance is in an Availability
--   Zone that is not enabled for its load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.IpUnusable</tt></b> - The target IP address is
--   reserved for use by a Lightsail load balancer.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.InvalidState</tt></b> - The target is in the
--   stopped or terminated state.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If <b><tt>instanceHealth</tt></b> is <tt>draining</tt>, the
--   <b><tt>instanceHealthReason</tt></b> value can be one of the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance.DeregistrationInProgress</tt></b> - The target
--   instance is in the process of being deregistered and the
--   deregistration delay period has not expired.</li>
--   </ul>
instanceHealthSummary_instanceHealthReason :: Lens' InstanceHealthSummary (Maybe InstanceHealthReason)

-- | The amount of data in GB allocated for monthly data transfers.
instanceNetworking_monthlyTransfer :: Lens' InstanceNetworking (Maybe MonthlyTransfer)

-- | An array of key-value pairs containing information about the ports on
--   the instance.
instanceNetworking_ports :: Lens' InstanceNetworking (Maybe [InstancePortInfo])

-- | The first port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP type for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP type for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortInfo_fromPort :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | The IPv4 address, or range of IPv4 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol.
--   
--   The <tt>ipv6Cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv6 addresses that are
--   allowed to connect to an instance.
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
instancePortInfo_cidrs :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The common name of the port information.
instancePortInfo_commonName :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP protocol name.
--   
--   The name can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>tcp</tt> - Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) provides
--   reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of streamed data between
--   applications running on hosts communicating by an IP network. If you
--   have an application that doesn't require reliable data stream service,
--   use UDP instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>all</tt> - All transport layer protocol types. For more
--   general information, see <a>Transport layer</a> on
--   <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>udp</tt> - With User Datagram Protocol (UDP), computer
--   applications can send messages (or datagrams) to other hosts on an
--   Internet Protocol (IP) network. Prior communications are not required
--   to set up transmission channels or data paths. Applications that don't
--   require reliable data stream service can use UDP, which provides a
--   connectionless datagram service that emphasizes reduced latency over
--   reliability. If you do require reliable data stream service, use TCP
--   instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>icmp</tt> - Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used
--   to send error messages and operational information indicating success
--   or failure when communicating with an instance. For example, an error
--   is indicated when an instance could not be reached. When you specify
--   <tt>icmp</tt> as the <tt>protocol</tt>, you must specify the ICMP type
--   using the <tt>fromPort</tt> parameter, and ICMP code using the
--   <tt>toPort</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortInfo_protocol :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe NetworkProtocol)

-- | An alias that defines access for a preconfigured range of IP
--   addresses.
--   
--   The only alias currently supported is <tt>lightsail-connect</tt>,
--   which allows IP addresses of the browser-based RDP/SSH client in the
--   Lightsail console to connect to your instance.
instancePortInfo_cidrListAliases :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The IPv6 address, or range of IPv6 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol. Only devices with an IPv6 address can connect to an instance
--   through IPv6; otherwise, IPv4 should be used.
--   
--   The <tt>cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv4 addresses that are allowed
--   to connect to an instance.
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
instancePortInfo_ipv6Cidrs :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The access direction (<tt>inbound</tt> or <tt>outbound</tt>).
--   
--   Lightsail currently supports only <tt>inbound</tt> access direction.
instancePortInfo_accessDirection :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe AccessDirection)

-- | The type of access (<tt>Public</tt> or <tt>Private</tt>).
instancePortInfo_accessType :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe PortAccessType)

-- | The last port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP code for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP code for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortInfo_toPort :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | The location from which access is allowed. For example, <tt>Anywhere
--   (0.0.0.0/0)</tt>, or <tt>Custom</tt> if a specific IP address or range
--   of IP addresses is allowed.
instancePortInfo_accessFrom :: Lens' InstancePortInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The first port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP type for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP type for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortState_fromPort :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe Int)

-- | The IPv4 address, or range of IPv4 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol.
--   
--   The <tt>ipv6Cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv6 addresses that are
--   allowed to connect to an instance.
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
instancePortState_cidrs :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe [Text])

-- | Specifies whether the instance port is <tt>open</tt> or
--   <tt>closed</tt>.
--   
--   The port state for Lightsail instances is always <tt>open</tt>.
instancePortState_state :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe PortState)

-- | The IP protocol name.
--   
--   The name can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>tcp</tt> - Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) provides
--   reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of streamed data between
--   applications running on hosts communicating by an IP network. If you
--   have an application that doesn't require reliable data stream service,
--   use UDP instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>all</tt> - All transport layer protocol types. For more
--   general information, see <a>Transport layer</a> on
--   <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>udp</tt> - With User Datagram Protocol (UDP), computer
--   applications can send messages (or datagrams) to other hosts on an
--   Internet Protocol (IP) network. Prior communications are not required
--   to set up transmission channels or data paths. Applications that don't
--   require reliable data stream service can use UDP, which provides a
--   connectionless datagram service that emphasizes reduced latency over
--   reliability. If you do require reliable data stream service, use TCP
--   instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>icmp</tt> - Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used
--   to send error messages and operational information indicating success
--   or failure when communicating with an instance. For example, an error
--   is indicated when an instance could not be reached. When you specify
--   <tt>icmp</tt> as the <tt>protocol</tt>, you must specify the ICMP type
--   using the <tt>fromPort</tt> parameter, and ICMP code using the
--   <tt>toPort</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortState_protocol :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe NetworkProtocol)

-- | An alias that defines access for a preconfigured range of IP
--   addresses.
--   
--   The only alias currently supported is <tt>lightsail-connect</tt>,
--   which allows IP addresses of the browser-based RDP/SSH client in the
--   Lightsail console to connect to your instance.
instancePortState_cidrListAliases :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe [Text])

-- | The IPv6 address, or range of IPv6 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol. Only devices with an IPv6 address can connect to an instance
--   through IPv6; otherwise, IPv4 should be used.
--   
--   The <tt>cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv4 addresses that are allowed
--   to connect to an instance.
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
instancePortState_ipv6Cidrs :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe [Text])

-- | The last port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP code for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP code for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
instancePortState_toPort :: Lens' InstancePortState (Maybe Int)

-- | The blueprint ID from which you created the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>). A blueprint is a virtual private server (or
--   <i>instance</i>) image used to create instances quickly.
instanceSnapshot_fromBlueprintId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the snapshot was created from an
--   automatic snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_isFromAutoSnapshot :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Bool)

-- | The state the snapshot is in.
instanceSnapshot_state :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe InstanceSnapshotState)

-- | The type of resource (usually <tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_resourceType :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | An array of disk objects containing information about all block
--   storage disks.
instanceSnapshot_fromAttachedDisks :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe [Disk])

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:InstanceSnapshot/d23b5706-3322-4d83-81e5-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_arn :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the snapshot was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479907467.024</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_createdAt :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where you created the snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_location :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The progress of the snapshot.
--   
--   This is populated only for disk snapshots, and is <tt>null</tt> for
--   instance snapshots.
instanceSnapshot_progress :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the snapshot.
instanceSnapshot_name :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle ID from which you created the snapshot (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_fromBundleId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The size in GB of the SSD.
instanceSnapshot_sizeInGb :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Int)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
instanceSnapshot_supportCode :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance from which the snapshot
--   was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:Instance/64b8404c-ccb1-430b-8daf-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
instanceSnapshot_fromInstanceArn :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance from which the snapshot was created.
instanceSnapshot_fromInstanceName :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
instanceSnapshot_tags :: Lens' InstanceSnapshot (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The blueprint ID from which the source instance (e.g.,
--   <tt>os_debian_8_3</tt>).
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBlueprintId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle ID from which the source instance was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromBundleId :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects describing the disks that were attached to the
--   source instance.
instanceSnapshotInfo_fromDiskInfo :: Lens' InstanceSnapshotInfo (Maybe [DiskInfo])

-- | The state of the instance (e.g., <tt>running</tt> or
--   <tt>pending</tt>).
instanceState_name :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Text)

-- | The status code for the instance.
instanceState_code :: Lens' InstanceState (Maybe Int)

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>KeyPair</tt>).
keyPair_resourceType :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the key pair (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:KeyPair/05859e3d-331d-48ba-9034-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
keyPair_arn :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the key pair was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).
keyPair_createdAt :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region name and Availability Zone where the key pair was created.
keyPair_location :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The RSA fingerprint of the key pair.
keyPair_fingerprint :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name of the SSH key pair.
keyPair_name :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
keyPair_supportCode :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
keyPair_tags :: Lens' KeyPair (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The status of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_status :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the origin resource of the distribution, such
--   as a Lightsail instance or load balancer.
--   
--   The distribution pulls, caches, and serves content from the origin.
lightsailDistribution_origin :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Origin)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate attached to the distribution, if
--   any.
lightsailDistribution_certificateName :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Distribution</tt>).
lightsailDistribution_resourceType :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_arn :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the distribution was created.
lightsailDistribution_createdAt :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An object that describes the location of the distribution, such as the
--   AWS Region and Availability Zone.
--   
--   Lightsail distributions are global resources that can reference an
--   origin in any AWS Region, and distribute its content globally.
--   However, all distributions are located in the <tt>us-east-1</tt>
--   Region.
lightsailDistribution_location :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | An object that describes the cache behavior settings of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviorSettings :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe CacheSettings)

-- | The alternate domain names of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_alternativeDomainNames :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [Text])

-- | The ID of the bundle currently applied to the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_bundleId :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | Indicates whether the bundle that is currently applied to your
--   distribution, specified using the <tt>distributionName</tt> parameter,
--   can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   Use the <tt>UpdateDistributionBundle</tt> action to change your
--   distribution's bundle.
lightsailDistribution_ableToUpdateBundle :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The public DNS of the origin.
lightsailDistribution_originPublicDNS :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_domainName :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the distribution.
lightsailDistribution_name :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | The IP address type of the distribution.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
lightsailDistribution_ipAddressType :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe IpAddressType)

-- | Indicates whether the distribution is enabled.
lightsailDistribution_isEnabled :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Bool)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail distribution. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
lightsailDistribution_supportCode :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that describes the default cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_defaultCacheBehavior :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe CacheBehavior)

-- | An array of objects that describe the per-path cache behavior of the
--   distribution.
lightsailDistribution_cacheBehaviors :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [CacheBehaviorPerPath])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
lightsailDistribution_tags :: Lens' LightsailDistribution (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The path you specified to perform your health checks. If no path is
--   specified, the load balancer tries to make a request to the default
--   (root) page.
loadBalancer_healthCheckPath :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of your load balancer. Valid values are below.
loadBalancer_state :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerState)

--   balancer across Availability Zones.

--   instances. For HTTP traffic, it's port 80. For HTTPS traffic, it's
--   port 443.
loadBalancer_instancePort :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Int)

--   balancer. Valid values are listed below.

--   You can't just have <tt>HTTP_HTTPS</tt>, but you can have just

loadBalancer_protocol :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe LoadBalancerProtocol)

--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
loadBalancer_supportCode :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe Text)

--   port 80. For HTTPS, use port 443.
loadBalancer_publicPorts :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Int])

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
loadBalancer_tags :: Lens' LoadBalancer (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The validation failure reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_failureReason :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateFailureReason)

-- | The name of the entity that is associated with the public key
--   contained in the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subject :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation status of the SSL/TLS certificate. Valid values are
--   below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_status :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateStatus)

-- | An array of strings that specify the alternate domains (e.g.,
--   <tt>example2.com</tt>) and subdomains (e.g.,
--   <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) for the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_subjectAlternativeNames :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [Text])

-- | The resource type (e.g., <tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt>).
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>Instance</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance (a virtual private
--   server)</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StaticIp</tt></b> - A static IP address</li>
--   <li><b><tt>KeyPair</tt></b> - The key pair used to connect to a
--   Lightsail instance</li>
--   <li><b><tt>InstanceSnapshot</tt></b> - A Lightsail instance
--   snapshot</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Domain</tt></b> - A DNS zone</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PeeredVpc</tt></b> - A peered VPC</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancer</tt></b> - A Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>LoadBalancerTlsCertificate</tt></b> - An SSL/TLS
--   certificate associated with a Lightsail load balancer</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Disk</tt></b> - A Lightsail block storage disk</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskSnapshot</tt></b> - A block storage disk snapshot</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_resourceType :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_arn :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The time when you created your SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_createdAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The AWS Region and Availability Zone where you created your
--   certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_location :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The load balancer name where your SSL/TLS certificate is attached.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_loadBalancerName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The serial number of the certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_serial :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_isAttached :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Bool)

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present
--   only when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_revokedAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notBefore :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.

-- | The domain name for your SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

--   certificate. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_supportCode :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord objects
--   describing the records.

loadBalancerTlsCertificate_issuedAt :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

--   key).

loadBalancerTlsCertificate_signatureAlgorithm :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe Text)

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_tags :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The timestamp when the SSL/TLS certificate expires.
loadBalancerTlsCertificate_notAfter :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The fully qualified domain name in the certificate request.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption (Maybe Text)

-- | The status of the domain validation. Valid values are listed below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption_validationStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus)

-- | The value for that type.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_value :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The domain name against which your SSL/TLS certificate was validated.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_domainName :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | A fully qualified domain name in the certificate. For example,
--   <tt>example.com</tt>.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_name :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The validation status. Valid values are listed below.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_validationStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainStatus)

-- | The type of validation record. For example, <tt>CNAME</tt> for domain
--   validation.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord_type :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_renewalStatus :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalStatus)

-- | Contains information about the validation of each domain name in the
--   certificate, as it pertains to Lightsail's managed renewal. This is
--   different from the initial validation that occurs as a result of the
--   RequestCertificate request.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary_domainValidationOptions :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateRenewalSummary (Maybe [LoadBalancerTlsCertificateDomainValidationOption])

-- | When <tt>true</tt>, the SSL/TLS certificate is attached to the
--   Lightsail load balancer.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_isAttached :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the SSL/TLS certificate.
loadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary_name :: Lens' LoadBalancerTlsCertificateSummary (Maybe Text)

monitoredResourceInfo_name :: Lens' MonitoredResourceInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The amount allocated per month (in GB).
monthlyTransfer_gbPerMonthAllocated :: Lens' MonthlyTransfer (Maybe Int)

-- | The status of the operation.

--   <tt>1479816991.349</tt>).

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is terminal.
operation_isTerminal :: Lens' Operation (Maybe Bool)

-- | The AWS Region name of the origin resource.
origin_regionName :: Lens' Origin (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The resource type of the origin resource (e.g., <i>Instance</i>).
origin_resourceType :: Lens' Origin (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The name of the origin resource.
origin_name :: Lens' Origin (Maybe Text)

-- | The protocol that your Amazon Lightsail distribution uses when
--   establishing a connection with your origin to pull content.
origin_protocolPolicy :: Lens' Origin (Maybe OriginProtocolPolicyEnum)

-- | The name of the key pair that you used when creating your instance. If
--   no key pair name was specified when creating the instance, Lightsail
--   uses the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>).
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decrypting your password using the <tt>ciphertext</tt>. Lightsail
--   creates the ciphertext by encrypting your password with the public key
--   part of this key pair.
passwordData_keyPairName :: Lens' PasswordData (Maybe Text)

-- | The encrypted password. Ciphertext will be an empty string if access
--   to your new instance is not ready yet. When you create an instance, it
--   can take up to 15 minutes for the instance to be ready.
--   
--   If you use the default key pair (<tt>LightsailDefaultKeyPair</tt>),
--   the decrypted password will be available in the password field.
--   
--   If you are using a custom key pair, you need to use your own means of
--   decryption.
--   
--   If you change the Administrator password on the instance, Lightsail
--   will continue to return the original ciphertext value. When accessing
--   the instance using RDP, you need to manually enter the Administrator
--   password after changing it from the default.
passwordData_ciphertext :: Lens' PasswordData (Maybe Text)

-- | The type of pending database maintenance action.
pendingMaintenanceAction_action :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | Additional detail about the pending database maintenance action.
pendingMaintenanceAction_description :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe Text)

-- | The effective date of the pending database maintenance action.
pendingMaintenanceAction_currentApplyDate :: Lens' PendingMaintenanceAction (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The database engine version.
pendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues_engineVersion :: Lens' PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues (Maybe Text)

-- | The password for the master user of the database.
pendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues_masterUserPassword :: Lens' PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether automated backup retention is
--   enabled.
pendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues_backupRetentionEnabled :: Lens' PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues (Maybe Bool)

-- | The first port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP type for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP type for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
portInfo_fromPort :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | The IPv4 address, or range of IPv4 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol.
--   
--   The <tt>ipv6Cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv6 addresses that are
--   allowed to connect to an instance.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To allow the IP address <tt>192.0.2.44</tt>, specify
--   <tt>192.0.2.44</tt> or <tt>192.0.2.44/32</tt>.</li>
--   <li>To allow the IP addresses <tt>192.0.2.0</tt> to
--   <tt>192.0.2.255</tt>, specify <tt>192.0.2.0/24</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
portInfo_cidrs :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The IP protocol name.
--   
--   The name can be one of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>tcp</tt> - Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) provides
--   reliable, ordered, and error-checked delivery of streamed data between
--   applications running on hosts communicating by an IP network. If you
--   have an application that doesn't require reliable data stream service,
--   use UDP instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>all</tt> - All transport layer protocol types. For more
--   general information, see <a>Transport layer</a> on
--   <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li><tt>udp</tt> - With User Datagram Protocol (UDP), computer
--   applications can send messages (or datagrams) to other hosts on an
--   Internet Protocol (IP) network. Prior communications are not required
--   to set up transmission channels or data paths. Applications that don't
--   require reliable data stream service can use UDP, which provides a
--   connectionless datagram service that emphasizes reduced latency over
--   reliability. If you do require reliable data stream service, use TCP
--   instead.</li>
--   <li><tt>icmp</tt> - Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) is used
--   to send error messages and operational information indicating success
--   or failure when communicating with an instance. For example, an error
--   is indicated when an instance could not be reached. When you specify
--   <tt>icmp</tt> as the <tt>protocol</tt>, you must specify the ICMP type
--   using the <tt>fromPort</tt> parameter, and ICMP code using the
--   <tt>toPort</tt> parameter.</li>
--   </ul>
portInfo_protocol :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe NetworkProtocol)

-- | An alias that defines access for a preconfigured range of IP
--   addresses.
--   
--   The only alias currently supported is <tt>lightsail-connect</tt>,
--   which allows IP addresses of the browser-based RDP/SSH client in the
--   Lightsail console to connect to your instance.
portInfo_cidrListAliases :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The IPv6 address, or range of IPv6 addresses (in CIDR notation) that
--   are allowed to connect to an instance through the ports, and the
--   protocol. Only devices with an IPv6 address can connect to an instance
--   through IPv6; otherwise, IPv4 should be used.
--   
--   The <tt>cidrs</tt> parameter lists the IPv4 addresses that are allowed
--   to connect to an instance.
--   
--   For more information about CIDR block notation, see <a>Classless
--   Inter-Domain Routing</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.
portInfo_ipv6Cidrs :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe [Text])

-- | The last port in a range of open ports on an instance.
--   
--   Allowed ports:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>TCP and UDP - <tt>0</tt> to <tt>65535</tt></li>
--   <li>ICMP - The ICMP code for IPv4 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>8</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMP type), and <tt>-1</tt> as
--   the <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMP code), to enable ICMP Ping. For more
--   information, see <a>Control Messages</a> on <i>Wikipedia</i>.</li>
--   <li>ICMPv6 - The ICMP code for IPv6 addresses. For example, specify
--   <tt>128</tt> as the <tt>fromPort</tt> (ICMPv6 type), and <tt>0</tt> as
--   <tt>toPort</tt> (ICMPv6 code). For more information, see <a>Internet
--   Control Message Protocol for IPv6</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
portInfo_toPort :: Lens' PortInfo (Maybe Int)

-- | The specific query strings that the distribution forwards to the
--   origin.
--   
--   Your distribution will cache content based on the specified query
--   strings.
--   
--   If the <tt>option</tt> parameter is true, then your distribution
--   forwards all query strings, regardless of what you specify using the
--   <tt>queryStringsAllowList</tt> parameter.
queryStringObject_queryStringsAllowList :: Lens' QueryStringObject (Maybe [Text])

-- | Indicates whether the distribution forwards and caches based on query
--   strings.
queryStringObject_option :: Lens' QueryStringObject (Maybe Bool)

-- | The Availability Zones. Follows the format <tt>us-east-2a</tt>
--   (case-sensitive).
regionInfo_availabilityZones :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe [AvailabilityZone])

-- | The region name (e.g., <tt>us-east-2</tt>).
regionInfo_name :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The Availability Zones for databases. Follows the format
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> (case-sensitive).
regionInfo_relationalDatabaseAvailabilityZones :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe [AvailabilityZone])

-- | The display name (e.g., <tt>Ohio</tt>).
regionInfo_displayName :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The continent code (e.g., <tt>NA</tt>, meaning North America).
regionInfo_continentCode :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The description of the AWS Region (e.g., <tt>This region is
--   recommended to serve users in the eastern United States and eastern
--   Canada</tt>).
regionInfo_description :: Lens' RegionInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | The database engine version (for example, <tt>5.7.23</tt>).
relationalDatabase_engineVersion :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The bundle ID for the database. A bundle describes the performance
--   specifications for your database.
relationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseBundleId :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The master endpoint for the database.
relationalDatabase_masterEndpoint :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe RelationalDatabaseEndpoint)

-- | Describes the current state of the database.
relationalDatabase_state :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type for the database (for example,
--   <tt>RelationalDatabase</tt>).
relationalDatabase_resourceType :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the database is publicly
--   accessible.
relationalDatabase_publiclyAccessible :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The master user name of the database.
relationalDatabase_masterUsername :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the database.
relationalDatabase_arn :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the database was created. Formatted in Unix time.
relationalDatabase_createdAt :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Region name and Availability Zone where the database is located.
relationalDatabase_location :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | The database software (for example, <tt>MySQL</tt>).
relationalDatabase_engine :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The latest point in time to which the database can be restored.
--   Formatted in Unix time.
relationalDatabase_latestRestorableTime :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The weekly time range during which system maintenance can occur on the
--   database.
--   
--   In the format <tt>ddd:hh24:mi-ddd:hh24:mi</tt>. For example,
--   <tt>Tue:17:00-Tue:17:30</tt>.
relationalDatabase_preferredMaintenanceWindow :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The blueprint ID for the database. A blueprint describes the major
--   engine version of a database.
relationalDatabase_relationalDatabaseBlueprintId :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The certificate associated with the database.
relationalDatabase_caCertificateIdentifier :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The unique name of the database resource in Lightsail.
relationalDatabase_name :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether automated backup retention is
--   enabled for the database.
relationalDatabase_backupRetentionEnabled :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Bool)

-- | The daily time range during which automated backups are created for
--   the database (for example, <tt>16:00-16:30</tt>).
relationalDatabase_preferredBackupWindow :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the pending maintenance actions for the database.
relationalDatabase_pendingMaintenanceActions :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe [PendingMaintenanceAction])

-- | The support code for the database. Include this code in your email to
--   support when you have questions about a database in Lightsail. This
--   code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail information
--   more easily.
relationalDatabase_supportCode :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the secondary Availability Zone of a high availability
--   database.
--   
--   The secondary database is used for failover support of a high
--   availability database.
relationalDatabase_secondaryAvailabilityZone :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes pending database value modifications.
relationalDatabase_pendingModifiedValues :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe PendingModifiedRelationalDatabaseValues)

-- | The name of the master database created when the Lightsail database
--   resource is created.
relationalDatabase_masterDatabaseName :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | Describes the hardware of the database.
relationalDatabase_hardware :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe RelationalDatabaseHardware)

-- | The status of parameter updates for the database.
relationalDatabase_parameterApplyStatus :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe Text)

-- | The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
relationalDatabase_tags :: Lens' RelationalDatabase (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The database engine version for the database blueprint (for example,
--   <tt>5.7.23</tt>).

relationalDatabaseBundle_isEncrypted :: Lens' RelationalDatabaseBundle (Maybe Bool)

--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
relationalDatabaseSnapshot_tags :: Lens' RelationalDatabaseSnapshot (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The renewal status of the certificate.
--   
--   The following renewal status are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingAutoRenewal</tt></b> - Lightsail is attempting to
--   automatically validate the domain names of the certificate. No further
--   action is required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>PendingValidation</tt></b> - Lightsail couldn't
--   automatically validate one or more domain names of the certificate.
--   You must take action to validate these domain names or the certificate
--   won't be renewed. Check to make sure your certificate's domain
--   validation records exist in your domain's DNS, and that your
--   certificate remains in use.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Success</tt></b> - All domain names in the certificate are
--   validated, and Lightsail renewed the certificate. No further action is
--   required.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>Failed</tt></b> - One or more domain names were not
--   validated before the certificate expired, and Lightsail did not renew
--   the certificate. You can request a new certificate using the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action.</li>
--   </ul>
renewalSummary_renewalStatus :: Lens' RenewalSummary (Maybe RenewalStatus)

-- | An array of objects that describe the domain validation records of the
--   certificate.
renewalSummary_domainValidationRecords :: Lens' RenewalSummary (Maybe [DomainValidationRecord])

-- | The timestamp when the certificate was last updated.
renewalSummary_updatedAt :: Lens' RenewalSummary (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The reason for the renewal status of the certificate.
renewalSummary_renewalStatusReason :: Lens' RenewalSummary (Maybe Text)

-- | The AWS Region name.
resourceLocation_regionName :: Lens' ResourceLocation (Maybe RegionName)

-- | The Availability Zone. Follows the format <tt>us-east-2a</tt>
--   (case-sensitive).
resourceLocation_availabilityZone :: Lens' ResourceLocation (Maybe Text)

-- | The Lightsail resource type (for example, <tt>Instance</tt>).
resourceReceivingAccess_resourceType :: Lens' ResourceReceivingAccess (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the Lightsail instance.
resourceReceivingAccess_name :: Lens' ResourceReceivingAccess (Maybe Text)

-- | The value for the DNS record.
resourceRecord_value :: Lens' ResourceRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the record.
resourceRecord_name :: Lens' ResourceRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The DNS record type.
resourceRecord_type :: Lens' ResourceRecord (Maybe Text)

-- | The static IP address.
staticIp_ipAddress :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The resource type (usually <tt>StaticIp</tt>).
staticIp_resourceType :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe ResourceType)

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the static IP (e.g.,
--   <tt>arn:aws:lightsail:us-east-2:123456789101:StaticIp/9cbb4a9e-f8e3-4dfe-b57e-12345EXAMPLE</tt>).
staticIp_arn :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The timestamp when the static IP was created (e.g.,
--   <tt>1479735304.222</tt>).
staticIp_createdAt :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The region and Availability Zone where the static IP was created.
staticIp_location :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe ResourceLocation)

-- | A Boolean value indicating whether the static IP is attached.
staticIp_isAttached :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Bool)

-- | The name of the static IP (e.g., <tt>StaticIP-Ohio-EXAMPLE</tt>).
staticIp_name :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about an instance or another resource in Lightsail.
--   This code enables our support team to look up your Lightsail
--   information more easily.
staticIp_supportCode :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The instance where the static IP is attached (e.g.,
--   <tt>Amazon_Linux-1GB-Ohio-1</tt>).
staticIp_attachedTo :: Lens' StaticIp (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag values accept a maximum of 256 letters, numbers,
--   spaces in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
tag_value :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)

-- | The key of the tag.
--   
--   Constraints: Tag keys accept a maximum of 128 letters, numbers, spaces
--   in UTF-8, or the following characters: + - = . _ : / @
tag_key :: Lens' Tag (Maybe Text)


module Network.AWS.Lightsail.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2016-11-28</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon Lightsail is the easiest way to get started with Amazon Web
--   Services (AWS) for developers who need to build websites or web
--   applications. It includes everything you need to launch your project
--   quickly - instances (virtual private servers), container services,
--   storage buckets, managed databases, SSD-based block storage, static IP
--   addresses, load balancers, content delivery network (CDN)
--   distributions, DNS management of registered domains, and resource
--   snapshots (backups) - for a low, predictable monthly price.
--   
--   You can manage your Lightsail resources using the Lightsail console,
--   Lightsail API, AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), or SDKs. For more
--   information about Lightsail concepts and tasks, see the <a>Amazon
--   Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   This API Reference provides detailed information about the actions,
--   data types, parameters, and errors of the Lightsail service. For more
--   information about the supported AWS Regions, endpoints, and service
--   quotas of the Lightsail service, see <a>Amazon Lightsail Endpoints and
--   Quotas</a> in the <i>AWS General Reference</i>.
module Network.AWS.Lightsail

-- | API version <tt>2016-11-28</tt> of the Amazon Lightsail SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when the user cannot be authenticated
--   or uses invalid credentials to access a resource.
_AccessDeniedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when an account is still in the setup
--   in progress state.
_AccountSetupInProgressException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when it cannot find a resource.
_NotFoundException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when an operation fails to execute.
_OperationFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | A general service exception.
_ServiceException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when the user has not been
--   authenticated.
_UnauthenticatedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | Lightsail throws this exception when user input does not conform to
--   the validation rules of an input field.
--   
--   Domain and distribution APIs are only available in the N. Virginia
--   (<tt>us-east-1</tt>) AWS Region. Please set your AWS Region
--   configuration to <tt>us-east-1</tt> to create, view, or edit these
--   resources.
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRelationalDatabaseMetricData</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData
GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData' :: Text -> RelationalDatabaseMetricName -> Natural -> POSIX -> POSIX -> MetricUnit -> [MetricStatistic] -> GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:relationalDatabaseName:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_relationalDatabaseName</a> - The
--   name of your database from which to get metric data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_metricName</a> - The metric for
--   which you want to return information.
--   
--   Valid relational database metric names are listed below, along with
--   the most useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and
--   the published <tt>unit</tt> value. All relational database metric data
--   is available in 1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUUtilization</tt></b> - The percentage of CPU utilization
--   currently in use on the database.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistics are <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>:
--   The published unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DatabaseConnections</tt></b> - The number of database
--   connections in use.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DiskQueueDepth</tt></b> - The number of outstanding IOs
--   (read/write requests) that are waiting to access the
--   disk.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>FreeStorageSpace</tt></b> - The amount of available storage
--   space.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkReceiveThroughput</tt></b> - The incoming (Receive)
--   network traffic on the database, including both customer database
--   traffic and AWS traffic used for monitoring and
--   replication.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Bytes/Second</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkTransmitThroughput</tt></b> - The outgoing
--   (Transmit) network traffic on the database, including both customer
--   database traffic and AWS traffic used for monitoring and
--   replication.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Bytes/Second</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_period</a> - The granularity, in
--   seconds, of the returned data points.
--   
--   All relational database metric data is available in 1-minute (60
--   seconds) granularity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_startTime</a> - The start of the
--   time interval from which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   a start time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the start time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_endTime</a> - The end of the time
--   interval from which to get metric data.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>Specified in the Unix time format.For example, if you wish to use
--   an end time of October 1, 2018, at 8 PM UTC, then you input
--   <tt>1538424000</tt> as the end time.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_unit</a> - The unit for the metric
--   data request. Valid units depend on the metric data being requested.
--   For the valid units with each available metric, see the
--   <tt>metricName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistics:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getRelationalDatabaseMetricData_statistics</a> - The statistic for
--   the metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
newGetRelationalDatabaseMetricData :: Text -> RelationalDatabaseMetricName -> Natural -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> MetricUnit -> GetRelationalDatabaseMetricData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse
GetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse' :: Maybe RelationalDatabaseMetricName -> Maybe [MetricDatapoint] -> Int -> GetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.

--   of the metric returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricData:GetRelationalDatabaseMetricDataResponse'</a>,

--   fields.

--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:forceDelete:DeleteBucket'</a>, <a>deleteBucket_forceDelete</a>
--   - A Boolean value that indicates whether to force delete the bucket.
--   
--   You must force delete the bucket if it has one of the following
--   conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The bucket is the origin of a distribution.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has instances that were granted access to it using the
--   SetResourceAccessForBucket action.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has objects.</li>
--   <li>The bucket has access keys.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   Force deleting a bucket might impact other resources that rely on the
--   bucket, such as instances, distributions, or software that use the
--   issued access keys.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:DeleteBucket'</a>, <a>deleteBucket_bucketName</a> -
--   The name of the bucket to delete.
--   
--   Use the GetBuckets action to get a list of bucket names that you can
--   specify.
newDeleteBucket :: Text -> DeleteBucket

--   specify the AWS account IDs that can access the bucket.
--   
--   You can give a maximum of 10 AWS accounts access to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessRules:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_accessRules</a>
--   - An object that sets the public accessibility of objects in the
--   specified bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:versioning:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_versioning</a> -
--   Specifies whether to enable or suspend versioning of objects in the
--   bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Enables versioning of objects in the specified
--   bucket.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Suspends versioning of objects in the
--   specified bucket. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:bucketName:UpdateBucket'</a>, <a>updateBucket_bucketName</a> -
--   The name of the bucket to update.

--   than the domain name of the certificate. For example, your certificate
--   name might be <tt>WordPress-Blog-Certificate</tt> and the domain name
--   of the certificate might be <tt>example.com</tt>.

--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alarmName:TestAlarm'</a>, <a>testAlarm_alarmName</a> - The
--   name of the alarm to test.
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:TestAlarm'</a>, <a>testAlarm_state</a> - The alarm state
--   to test.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states that can be tested:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
newTestAlarm :: Text -> AlarmState -> TestAlarm
