-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInstanceMetricData</a> smart constructor.
data GetInstanceMetricData
GetInstanceMetricData' :: Text -> InstanceMetricName -> Natural -> POSIX -> POSIX -> MetricUnit -> [MetricStatistic] -> GetInstanceMetricData

-- | Create a value of <a>GetInstanceMetricData</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceName:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_instanceName</a> - The name of the instance
--   for which you want to get metrics data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_metricName</a> - The metric for which you
--   want to return information.
--   
--   Valid instance metric names are listed below, along with the most
--   useful <tt>statistics</tt> to include in your request, and the
--   published <tt>unit</tt> value.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt></b> - The percentage of CPU
--   performance available for your instance to burst above its baseline.
--   Your instance continuously accrues and consumes burst capacity. Burst
--   capacity stops accruing when your instance's
--   <tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt> reaches 100%. For more information,
--   see <a>Viewing instance burst capacity in Amazon
--   Lightsail</a>.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>BurstCapacityTime</tt></b> - The available amount of time
--   for your instance to burst at 100% CPU utilization. Your instance
--   continuously accrues and consumes burst capacity. Burst capacity time
--   stops accruing when your instance's <tt>BurstCapacityPercentage</tt>
--   metric reaches 100%.Burst capacity time is consumed at the full rate
--   only when your instance operates at 100% CPU utilization. For example,
--   if your instance operates at 50% CPU utilization in the burstable zone
--   for a 5-minute period, then it consumes CPU burst capacity minutes at
--   a 50% rate in that period. Your instance consumed 2 minutes and 30
--   seconds of CPU burst capacity minutes in the 5-minute period. For more
--   information, see <a>Viewing instance burst capacity in Amazon
--   Lightsail</a>.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Seconds</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>CPUUtilization</tt></b> - The percentage of allocated
--   compute units that are currently in use on the instance. This metric
--   identifies the processing power to run the applications on the
--   instance. Tools in your operating system can show a lower percentage
--   than Lightsail when the instance is not allocated a full processor
--   core.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistics are
--   <tt>Maximum</tt> and <tt>Average</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published
--   unit is <tt>Percent</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkIn</tt></b> - The number of bytes received on all
--   network interfaces by the instance. This metric identifies the volume
--   of incoming network traffic to the instance. The number reported is
--   the number of bytes received during the period. Because this metric is
--   reported in 5-minute intervals, divide the reported number by 300 to
--   find Bytes/second.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>NetworkOut</tt></b> - The number of bytes sent out on all
--   network interfaces by the instance. This metric identifies the volume
--   of outgoing network traffic from the instance. The number reported is
--   the number of bytes sent during the period. Because this metric is
--   reported in 5-minute intervals, divide the reported number by 300 to
--   find Bytes/second.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Bytes</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed</tt></b> - Reports whether the instance
--   passed or failed both the instance status check and the system status
--   check. This metric can be either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric
--   data is available in 1-minute (60 seconds)
--   granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful statistic is
--   <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed_Instance</tt></b> - Reports whether the
--   instance passed or failed the instance status check. This metric can
--   be either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric data is available in
--   1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>StatusCheckFailed_System</tt></b> - Reports whether the
--   instance passed or failed the system status check. This metric can be
--   either 0 (passed) or 1 (failed). This metric data is available in
--   1-minute (60 seconds) granularity.<tt>Statistics</tt>: The most useful
--   statistic is <tt>Sum</tt>.<tt>Unit</tt>: The published unit is
--   <tt>Count</tt>.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_period</a> - The granularity, in seconds, of
--   the returned data points.
--   
--   The <tt>StatusCheckFailed</tt>, <tt>StatusCheckFailed_Instance</tt>,
--   and <tt>StatusCheckFailed_System</tt> instance metric data is
--   available in 1-minute (60 seconds) granularity. All other instance
--   metric data is available in 5-minute (300 seconds) granularity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_startTime</a> - The start time of the time
--   period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_endTime</a> - The end time of the time
--   period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_unit</a> - The unit for the metric data
--   request. Valid units depend on the metric data being requested. For
--   the valid units to specify with each available metric, see the
--   <tt>metricName</tt> parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistics:GetInstanceMetricData'</a>,
--   <a>getInstanceMetricData_statistics</a> - The statistic for the
--   metric.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
newGetInstanceMetricData :: Text -> InstanceMetricName -> Natural -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> MetricUnit -> GetInstanceMetricData

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetInstanceMetricDataResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetInstanceMetricDataResponse

--   API. It is now deprecated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:addOns:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_addOns</a> -
--   An array of objects representing the add-ons to enable for the new
--   instance.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userData:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_userData</a>
--   - A launch script you can create that configures a server with
--   additional user data. For example, you might want to run <tt>apt-get
--   -y update</tt>.
--   
--   Depending on the machine image you choose, the command to get software
--   on your instance varies. Amazon Linux and CentOS use <tt>yum</tt>,
--   Debian and Ubuntu use <tt>apt-get</tt>, and FreeBSD uses <tt>pkg</tt>.
--   For a complete list, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ipAddressType:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_ipAddressType</a> - The IP address type for the
--   instance.
--   
--   The possible values are <tt>ipv4</tt> for IPv4 only, and
--   <tt>dualstack</tt> for IPv4 and IPv6.
--   
--   The default value is <tt>dualstack</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyPairName:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_keyPairName</a> - The name of your key pair.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_tags</a> - The
--   tag keys and optional values to add to the resource during create.
--   
--   Use the <tt>TagResource</tt> action to tag a resource after it's
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceNames:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_instanceNames</a> - The names to use for your new
--   Lightsail instances. Separate multiple values using quotation marks
--   and commas, for example:
--   <tt>["MyFirstInstance","MySecondInstance"]</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:availabilityZone:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_availabilityZone</a> - The Availability Zone in
--   which to create your instance. Use the following format:
--   <tt>us-east-2a</tt> (case sensitive). You can get a list of
--   Availability Zones by using the <a>get regions</a> operation. Be sure
--   to add the <tt>include Availability Zones</tt> parameter to your
--   request.
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintId:CreateInstances'</a>,
--   <a>createInstances_blueprintId</a> - The ID for a virtual private
--   server image (e.g., <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or
--   <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>). Use the <tt>get blueprints</tt> operation to
--   return a list of available images (or <i>blueprints</i>).
--   
--   Use active blueprints when creating new instances. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances and are not
--   necessarily available to create new instances. Blueprints are marked
--   inactive when they become outdated due to operating system updates or
--   new application releases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:CreateInstances'</a>, <a>createInstances_bundleId</a>
--   - The bundle of specification information for your virtual private
--   server (or <i>instance</i>), including the pricing plan (e.g.,
--   <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).

--   <a>$sel:serviceName:DeleteContainerImage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContainerImage_serviceName</a> - The name of the container
--   service for which to delete a registered container image.
--   
--   <a>$sel:image:DeleteContainerImage'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContainerImage_image</a> - The name of the container image to
--   delete from the container service.
--   
--   Use the <tt>GetContainerImages</tt> action to get the name of the
--   container images that are registered to a container service.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
newDeleteContainerImage :: Text -> Text -> DeleteContainerImage

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDeleteContainerImageResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DeleteContainerImageResponse
DeleteContainerImageResponse' :: Int -> DeleteContainerImageResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DeleteContainerImageResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DeleteContainerImageResponse'</a>,
--   <a>deleteContainerImageResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDeleteContainerImageResponse :: Int -> DeleteContainerImageResponse

--   
--   To get a page token, perform an initial <tt>GetBundles</tt> request.
--   If your results are paginated, the response will return a next page
--   token that you can specify as the page token in a subsequent request.
newGetBundles :: GetBundles

--   <li><tt>deny</tt> - Denies access to the bucket and its objects. Use

--   <tt>allow</tt>.</li>

-- | Describes an access key for an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   Access keys grant full programmatic access to the specified bucket and
--   its objects. You can have a maximum of two access keys per bucket. Use
--   the CreateBucketAccessKey action to create an access key for a
--   specific bucket. For more information about access keys, see
--   <a>Creating access keys for a bucket in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   The <tt>secretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to the
--   <tt>CreateBucketAccessKey</tt> action. You can get a secret access key
--   only when you first create an access key; you cannot get the secret
--   access key later. If you lose the secret access key, you must create a
--   new access key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKey</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKey
AccessKey' :: Maybe StatusType -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessKeyLastUsed -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> AccessKey

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKey</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_status</a> - The status of
--   the access key.
--   
--   A status of <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid, while
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the access key was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKey'</a>,
--   <a>accessKey_secretAccessKey</a> - The secret access key used to sign
--   requests.
--   
--   You should store the secret access key in a safe location. We
--   recommend that you delete the access key if the secret access key is
--   compromised.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsed:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_lastUsed</a> - An object
--   that describes the last time the access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action. If the access key has not been used, the
--   <tt>region</tt> and <tt>serviceName</tt> values are <tt>N/A</tt>, and
--   the <tt>lastUsedDate</tt> value is null.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKey'</a>, <a>accessKey_accessKeyId</a> - The
--   ID of the access key.
newAccessKey :: AccessKey

-- | Describes the last time an access key was used.
--   
--   This object does not include data in the response of a
--   CreateBucketAccessKey action.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyLastUsed</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyLastUsed
AccessKeyLastUsed' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyLastUsed</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsedDate:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate</a> - The date and time when the
--   access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is null if the access key has not been used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName</a> - The name of the AWS service
--   with which this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>, <a>accessKeyLastUsed_region</a>
--   - The AWS Region where this access key was most recently used.
--   
--   This value is <tt>N/A</tt> if the access key has not been used.
newAccessKeyLastUsed :: AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | Describes the anonymous access permissions for an Amazon Lightsail
--   bucket and its objects.
--   
--   For more information about bucket access permissions, see
--   <a>Understanding bucket permissions in Amazon Lightsail</a> in the
--   
--   <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessRules</a> smart constructor.
data AccessRules
AccessRules' :: Maybe AccessType -> Maybe Bool -> AccessRules

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessRules</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:getObject:AccessRules'</a>, <a>accessRules_getObject</a> -
--   Specifies the anonymous access to all objects in a bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>public</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to public
--   (read-only), making them readable by anyone in the world.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>public</tt>, then all objects
--   in the bucket default to public regardless of the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value.</li>
--   <li><tt>private</tt> - Sets all objects in the bucket to private,
--   making them readable only by you or anyone you give access to.If the
--   <tt>getObject</tt> value is set to <tt>private</tt>, and the
--   <tt>allowPublicOverrides</tt> value is set to <tt>true</tt>, then all
--   objects in the bucket default to private unless they are configured
--   with a <tt>public-read</tt> ACL. Individual objects with a
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL are readable by anyone in the world.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowPublicOverrides:AccessRules'</a>,
--   <a>accessRules_allowPublicOverrides</a> - A Boolean value that
--   indicates whether the access control list (ACL) permissions that are
--   applied to individual objects override the <tt>getObject</tt> option
--   that is currently specified.
--   
--   When this is true, you can use the <a>PutObjectAcl</a> Amazon S3 API
--   action to set individual objects to public (read-only) using the
--   <tt>public-read</tt> ACL, or to private using the <tt>private</tt>
--   ACL.
newAccessRules :: AccessRules

-- | Describes an add-on that is enabled for an Amazon Lightsail resource.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAddOn</a> smart constructor.
data AddOn
AddOn' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AddOn

-- | Create a value of <a>AddOn</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_status</a> - The status of the
--   add-on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextSnapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'</a>,
--   <a>addOn_nextSnapshotTimeOfDay</a> - The next daily time an automatic
--   snapshot will be created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_snapshotTimeOfDay</a> -
--   The daily time when an automatic snapshot is created.
--   
--   The time shown is in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in Coordinated
--   Universal Time (UTC).
--   
--   The snapshot is automatically created between the time shown and up to
--   45 minutes after.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:AddOn'</a>, <a>addOn_name</a> - The name of the add-on.
newAddOn :: AddOn

-- | Describes a request to enable, modify, or disable an add-on for an
--   Amazon Lightsail resource.

data AddOnRequest

newAddOnRequest :: AddOnType -> AddOnRequest

-- | Describes an alarm.
--   
--   An alarm is a way to monitor your Lightsail resource metrics. For more
--   information, see <a>Alarms in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAlarm</a> smart constructor.
data Alarm
Alarm' :: Maybe AlarmState -> Maybe TreatMissingData -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe [ContactProtocol] -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Int -> Maybe MetricName -> Maybe ComparisonOperator -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe [AlarmState] -> Maybe MetricStatistic -> Maybe MetricUnit -> Maybe MonitoredResourceInfo -> Alarm

-- | Create a value of <a>Alarm</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_state</a> - The current state of
--   the alarm.
--   
--   An alarm has the following possible states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>ALARM</tt> - The metric is outside of the defined
--   threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>INSUFFICIENT_DATA</tt> - The alarm has just started, the
--   metric is not available, or not enough data is available for the
--   metric to determine the alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The metric is within the defined threshold.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:treatMissingData:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_treatMissingData</a> -
--   Specifies how the alarm handles missing data points.
--   
--   An alarm can treat missing data in the following ways:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>breaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is not within the
--   threshold. Missing data counts towards the number of times the metric
--   is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>notBreaching</tt> - Assume the missing data is within the
--   threshold. Missing data does not count towards the number of times the
--   metric is not within the threshold.</li>
--   <li><tt>ignore</tt> - Ignore the missing data. Maintains the current
--   alarm state.</li>
--   <li><tt>missing</tt> - Missing data is treated as missing.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>Alarm</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_createdAt</a> - The timestamp
--   when the alarm was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_location</a> - An object that
--   lists information about the location of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactProtocols:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_contactProtocols</a> -
--   The contact protocols for the alarm, such as <tt>Email</tt>,
--   <tt>SMS</tt> (text messaging), or both.
--   
--   <a>$sel:period:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_period</a> - The period, in
--   seconds, over which the statistic is applied.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationPeriods:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_evaluationPeriods</a> -
--   The number of periods over which data is compared to the specified
--   threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricName:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_metricName</a> - The name of
--   the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:comparisonOperator:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_comparisonOperator</a>
--   - The arithmetic operation used when comparing the specified statistic
--   and threshold.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_name</a> - The name of the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:threshold:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_threshold</a> - The value
--   against which the specified statistic is compared.
--   
--   <a>$sel:datapointsToAlarm:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_datapointsToAlarm</a> -
--   The number of data points that must not within the specified threshold
--   to trigger the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_supportCode</a> - The support
--   code. Include this code in your email to support when you have
--   questions about your Lightsail alarm. This code enables our support
--   team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationEnabled:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationEnabled</a> - Indicates whether the alarm is
--   enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notificationTriggers:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_notificationTriggers</a> - The alarm states that trigger a
--   notification.
--   
--   <a>$sel:statistic:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_statistic</a> - The statistic
--   for the metric associated with the alarm.
--   
--   The following statistics are available:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Minimum</tt> - The lowest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine low volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Maximum</tt> - The highest value observed during the specified
--   period. Use this value to determine high volumes of activity for your
--   application.</li>
--   <li><tt>Sum</tt> - All values submitted for the matching metric added
--   together. You can use this statistic to determine the total volume of
--   a metric.</li>
--   <li><tt>Average</tt> - The value of Sum / SampleCount during the
--   specified period. By comparing this statistic with the Minimum and
--   Maximum values, you can determine the full scope of a metric and how
--   close the average use is to the Minimum and Maximum values. This
--   comparison helps you to know when to increase or decrease your
--   resources.</li>
--   <li><tt>SampleCount</tt> - The count, or number, of data points used
--   for the statistical calculation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:unit:Alarm'</a>, <a>alarm_unit</a> - The unit of the metric
--   associated with the alarm.
--   
--   <a>$sel:monitoredResourceInfo:Alarm'</a>,
--   <a>alarm_monitoredResourceInfo</a> - An object that lists information
--   about the resource monitored by the alarm.
newAlarm :: Alarm

-- | Describes a block storage disk that is attached to an instance, and is
--   included in an automatic snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachedDisk</a> smart constructor.
data AttachedDisk
AttachedDisk' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> AttachedDisk

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachedDisk</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:AttachedDisk'</a>, <a>attachedDisk_path</a> - The path of
--   the disk (e.g., <tt>/dev/xvdf</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:sizeInGb:AttachedDisk'</a>, <a>attachedDisk_sizeInGb</a> - The
--   size of the disk in GB.
newAttachedDisk :: AttachedDisk

-- | Describes a request to enable or modify the automatic snapshot add-on
--   for an Amazon Lightsail instance or disk.
--   
--   When you modify the automatic snapshot time for a resource, it is
--   typically effective immediately except under the following conditions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has been created for the current day, and
--   you change the snapshot time to a later time of day, then the new
--   snapshot time will be effective the following day. This ensures that
--   two snapshots are not created for the current day.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has not yet been created for the current
--   day, and you change the snapshot time to an earlier time of day, then
--   the new snapshot time will be effective the following day and a
--   snapshot is automatically created at the previously set time for the
--   current day. This ensures that a snapshot is created for the current
--   day.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot has not yet been created for the current
--   day, and you change the snapshot time to a time that is within 30
--   minutes from your current time, then the new snapshot time will be
--   effective the following day and a snapshot is automatically created at
--   the previously set time for the current day. This ensures that a
--   snapshot is created for the current day, because 30 minutes is
--   required between your current time and the new snapshot time that you
--   specify.</li>
--   <li>If an automatic snapshot is scheduled to be created within 30
--   minutes from your current time and you change the snapshot time, then
--   the new snapshot time will be effective the following day and a
--   snapshot is automatically created at the previously set time for the
--   current day. This ensures that a snapshot is created for the current
--   day, because 30 minutes is required between your current time and the
--   new snapshot time that you specify.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoSnapshotAddOnRequest</a> smart constructor.
data AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest
AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest' :: Maybe Text -> AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:snapshotTimeOfDay:AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotAddOnRequest_snapshotTimeOfDay</a> - The daily time
--   when an automatic snapshot will be created.
--   
--   Constraints:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Must be in <tt>HH:00</tt> format, and in an hourly increment.</li>
--   <li>Specified in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).</li>
--   <li>The snapshot will be automatically created between the time
--   specified and up to 45 minutes after.</li>
--   </ul>
newAutoSnapshotAddOnRequest :: AutoSnapshotAddOnRequest

-- | Describes an automatic snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAutoSnapshotDetails</a> smart constructor.
data AutoSnapshotDetails
AutoSnapshotDetails' :: Maybe AutoSnapshotStatus -> Maybe [AttachedDisk] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> AutoSnapshotDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>AutoSnapshotDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   snapshot.

--   <a>autoSnapshotDetails_fromAttachedDisks</a> - An array of objects
--   that describe the block storage disks attached to the instance when
--   the automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>,
--   <a>autoSnapshotDetails_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   automatic snapshot was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:date:AutoSnapshotDetails'</a>, <a>autoSnapshotDetails_date</a>

-- | Describes a blueprint (a virtual private server image).
--

data Blueprint
Blueprint' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe InstancePlatform -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe BlueprintType -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Blueprint

-- | Create a value of <a>Blueprint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:versionCode:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_versionCode</a> - The
--   version code.
--   
--   <a>$sel:platform:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_platform</a> - The
--   operating system platform (either Linux/Unix-based or Windows
--   Server-based) of the blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:group':Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_group</a> - The group name
--   of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>amazon-linux</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:minPower:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_minPower</a> - The
--   minimum bundle power required to run this blueprint. For example, you
--   need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to create an instance
--   that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of 500. <tt>0</tt>
--   indicates that the blueprint runs on all instance sizes.
--   
--   <a>$sel:productUrl:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_productUrl</a> - The
--   product URL to learn more about the image or blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:licenseUrl:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_licenseUrl</a> - The
--   end-user license agreement URL for the image or blueprint.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_name</a> - The friendly name
--   of the blueprint (e.g., <tt>Amazon Linux</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_version</a> - The version
--   number of the operating system, application, or stack (e.g.,
--   <tt>2016.03.0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:blueprintId:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_blueprintId</a> - The
--   ID for the virtual private server image (e.g.,
--   <tt>app_wordpress_4_4</tt> or <tt>app_lamp_7_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_type</a> - The type of the
--   blueprint (e.g., <tt>os</tt> or <tt>app</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_isActive</a> - A Boolean
--   value indicating whether the blueprint is active. Inactive blueprints
--   are listed to support customers with existing instances but are not
--   necessarily available for launch of new instances. Blueprints are
--   marked inactive when they become outdated due to operating system
--   updates or new application releases.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Blueprint'</a>, <a>blueprint_description</a> - The
--   description of the blueprint.
newBlueprint :: Blueprint

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucket</a> smart constructor.
data Bucket
Bucket' :: Maybe BucketState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResourceReceivingAccess] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessRules -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Bucket

-- | Create a value of <a>Bucket</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_state</a> - An object that
--   describes the state of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:objectVersioning:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_objectVersioning</a> -
--   Indicates whether object versioning is enabled for the bucket.
--   
--   The following options can be configured:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Enabled</tt> - Object versioning is enabled.</li>
--   <li><tt>Suspended</tt> - Object versioning was previously enabled but
--   is currently suspended. Existing object versions are retained.</li>
--   <li><tt>NeverEnabled</tt> - Object versioning has never been
--   enabled.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type of the bucket (for example, <tt>Bucket</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_createdAt</a> - The timestamp
--   when the distribution was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_location</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:readonlyAccessAccounts:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_readonlyAccessAccounts</a> - An array of strings that
--   specify the AWS account IDs that have read-only access to the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_url</a> - The URL of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourcesReceivingAccess:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_resourcesReceivingAccess</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe Lightsail instances that have access to the bucket.
--   
--   Use the SetResourceAccessForBucket action to update the instances that
--   have access to a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_bundleId</a> - The ID of the
--   bundle currently applied to the bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change the bundle of a bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessRules:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_accessRules</a> - An object
--   that describes the access rules of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ableToUpdateBundle:Bucket'</a>,
--   <a>bucket_ableToUpdateBundle</a> - Indicates whether the bundle that
--   is currently applied to a bucket can be changed to another bundle.
--   
--   You can update a bucket's bundle only one time within a monthly AWS
--   billing cycle.
--   
--   Use the UpdateBucketBundle action to change a bucket's bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_name</a> - The name of the bucket.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_supportCode</a> - The
--   support code for a bucket. Include this code in your email to support
--   when you have questions about a Lightsail bucket. This code enables
--   our support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Bucket'</a>, <a>bucket_tags</a> - The tag keys and
--   optional values for the bucket. For more information, see <a>Tags in
--   Amazon Lightsail</a> in the <i>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</i>.
newBucket :: Bucket

-- | Describes the specifications of a bundle that can be applied to an
--   Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   A bucket bundle specifies the monthly cost, storage space, and data
--   transfer quota for a bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketBundle</a> smart constructor.
data BucketBundle
BucketBundle' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> BucketBundle

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketBundle</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:storagePerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>bucketBundle_storagePerMonthInGb</a> - The storage size of the
--   bundle, in GB.
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:BucketBundle'</a>,
--   <a>bucketBundle_transferPerMonthInGb</a> - The monthly network
--   transfer quota of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_bundleId</a> - The
--   ID of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_name</a> - The name of
--   the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_price</a> - The
--   monthly price of the bundle, in US dollars.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:BucketBundle'</a>, <a>bucketBundle_isActive</a> -
--   Indicates whether the bundle is active. Use for a new or existing
--   bucket.
newBucketBundle :: BucketBundle

-- | Describes the state of an Amazon Lightsail bucket.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBucketState</a> smart constructor.
data BucketState
BucketState' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> BucketState

-- | Create a value of <a>BucketState</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:BucketState'</a>, <a>bucketState_code</a> - The state
--   code of the bucket.
--   
--   The following codes are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>OK</tt> - The bucket is in a running state.</li>
--   <li><tt>Unknown</tt> - Creation of the bucket might have timed-out.
--   You might want to delete the bucket and create a new one.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:BucketState'</a>, <a>bucketState_message</a> - A
--   message that describes the state of the bucket.
newBucketState :: BucketState

-- | Describes a bundle, which is a set of specs describing your virtual
--   private server (or <i>instance</i>).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newBundle</a> smart constructor.
data Bundle
Bundle' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Int -> Maybe [InstancePlatform] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Double -> Bundle

-- | Create a value of <a>Bundle</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:cpuCount:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_cpuCount</a> - The number of
--   vCPUs included in the bundle (e.g., <tt>2</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:transferPerMonthInGb:Bundle'</a>,
--   <a>bundle_transferPerMonthInGb</a> - The data transfer rate per month
--   in GB (e.g., <tt>2000</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:bundleId:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_bundleId</a> - The bundle ID
--   (e.g., <tt>micro_1_0</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceType:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_instanceType</a> - The
--   Amazon EC2 instance type (e.g., <tt>t2.micro</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_name</a> - A friendly name for the
--   bundle (e.g., <tt>Micro</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:power:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_power</a> - A numeric value that
--   represents the power of the bundle (e.g., <tt>500</tt>). You can use
--   the bundle's power value in conjunction with a blueprint's minimum
--   power value to determine whether the blueprint will run on the bundle.
--   For example, you need a bundle with a power value of 500 or more to
--   create an instance that uses a blueprint with a minimum power value of
--   500.
--   
--   <a>$sel:diskSizeInGb:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_diskSizeInGb</a> - The
--   size of the SSD (e.g., <tt>30</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportedPlatforms:Bundle'</a>,
--   <a>bundle_supportedPlatforms</a> - The operating system platform
--   (Linux/Unix-based or Windows Server-based) that the bundle supports.
--   You can only launch a <tt>WINDOWS</tt> bundle on a blueprint that
--   supports the <tt>WINDOWS</tt> platform. <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> blueprints
--   require a <tt>LINUX_UNIX</tt> bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:price:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_price</a> - The price in US
--   dollars (e.g., <tt>5.0</tt>) of the bundle.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isActive:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_isActive</a> - A Boolean value
--   indicating whether the bundle is active.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ramSizeInGb:Bundle'</a>, <a>bundle_ramSizeInGb</a> - The
--   amount of RAM in GB (e.g., <tt>2.0</tt>).
newBundle :: Bundle

-- | Describes the default cache behavior of an Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheBehavior</a> smart constructor.
data CacheBehavior
CacheBehavior' :: Maybe BehaviorEnum -> CacheBehavior

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheBehavior</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:CacheBehavior'</a>, <a>cacheBehavior_behavior</a> -
--   The cache behavior of the distribution.
--   
--   The following cache behaviors can be specified:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This option is best for static sites. When
--   specified, your distribution caches and serves your entire website as
--   static content. This behavior is ideal for websites with static
--   content that doesn't change depending on who views it, or for websites
--   that don't use cookies, headers, or query strings to personalize
--   content.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This option is best for sites that
--   serve a mix of static and dynamic content. When specified, your
--   distribution caches and serve only the content that is specified in
--   the distribution's <tt>CacheBehaviorPerPath</tt> parameter. This
--   behavior is ideal for websites or web applications that use cookies,
--   headers, and query strings to personalize content for individual
--   users.</li>
--   </ul>
newCacheBehavior :: CacheBehavior

-- | Describes the per-path cache behavior of an Amazon Lightsail content
--   delivery network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   A per-path cache behavior is used to override, or add an exception to,
--   the default cache behavior of a distribution. For example, if the
--   <tt>cacheBehavior</tt> is set to <tt>cache</tt>, then a per-path cache
--   behavior can be used to specify a directory, file, or file type that
--   your distribution will cache. Alternately, if the distribution's
--   <tt>cacheBehavior</tt> is <tt>dont-cache</tt>, then a per-path cache
--   behavior can be used to specify a directory, file, or file type that
--   your distribution will not cache.
--   
--   if the cacheBehavior's behavior is set to 'cache', then
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheBehaviorPerPath</a> smart constructor.
data CacheBehaviorPerPath
CacheBehaviorPerPath' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe BehaviorEnum -> CacheBehaviorPerPath

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheBehaviorPerPath</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:CacheBehaviorPerPath'</a>,
--   <a>cacheBehaviorPerPath_path</a> - The path to a directory or file to
--   cached, or not cache. Use an asterisk symbol to specify wildcard
--   directories (<tt>path/to/assets/*</tt>), and file types (<tt>*.html,
--   *jpg, *js</tt>). Directories and file paths are case-sensitive.
--   
--   Examples:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache all files in the document root of
--   an Apache web server running on a Lightsail
--   instance.<pre>var/www/html/</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following file to cache only the index page in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/index.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .html files in the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/*.html</pre></li>
--   <li>Specify the following to cache only the .jpg, .png, and .gif files
--   in the images sub-directory of the document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/*.jpg</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.png</pre><pre>var/www/html/images/*.gif</pre>Specify
--   the following to cache all files in the images sub-directory of the
--   document root of an Apache web
--   server.<pre>var/www/html/images/</pre></li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:behavior:CacheBehaviorPerPath'</a>,
--   <a>cacheBehaviorPerPath_behavior</a> - The cache behavior for the
--   specified path.
--   
--   You can specify one of the following per-path cache behaviors:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>cache</tt></b> - This behavior caches the specified
--   path.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>dont-cache</tt></b> - This behavior doesn't cache the
--   specified path.</li>
--   </ul>
newCacheBehaviorPerPath :: CacheBehaviorPerPath

-- | Describes the cache settings of an Amazon Lightsail content delivery
--   network (CDN) distribution.
--   
--   These settings apply only to your distribution's
--   <tt>cacheBehaviors</tt> (including the <tt>defaultCacheBehavior</tt>)
--   that have a <tt>behavior</tt> of <tt>cache</tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCacheSettings</a> smart constructor.
data CacheSettings
CacheSettings' :: Maybe Integer -> Maybe Text -> Maybe CookieObject -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe Integer -> Maybe HeaderObject -> Maybe QueryStringObject -> CacheSettings

-- | Create a value of <a>CacheSettings</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maximumTTL:CacheSettings'</a>, <a>cacheSettings_maximumTTL</a>
--   - The maximum amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the object has been updated.
--   
--   The value specified applies only when the origin adds HTTP headers
--   such as <tt>Cache-Control max-age</tt>, <tt>Cache-Control
--   s-maxage</tt>, and <tt>Expires</tt> to objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:cachedHTTPMethods:CacheSettings'</a>,
--   <a>cacheSettings_cachedHTTPMethods</a> - The HTTP method responses
--   that are cached by your distribution.
--   
--   You can specify the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD</tt> - The distribution caches responses to the
--   <tt>GET</tt> and <tt>HEAD</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS</tt> - The distribution caches responses to
--   the <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, and <tt>OPTIONS</tt> methods.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardedCookies:CacheSettings'</a>,
--   <a>cacheSettings_forwardedCookies</a> - An object that describes the
--   cookies that are forwarded to the origin. Your content is cached based
--   on the cookies that are forwarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedHTTPMethods:CacheSettings'</a>,
--   <a>cacheSettings_allowedHTTPMethods</a> - The HTTP methods that are
--   processed and forwarded to the distribution's origin.
--   
--   You can specify the following options:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD</tt> - The distribution forwards the <tt>GET</tt> and
--   <tt>HEAD</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS</tt> - The distribution forwards the
--   <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, and <tt>OPTIONS</tt> methods.</li>
--   <li><tt>GET,HEAD,OPTIONS,PUT,PATCH,POST,DELETE</tt> - The distribution
--   forwards the <tt>GET</tt>, <tt>HEAD</tt>, <tt>OPTIONS</tt>,
--   <tt>PUT</tt>, <tt>PATCH</tt>, <tt>POST</tt>, and <tt>DELETE</tt>
--   methods.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you specify the third option, you might need to restrict access to
--   your distribution's origin so users can't perform operations that you
--   don't want them to. For example, you might not want users to have
--   permission to delete objects from your origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultTTL:CacheSettings'</a>, <a>cacheSettings_defaultTTL</a>
--   - The default amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the content has been updated.
--   
--   The value specified applies only when the origin does not add HTTP
--   headers such as <tt>Cache-Control max-age</tt>, <tt>Cache-Control
--   s-maxage</tt>, and <tt>Expires</tt> to objects.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumTTL:CacheSettings'</a>, <a>cacheSettings_minimumTTL</a>
--   - The minimum amount of time that objects stay in the distribution's
--   cache before the distribution forwards another request to the origin
--   to determine whether the object has been updated.
--   
--   A value of <tt>0</tt> must be specified for <tt>minimumTTL</tt> if the
--   distribution is configured to forward all headers to the origin.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardedHeaders:CacheSettings'</a>,
--   <a>cacheSettings_forwardedHeaders</a> - An object that describes the
--   headers that are forwarded to the origin. Your content is cached based
--   on the headers that are forwarded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:forwardedQueryStrings:CacheSettings'</a>,
--   <a>cacheSettings_forwardedQueryStrings</a> - An object that describes
--   the query strings that are forwarded to the origin. Your content is
--   cached based on the query strings that are forwarded.
newCacheSettings :: CacheSettings

-- | Describes the full details of an Amazon Lightsail SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   To get a summary of a certificate, use the <tt>GetCertificates</tt>
--   action and ommit <tt>includeCertificateDetails</tt> from your request.
--   The response will include only the certificate Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN), certificate name, domain name, and tags.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data Certificate
Certificate' :: Maybe CertificateStatus -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe RenewalSummary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [DomainValidationRecord] -> Maybe Int -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe POSIX -> Certificate

-- | Create a value of <a>Certificate</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_status</a> - The
--   validation status of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:subjectAlternativeNames:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_subjectAlternativeNames</a> - An array of strings that
--   specify the alternate domains (e.g., <tt>example2.com</tt>) and
--   subdomains (e.g., <tt>blog.example.com</tt>) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_createdAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:eligibleToRenew:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_eligibleToRenew</a> - The renewal eligibility of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestFailureReason:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_requestFailureReason</a> - The validation failure
--   reason, if any, of the certificate.
--   
--   The following failure reasons are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><b><tt>NO_AVAILABLE_CONTACTS</tt></b> - This failure applies to
--   email validation, which is not available for Lightsail
--   certificates.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>ADDITIONAL_VERIFICATION_REQUIRED</tt></b> - Lightsail
--   requires additional information to process this certificate request.
--   This can happen as a fraud-protection measure, such as when the domain
--   ranks within the Alexa top 1000 websites. To provide the required
--   information, use the <a>AWS Support Center</a> to contact AWS
--   Support.You cannot request a certificate for Amazon-owned domain names
--   such as those ending in amazonaws.com, cloudfront.net, or
--   elasticbeanstalk.com.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>DOMAIN_NOT_ALLOWED</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request was reported as an unsafe domain by
--   <a>VirusTotal</a>. To correct the problem, search for your domain name
--   on the <a>VirusTotal</a> website. If your domain is reported as
--   suspicious, see <a>Google Help for Hacked Websites</a> to learn what
--   you can do.If you believe that the result is a false positive, notify
--   the organization that is reporting the domain. VirusTotal is an
--   aggregate of several antivirus and URL scanners and cannot remove your
--   domain from a block list itself. After you correct the problem and the
--   VirusTotal registry has been updated, request a new certificate.If you
--   see this error and your domain is not included in the VirusTotal list,
--   visit the <a>AWS Support Center</a> and create a case.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>INVALID_PUBLIC_DOMAIN</tt></b> - One or more of the domain
--   names in the certificate request is not valid. Typically, this is
--   because a domain name in the request is not a valid top-level domain.
--   Try to request a certificate again, correcting any spelling errors or
--   typos that were in the failed request, and ensure that all domain
--   names in the request are for valid top-level domains. For example, you
--   cannot request a certificate for <tt>example.invalidpublicdomain</tt>
--   because <tt>invalidpublicdomain</tt> is not a valid top-level
--   domain.</li>
--   <li><b><tt>OTHER</tt></b> - Typically, this failure occurs when there
--   is a typographical error in one or more of the domain names in the
--   certificate request. Try to request a certificate again, correcting
--   any spelling errors or typos that were in the failed request.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:revokedAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_revokedAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was revoked. This value is present only
--   when the certificate status is <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notBefore:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_notBefore</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate is first valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:revocationReason:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_revocationReason</a> - The reason the certificate was
--   revoked. This value is present only when the certificate status is
--   <tt>REVOKED</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_domainName</a> -
--   The domain name of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_name</a> - The name of
--   the certificate (e.g., <tt>my-certificate</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:renewalSummary:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_renewalSummary</a> - An object that describes the
--   status of the certificate renewal managed by Lightsail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_supportCode</a> -
--   The support code. Include this code in your email to support when you
--   have questions about your Lightsail certificate. This code enables our
--   support team to look up your Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainValidationRecords:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_domainValidationRecords</a> - An array of objects that
--   describe the domain validation records of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:inUseResourceCount:Certificate'</a>,
--   <a>certificate_inUseResourceCount</a> - The number of Lightsail
--   resources that the certificate is attached to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuedAt:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_issuedAt</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate was issued.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keyAlgorithm:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_keyAlgorithm</a>
--   - The algorithm used to generate the key pair (the public and private
--   key) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_serialNumber</a>
--   - The serial number of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:issuerCA:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_issuerCA</a> - The
--   certificate authority that issued the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_tags</a> - The tag keys
--   and optional values for the resource. For more information about tags
--   in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer Guide</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:notAfter:Certificate'</a>, <a>certificate_notAfter</a> - The
--   timestamp when the certificate expires.
newCertificate :: Certificate

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail SSL/TLS certificate.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCertificateSummary</a> smart constructor.
data CertificateSummary
CertificateSummary' :: Maybe Certificate -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> CertificateSummary

-- | Create a value of <a>CertificateSummary</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateDetail:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateDetail</a> - An object that describes
--   a certificate in detail.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateName:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateName</a> - The name of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateArn:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_certificateArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:domainName:CertificateSummary'</a>,
--   <a>certificateSummary_domainName</a> - The domain name of the
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:CertificateSummary'</a>, <a>certificateSummary_tags</a> -
--   The tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more
--   information about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail
--   Developer Guide</a>.
newCertificateSummary :: CertificateSummary

-- | Describes a CloudFormation stack record created as a result of the
--   <tt>create cloud formation stack</tt> action.
--   
--   A CloudFormation stack record provides information about the AWS
--   CloudFormation stack used to create a new Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud
--   instance from an exported Lightsail instance snapshot.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudFormationStackRecord</a> smart constructor.
data CloudFormationStackRecord
CloudFormationStackRecord' :: Maybe RecordState -> Maybe DestinationInfo -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo] -> CloudFormationStackRecord

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudFormationStackRecord</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_state</a> - The current state of the
--   CloudFormation stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:destinationInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_destinationInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the destination service, which is AWS CloudFormation, and
--   the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS CloudFormation stack.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource
--   type (e.g., <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   of the CloudFormation stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_createdAt</a> - The date when the
--   CloudFormation stack record was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_location</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the Availability Zone and AWS Region of the CloudFormation
--   stack record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_name</a> - The name of the CloudFormation
--   stack record. It starts with <tt>CloudFormationStackRecord</tt>
--   followed by a GUID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourceInfo:CloudFormationStackRecord'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecord_sourceInfo</a> - A list of objects
--   describing the source of the CloudFormation stack record.
newCloudFormationStackRecord :: CloudFormationStackRecord

-- | Describes the source of a CloudFormation stack record (i.e., the
--   export snapshot record).
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newCloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo</a> smart
--   constructor.
data CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo
CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo' :: Maybe CloudFormationStackRecordSourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_resourceType</a> - The
--   Lightsail resource type (e.g., <tt>ExportSnapshotRecord</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource
--   Name (ARN) of the export snapshot record.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo'</a>,
--   <a>cloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo_name</a> - The name of the
--   record.
newCloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo :: CloudFormationStackRecordSourceInfo

-- | Describes a contact method.
--   
--   A contact method is a way to send you notifications. For more
--   information, see <a>Notifications in Amazon Lightsail</a>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContactMethod</a> smart constructor.
data ContactMethod
ContactMethod' :: Maybe ContactMethodStatus -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe ContactProtocol -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ContactMethod

-- | Create a value of <a>ContactMethod</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_status</a> - The
--   current status of the contact method.
--   
--   A contact method has the following possible status:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PendingVerification</tt> - The contact method has not yet been
--   verified, and the verification has not yet expired.</li>
--   <li><tt>Valid</tt> - The contact method has been verified.</li>
--   <li><tt>InValid</tt> - An attempt was made to verify the contact
--   method, but the verification has expired.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource type (e.g.,
--   <tt>ContactMethod</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_arn</a> - The Amazon
--   Resource Name (ARN) of the contact method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_createdAt</a> -
--   The timestamp when the contact method was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_location</a> -
--   Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:protocol:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_protocol</a> -
--   The protocol of the contact method, such as email or SMS (text
--   messaging).
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:ContactMethod'</a>, <a>contactMethod_name</a> - The name
--   of the contact method.
--   
--   <a>$sel:supportCode:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_supportCode</a> - The support code. Include this code
--   in your email to support when you have questions about your Lightsail
--   contact method. This code enables our support team to look up your
--   Lightsail information more easily.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contactEndpoint:ContactMethod'</a>,
--   <a>contactMethod_contactEndpoint</a> - The destination of the contact
--   method, such as an email address or a mobile phone number.
newContactMethod :: ContactMethod

--   image used for the container.
--   
--   Container images sourced from your Lightsail container service, that
--   are registered and stored on your service, start with a colon
--   (<tt>:</tt>). For example,
--   <tt>:container-service-1.mystaticwebsite.1</tt>. Container images
--   sourced from a public registry like Docker Hub don't start with a
--   colon. For example, <tt>nginx:latest</tt> or <tt>nginx</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:command:Container'</a>, <a>container_command</a> - The launch
--   command for the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:environment:Container'</a>, <a>container_environment</a> - The
--   environment variables of the container.
--   
--   <a>$sel:ports:Container'</a>, <a>container_ports</a> - The open
--   firewall ports of the container.
newContainer :: Container

-- | Describes an Amazon Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerService</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerService
ContainerService' :: Maybe ContainerServiceState -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ResourceType -> Maybe Text -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe ResourceLocation -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceStateDetail -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServicePowerName -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe (HashMap Text [Text]) -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContainerServiceDeployment -> Maybe [Tag] -> ContainerService

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerService</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_state</a> -
--   The current state of the container service.
--   
--   The following container service states are possible:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>PENDING</tt> - The container service is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>READY</tt> - The container service is running but it does not
--   have an active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>DEPLOYING</tt> - The container service is launching a
--   container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>RUNNING</tt> - The container service is running and it has an
--   active container deployment.</li>
--   <li><tt>UPDATING</tt> - The container service capacity or its custom
--   domains are being updated.</li>
--   <li><tt>DELETING</tt> - The container service is being deleted.</li>
--   <li><tt>DISABLED</tt> - The container service is disabled, and its
--   active deployment and containers, if any, are shut down.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:powerId:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_powerId</a>
--   - The ID of the power of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceType:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_resourceType</a> - The Lightsail resource type of
--   the container service (i.e., <tt>ContainerService</tt>).
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the container
--   service was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:location:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_location</a> - An object that describes the
--   location of the container service, such as the AWS Region and
--   Availability Zone.
--   
--   <a>$sel:scale:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_scale</a> -
--   The scale specification of the container service.
--   
--   The scale specifies the allocated compute nodes of the container
--   service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:url:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_url</a> - The
--   publicly accessible URL of the container service.
--   
--   If no public endpoint is specified in the <tt>currentDeployment</tt>,
--   this URL returns a 404 response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:stateDetail:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_stateDetail</a> - An object that describes the
--   current state of the container service.
--   
--   The state detail is populated only when a container service is in a
--   <tt>PENDING</tt>, <tt>DEPLOYING</tt>, or <tt>UPDATING</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextDeployment:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_nextDeployment</a> - An object that describes the
--   next deployment of the container service.
--   
--   This value is <tt>null</tt> when there is no deployment in a
--   <tt>pending</tt> state.
--   
--   <a>$sel:principalArn:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_principalArn</a> - The principal ARN of the
--   container service.
--   
--   The principal ARN can be used to create a trust relationship between
--   your standard AWS account and your Lightsail container service. This
--   allows you to give your service permission to access resources in your
--   standard AWS account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:power:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_power</a> -
--   The power specification of the container service.
--   
--   The power specifies the amount of RAM, the number of vCPUs, and the
--   base price of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:privateDomainName:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_privateDomainName</a> - The private domain name of
--   the container service.
--   
--   The private domain name is accessible only by other resources within
--   the default virtual private cloud (VPC) of your Lightsail account.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isDisabled:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_isDisabled</a> - A Boolean value indicating
--   whether the container service is disabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicDomainNames:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_publicDomainNames</a> - The public domain name of
--   the container service, such as <tt>example.com</tt> and
--   <tt>www.example.com</tt>.
--   
--   You can specify up to four public domain names for a container
--   service. The domain names that you specify are used when you create a
--   deployment with a container configured as the public endpoint of your
--   container service.
--   
--   If you don't specify public domain names, then you can use the default
--   domain of the container service.
--   
--   You must create and validate an SSL/TLS certificate before you can use
--   public domain names with your container service. Use the
--   <tt>CreateCertificate</tt> action to create a certificate for the
--   public domain names you want to use with your container service.
--   
--   See <tt>CreateContainerService</tt> or <tt>UpdateContainerService</tt>
--   for information about how to specify public domain names for your
--   Lightsail container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containerServiceName:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_containerServiceName</a> - The name of the
--   container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:currentDeployment:ContainerService'</a>,
--   <a>containerService_currentDeployment</a> - An object that describes
--   the current container deployment of the container service.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ContainerService'</a>, <a>containerService_tags</a> - The
--   tag keys and optional values for the resource. For more information
--   about tags in Lightsail, see the <a>Amazon Lightsail Developer
--   Guide</a>.
newContainerService :: ContainerService

-- | Describes a container deployment configuration of an Amazon Lightsail
--   container service.
--   
--   A deployment specifies the settings, such as the ports and launch
--   command, of containers that are deployed to your container service.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContainerServiceDeployment</a> smart constructor.
data ContainerServiceDeployment
ContainerServiceDeployment' :: Maybe ContainerServiceDeploymentState -> Maybe ContainerServiceEndpoint -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe (HashMap Text Container) -> Maybe Int -> ContainerServiceDeployment

-- | Create a value of <a>ContainerServiceDeployment</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:state:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_state</a> - The state of the deployment.
--   
--   A deployment can be in one of the following states:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>Activating</tt> - The deployment is being created.</li>
--   <li><tt>Active</tt> - The deployment was successfully created, and
--   it's currently running on the container service. The container service
--   can have only one deployment in an active state at a time.</li>
--   <li><tt>Inactive</tt> - The deployment was previously successfully
--   created, but it is not currently running on the container
--   service.</li>
--   <li><tt>Failed</tt> - The deployment failed. Use the
--   <tt>GetContainerLog</tt> action to view the log events for the
--   containers in the deployment to try to determine the reason for the
--   failure.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:publicEndpoint:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_publicEndpoint</a> - An object that
--   describes the endpoint of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createdAt:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_createdAt</a> - The timestamp when the
--   deployment was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:containers:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_containers</a> - An object that
--   describes the configuration for the containers of the deployment.
--   
--   <a>$sel:version:ContainerServiceDeployment'</a>,
--   <a>containerServiceDeployment_version</a> - The version number of the
--   deployment.
newContainerServiceDeployment :: ContainerServiceDeployment
